135231212.content:
"Yeah...I guess you're right." you admit. There really wasn't anything to do. I mean, you could fit through the cave and explore it, but what fun would that be for Noah? He would end up just sitting out here, all alone, for however long it took to explore the cave. You laughed weakly as you imagined coming out of the cave an hour later only to be greeted by Noah's toes, stretching taller than you. Nah, he wouldn't grow that big...right?

Noah picked you up again and put you on his shoulder. "Hold on tight little big bro!"

You noticed he had attached a "little" on there. But why shouldn't he? He was now much larger than you. You were action figured size to him for crying out loud. The fact that he was still showing you any respect at all was a miracle. Your once little brother easily made his way down the incline and down the forest path, making it out of the woods in record time. A large tree had blocked his way at one point, only coming up to his chest. With a careless swat he had knocked it to the ground, crushing the trunk under his bare foot like it was nothing. You gulped a little. It was...kind of frightening. Your brother had a great deal of power in him now. Was there any guarantee he'd stay the same loving little brother who looked up to you? Was it possible to look up to someone when you're looking so far down at them?

These thoughts invaded your mind as your brother easily crossed the miles back to your home, getting many stares from the people around town. It was one thing to see a clothes twelve foot tall eleven year old. It was quite another to see a buck naked forty foot tall eleven year old. You sighed as you saw the stares. The news was going to get called in for sure. Noah was attracting way too much attention. It wasn't long before you reached your house. Noah laughed a little and said, "Wow...it's like a doll house now!"

He set you down and stood back up to his full height, looking down on the house. "Guess I can't go inside with you little big bro!"

You nodded and said, "I'm...going to go get something to drink. We still have the whole day to spend with each other! It's your birthday after all!"

Noah looked excited and replied, "Yeah! This is going to be great!"

You walked inside and collapsed on a chair in the kitchen. This was getting to be too much. You didn't have a lot of time. The news would be here to cover the sensational story as Noah became the biggest grower yet recorded. You got up and went to the sink, filing a glass with water. As you drank a humongous eyeball suddenly peered at you through the kitchen window. You spat the water you had been drinking out, your heart racing. "Hey...are you okay in there? You're taking a long time..."

It was just Noah. You opened the window and shouted, "Yeah, I'm fine! I'll be right out!" The massive eye disappeared and you quickly finished drinking the water, heading out the door. Noah scooped you up and put you on his shoulder again. "So, didja have anything planned for today besides the hike?"

You thought about it and said, "Well, we could always go for a swim at the lake." The lake was on the outskirts of town. It was big, private, and, if Noah sat down in it, he would be mostly out of sight. It would save them time from having to deal with the press. Noah instantly began heading toward the lake. "That sounds like fun! Let's go!"

He had only taken a few steps when he suddenly stopped again. You felt a cold sensation in the pit of your stomach. "Is...something wrong Noah?"
135231212.title: Hightail it back to Town.

1352312121.content:
"Yeah, well..." Noah stopped and looked down at you again, smirking. "Can't you tell?"

You shook your head. "No, what's up?"

He chuckled, brushing his hair out of his eyes. "I think I'm about to grow again."

Sure enough, as soon as he finished that sentence, he began to get bigger. At first, his head was just below the large tree that spread high above your house, but within seconds, he had passed it, until it only came up to his chin, when his growth spurt stopped. Noah was smiling broadly; you could tell Noah was enjoying being taller than anything in the neighborhood.

"Wow," Noah said, "this is pretty cool! How tall do you think I am now?"

"I'm not sure," you told him. "I'd guess around fifty feet. It's kinda hard to tell, what with you being taller than everything around you."

"Hee hee", Noah grinned. "You're right! I'm the tallest thing around now!" He lifted his arms and started to flex his muscles. Even though he was still the same proportions and build he was before, his arms and legs were still nearly twice as thick around as your entire body; he looked like he could uproot a tree if he wanted to.

The two of you continued to the lake. When you got there, you were pleased to see that it was currently deserted. You stripped down to your boxers, and started to walk in the lake, which had a somewhat steep drop-off so that you were quickly having to tread water to stay above the surface. Noah, already naked of course, followed behind you. He was barely ankle-deep at the point where you started to have to swim, and as you continued out towards the deep center of the lake, more and more of his legs became underwater until the two of you were at the deepest point of the lake, where the water only came up to his hips.

"Awesome!" Noah said. "The water only covers me halfway! I don't even need to swim!"

Noah reached down and started splashing the water. His hands, now wider across than you were tall, caused large waves to form, and their force pushed you several feet away from Noah. "Hey, cool, Noah," you said. "You can make your own wave pool!"

Noah laughed and continued to splash you for several minutes, until he became hot. He then started to sit down in the lake. Even sitting at the bottom of the lake, the water only covered him up to his chin, and you could still see his head sticking out above the lake. You swam around his head, amazed how it felt to be up so close to the face of a giant like him. Every blink of the eye or movement of the lips seemed so natural to him, yet it generated enough force that you could feel it. Curious as you were, you were careful to stay away from his mouth, just in case he got some mischievous ideas and tried to swallow you whole!

Suddenly, as you treaded water in front of his face, you felt the ground rush up underneath your feet. Within seconds, you were being pushed out of the water, though you quickly realized it wasn't the sandy bottom of the lake, but Noah's chest! He leaned back a little and started to float face-up in the lake. His chest, chin, toes, and knees stood out from the surface, while the rest of his body stayed hidden underneath the water. You decided to make the best of it and laid down on your back, in the crevice between his pecs. It was actually kinda relaxing. His skin was smooth and slippery due to the water, but still warm and surprisingly comforting. He began to breath deeply in and out, his chest rising and falling slightly with you on it. You imagined this must be how it felt like to be a baby, being held by its mother. After a moment, Noah slowly brought his hand out of the water and rested it on your body. It startled you for a moment, but you decided to let him do it.

"Does this bother you, little big bro?" Noah asked.

"No, not at all," you said, smiling. "In fact, it feels really nice."

The two of you shared a nice moment of silence, after which you sat up and turned around, looking at Noah's face. His eyes were closed, and he was smiling. You imagined he must be enjoying his birthday quite a bit.

"Hey, Noah," you said as he opened his eyes, "can I tell you something?"

"Sure," he said, lifting his head slightly out of the lake so he could get a better look at you.

"Well," you continued, "I gotta admit, when you first started growing the way you did a couple of years ago, I was pretty angry. I mean, by the time you were nine and a half, you were already bigger than me. I thought, 'I'm supposed to be the big brother, not this little freak.'"

Noah continued to look at you intently, as you continued. "But now, well, I know that I couldn't have been luckier. I mean, some of my friends have been tormented by their younger, bigger brothers, but you have always treated me with respect, even though you could easily beat me up, or now even squish me. I gotta say, you've earned being the bigger brother, and I am glad to call you that now."

Noah's eyes were starting to tear up, and he smiled, and said, "You'll always be my big brother, even if you're littler than me." He gently stroked your hair, and you leaned forward and gave him a hug, or at least as much as you could sitting on his chest.

After the two of you swam around a little more, Noah began to propel you both back towards the shore. As you got closer, and began to get out of the lake, you heard sirens in the distance. "That's odd," you said. "I've never seen any police or ambulance out here before." The sirens sounded like they were getting closer.

You look up at Noah, who by now was standing out of the lake and looking at the road ahead. His gaze had frozen, and you could tell by the way his facial expression was that trouble was coming.

Suddenly, a caravan of automobiles came careening around the curve and down the dirt road to the shore. Police cars, fire trucks, and lots and lots of press were heading straight for the lake, and you knew what they were there for. Within a few minutes, they had formed a circle blocking the escape from the shoreline, and policeman after policeman got out of the cars, unholstered their guns, and pointed it up at Noah. "Freeze!" yelled the officer that you guessed was the leader of the group. "You are under arrest! Don't try any sudden movements; we have you surrounded!"

Dumbfounded, you and Noah stood still. You saw behind the cops several TV reporters had set up in front of their cameramen, and within a few seconds, they had started a live report. You could hear the one closest to you: "I'm reporting to you live from Lake Tranquil, where one of these larger than normal giant boys has been cornered by the police. Reports coming in state that, though there are only a few dozen around the world who have experienced these extreme surges of growth in the past twenty-four hours, they are very dangerous and unpredictable, and so the local police have decided to take this one into custody for detention and experimentation."

You knew you didn't like the sound of that. Looking up at Noah, you saw that he looked terrified; this was all too much for him, no matter how big he was. You gave him a pinch on the ankle, and he looked down at you.

"Noah, don't be afraid!" you said. "We're not going to let them capture you!"

"B-but they have the exit blocked off, and there's like a thousand cops pointing guns at me. If I try anything, they'll shoot me!!"

"Noah, look at me!" you said, trembling but making sure you kept your cool so that Noah would too. "You're more powerful than all of them put together! The way I see it, you've got two choices. You can take them head on, or we can try escaping across the lake. Either way, we can move faster and out muscle anything they throw at us. I believe in you, Noah!"

With those words of encouragement, Noah's face changed from frightened to determined. You grabbed onto the top of his foot, as he got ready to make his move.
1352312121.title: Some growth, some fun, some tears, & some danger!

13523121212.content:
Noah may have been a massive tower of a boy but he wasn't bold enough to want to actually attack or hurt anyone. He slowly backed up and the police men cocked their guns, advancing on him. With a sudden movement, Noah kicked a wave of water at the policemen, soaking them and getting their guns wet. In the confusion this caused Noah turned and ran into the water, your tiny body suddenly surrounded by water. Noah's hand quickly snatched you up and held you close to his chest as he darted across the water, hitting dry land again in seconds and running as fast as he could. The ground shook under your massive little brother's feet, dirt getting flung up as he ran. Soon, all sights and sounds of the police and firemen and reporters was lost as Noah ran across the countryside.

"I-I need to hide! I don't want to be an experiment!" Noah said, his eyes starting to mist over again. He was really scared. He was only eleven after all. You had to keep it together for his sake. They couldn't take him in if they wanted to. He was too big, so he was probably safe...but who knew what they might do now? Would he be perceived as a greater threat now? Would they bring in bigger guys? You couldn't bear your little brother getting hurt. You snapped your fingers. Yes! That might work!

"Noah! Listen to me! Stop for a minute!" You shouted, cupping your hands around your mouth.

Noah stopped, breathing hard. You were pressed up against his chest and could hear his heart beating rapidly. You pressed your tiny hand against his chest and said, "Settle down! I have an idea!"

Noah nodded and closed his eyes, breathing deeply. After a few seconds he was calmer and he looked down at it. "What is it little big bro?"

"I have an idea! You alone can't do much right now against those army guys...but, if we gathered up some other boys your age we would have an easier time with it! They may not be as big as you, but there's safety in numbers! Who knows? You might still be growing! If we can be patient and careful, we'll definitely be able to get away!"

Noah's eyes sparkled a little and he said, "Do...you really think I might still grow?"

You laughed a little and said, "I don't see why not! You're already this huge! What's to stop you?"

Noah grinned and said, "That would be awesome! I'd teach those jerks a lesson then!"

You patted him on the chest and said, "Yeah! But right now we have to play it safe, okay? Now, who else do you know who started growing that we can trust?"

Noah thought about it for a second and said, "Umm...Well, I know Troy did! He's in my class. Remember him? Short brown hair, a little taller than me?"

You thought back to when you last visited Noah when he was in class and a face suddenly swam up from your memories. Yeah! Troy! He had an older brother in your class. His brother had always been kind of a bully to him and had fully expected to be bullied right back when his younger brother suddenly towered over him. But, surprisingly, Troy had kept his shy, quiet personality. He had always loved to read and he still did so, though the books were harder to manage in his large hands. His brother, Blaine, had changed his ways a little seeing his brother turning the other cheek. Troy was truly a very nice boy and someone they could definitely trust. You smiled up at Noah and said, "Let's go get him! Do you know where he lives?"

Noah nodded and said, "Definitely! It's not too far from here actually!"

Noah eagerly changed direction and began moving towards a cluster of houses nearby. He carefully stepped up to the right house and pointed at it. "He lives in here!"

"Okay, set me down and I'll get him!" you said.

Noah let you down and you knocked on the door. Blaine answered it, a haggard look on his face. "What do you want?" He purposefully ignored Noah.

"Hey! Where's Troy? We need to talk to him!"

Blaine snorted and said, "He's not in here! He can't even FIT in here anymore! He had to move out to the woods to avoid press and shit. You can go look for him if you want."

With that, he slammed the door in your face. You didn't care. You grinned up at Noah and shouted, "Hear that? He can't fit in his house! He'll definitely be able to help us!"

Noah picked up happily and said, "Well what are we waiting for? Let's go look for him!"

Noah headed into the woods, the trees even smaller now to him. With a slight brush of his hand he could level a towering oak, his feet smashing apart branches and logs like nothing, grinding them into mulch. Noah, who at point in his life would have to scramble over these same logs, was now ignoring them completely, their presence not even registering to him. You both looked around the woods for awhile, but you couldn't find Troy. Where could he be? Noah had been calling out his name too, his powerful lungs allowing his voice to carry for miles. Still, nothing. These woods were rather huge...but why would Troy be hiding himself so much?

"Where do you think he is?" Noah asked sadly, losing heart again. "You don't think...they got him do you?"

Before you could answer, you felt the ground shake slightly. What was that? You looked around and saw Troy! Finally! But...wait, how big was he?
13523121212.title: Gathering the Forces

choices: "...that we need to find as many as we can and form an army"
"...that we're in this on our own."
135231212121.content:
“Noah? Is that you?” you heard Troy’s voice coming from a large cluster of trees about a hundred yards away. A hand shot out and bent the trees to the side, and you saw a tall, lanky boy with short brown hair and wearing only a loincloth around his waist, step out into the open.

“Troy!” Noah yelled excitedly. “Over here!”

As Troy walked over, you saw that he, too had increased in size substantially since the last time you had seen him, but when he got close, you could see that he was no match for Noah, only coming up to his waist. You could see that Troy was impressed and a little intimidated by Noah towering over him as he walked around his legs.

“Boy, look at you?” Troy said. “I thought I was the biggest boy in town. Guess I was wrong.”

Noah laughed. “Well, all this happened today, it’s all kinda sudden. How about you? When did you grow?”

Troy nodded shyly, “Same here. I was around twelve or thirteen feet tall until this morning, when I started growing fast. My brother started freaking out, and was about to call the police. That’s why I came out here; I didn’t want anyone to find out.”

“I don’t think we’re gonna be able to avoid that now,” you said. “We were just at the lake, and a whole bunch of police and press showed up. We barely escaped.”

“Yeah,” Noah said, “that’s why we came to find you! We need you to help us fight them back!”

“Fight?” Troy said with a quizzical look on his face. “C’mon, Noah, we can’t do that. It’d be us versus a million! There’s no way it would work.”

“It’s worth a shot!” he said. “There’s gotta be more of us out there that can team together.”

“Well, I dunno...” Troy said, as he turned around, looking off into the distance. As he was thinking, you suddenly saw that both boys were beginning to grow again. What’s more, they seemed to be growing at the exact same time! You were standing next to Noah’s feet, and without him moving, they began to push against you, forcing you to step backwards.

After a few seconds, they had finished growing. The two boys were still at the same proportion to each other (Troy was still half the height of Noah), but now Troy was about forty feet tall, and Noah was already eighty feet tall! It was coming to the point where Noah’s head was beginning to stick out from the top of the trees. He bent down on his knees so that he could see you better.

“Whoa that was cool,” Noah said. “We grew at the same time!”

“Yeah, and at the same rate, proportional to each other,” you said, musing. “I wonder if that means that there are other boys who are growing at the same time elsewhere.”

“Well, they can’t be growing like we are,” Noah said, thinking, “otherwise we would have seen them when we were in town.”

Suddenly your eyes lit up. “I think one of the news reporters back at the lake said that there were only a few dozen around the world.” You paced around the feet of the two giants as you reasoned aloud. “And I saw a news report about a boy who had grown a lot today, but he was all the way over in India.”

“Well that's great," Troy said sarcastically, throwing his hands up in the air. "We'll just hop on the next plain to India and get him to help us. Is that what you're saying?”

“I’m saying,” you continued as you turned back around to face Noah and Troy...
135231212121.title: The Plan

choices: Both boys continue to grow as you try to escape
The government is getting involved...and they have a secret weapon!
1352312121212.content:
"...that we're in this on our own."

Troy sighed and said, "I thought as much."

"Don't lose heart Troy!" you said. "We're in this alone, but we can still do this! As long as we stick together we can survive! Besides, we don't have any idea how big you guys are going to end up!"

"Oh no! You're right! We won't be able to hide if we get too big!" Troy said, looking scared.

Noah laughed and said, "Yeah, but the bigger we get, the easier it'll be to take these guys down!"

Troy looked dubious but you grinned and said, "That's the right way to think about it Noah! I say, for now, we travel around and see what we can find. There's a good chance that the rest of the growing boys are in different countries but we might find another one in the U.S.A. We can't give up!"

Troy smiled a little and said, "Maybe you're right..."

Noah picked you up and said, "Alright then! Let's go!"

The two titanic boys began to move through the forest, staying hidden. There was a good chance that the police had sent out a report of some kind on Noah and Troy so you had to be extra careful. No place would ever be truly safe. Your best bet was to make it as far away as possible. Luckily, both boys were around the same size so they moved at about the same speed. You knew this forest spread out for a few miles so you should be able to cover a good bit of ground without worrying about being seen. Unfortunately, Noah was getting too big to go unnoticed. Every time his hand struck a tree, or his leg, foot, or his elbows, or really any part of his body hit a tree, it toppled, creating a loud ruckus. Noah couldn't even help himself. It would take far too long to move if he was careful to weave between the trees.

It took about ten or so minutes to reach the end of the forest. They were at the highway now. You looked up from your position on Noah's shoulder and said, "Noah! Follow the highway to the right! That should take us to the Interstate and put us on the fast track out of this state!"

Noah nodded and said, "Come on Troy!"

"Right behind you!"

Cars screeched and crashed all along the highway as the massive, naked eleven year olds ran down the highway. You couldn't be bothered about it. It was time to sprint, to get away.
1352312121212.title: On the Lam

choices: Follow the President & Generals to the Pentagon
13523121212122.content:
"...We've have reported sightings here in the suburbs, here at Lake Tranquil, and most recently, here alongside the highway next to Zodiac National Forest."

President Andrews was meeting with his cabinet, having been called in to the Situation Room for immediate assistance for this troubling development. The President was getting tired of dealing with this issue. It had started just a month into his first term - boys all across the country and across the world, growing abnormally, sprouting up like weeds. Even his own seven-year-old son, Tyson, was experiencing the spurt, and he had to have the White House fitted with extra-big bedrooms, bathrooms, and living spaces. The whole mess definitely made him think twice about running for a second term.

"And at the rate they're going," General Shepherd continued, "they could be near Washington within seventy-two hours. Of course, the unpredictable variable there is how big they end up growing, or if they even continue to grow at all."

The President muttered silently under his breath, taking off his glasses, and rubbing his eyes. Putting them back on, he asked, "Well, how big is he now?'

Shepherd filed through his paperwork, searching. "The last reported sighting had him at eighty feet tall, and he's traveling with two other boys, one his age and forty feet tall, and one older, we assume his sixteen-year-old brother, who is, uh, 'normal' height."

"So wait," the President said, leaning forward, "are you telling me we're dealing with two giants teaming up here?"

"Precisely, sir."

"Terrific." He leaned back in his chair, looking around the room. All of his advisors stared at him, hesitant to say anything. "Well, what do we think?"

The Secretary of State chimed in. "Sir, we're getting reports from several of our allies that are experiencing similar situations. India, Japan, England, France, and Canada all reported at least one boy having an extreme growth spurt in the past twenty-four hours."

"Yeah?" the President asked. "And what are they doing about it?"

"Sir, they're in the same state as us," the Secretary replied, "They haven't got a clue."

"Of course they haven't," the President stood up and began pacing around the room. "And is this the only two we've gotten reports of here?"

Admiral Shepherd shook his head, "No, sir. We've gotten reports of at least two others in this country, though neither of them are a threat to Washington, yet. One is out in California, the other is in Texas."

"Well, you know what they say," the President said softly, facing away from the group, "Everything's bigger in Texas..."

"What was that, sir?" the Secretary of State asked.

"Nevermind," he said as he whirled back around. "Listen, I want to hear options, solutions. Nothing is too crazy or out of question to be brought up. God knows that this whole blasted situation is crazy enough already."

At this point, the Secretary of Defense stood up. Secretary Grayson was an older, large man, a decorated war hero and former four-star general who had enormous power of presence. He was the only person in the Cabinet who wasn't intimidated by the President; in fact, the President was a little intimidated of him!

"Mr. President," Secretary Grayson said. "the way I see it, there are only two options. One of them, of course, is the Nuclear option."

"Secretary Grayson," the President interrupted.

"General Grayson, sir."

"Fine, General Grayson," the President continued, only slightly flustered, "you know I can't do that! I campaigned hard on a promise to eradicate our nuclear weapons program. I won't go down in history as the first President since Truman to actually use a nuke in combat!"

"Fine, sir," Grayson dryly continued, "you're the boss. But the only other option is one that I don't think you'll like."

"What is it?" the President asked.

Grayson and Shepherd exchanged knowing glances. Nodding, Shepherd turned towards the President. "Sir, we have been working on a...let's just say top-secret weapons program, specifically designed to counter the threat we're facing today."

"A top-secret weapons program?" President Andrews asked, his brow wrinkled up. "Why wasn't I made aware of it?"

"Sir, we thought it best to alleviate you of any potential liability should something go wrong," Shepherd continued. "But now, I think you need to know."

"Well, what is it?"

"It's something you're going to have to see for yourself," Grayson remarked coldly. He pressed a button on the phone at the center of the table, and said, "Phillips, it's Grayson. Get Marine One ready for takeoff. We'll be leaving in five minutes."

"Roger, sir," the voice on the other end of the intercom said. Grayson began walking towards the door, along with Shepherd.

"Leaving," President Andrews asked. "Where are we going?"

Grayson turned around and said, "To the Pentagon, sir. You need to meet Project Behemoth face-to-face."

"Face-to-face?" President Andrews said to himself. He didn't like the sound of that. Shaking his head, he followed Grayson out the door and headed towards the South Lawn. Whatever was in store for him at the Pentagon, he knew he wasn't going to like it.
13523121212122.title: The government is getting involved...and they h...

choices: Meanwhile, in another part of the world...
Noah and the others rest for awhile
135231212121221.content:
The President made his way across the South Lawn, Marine One prepared for take off. Grayson stepped aside to allow the President to climb up into the helicopter first before climbing in after him. Once they were both strapped in, Grayson nodded and the air craft took off, slowly rising into the air. The President stared icily at the General who was looking fixedly out the window. After about a minute or so had passed the President got fed up and shouted, "Well? Are you going to tell me what this thing is?"

Grayson slowly turned to face the slightly hysterical President and said, "It's exactly what it sounds like sir. Project Behemoth was put into effect as soon as the effects of the radiation was discovered. When the boys started growing, which I might add is physically impossible for a human body to reach sizes like this, we knew we needed to have something to counter any threat that might occur."

"Wait a minute. If this growth is impossible for a human body, why is it happening?" The President asked.

"Well sir, we believe that the radiation wasn't a random event that developed naturally in space. It was too isolated, too...coincidental to be a random event." Shepard said, taking over for a moment.

"What are you saying Admiral?" Andrews asked, "Are you saying that someone on this planet created this radiation somehow and then just...made a belt for the planet to pass through? Do you know how RIDICULOUS that sounds?"

"With all due respect sir, we weren't the first country to discover this radiation. It's entirely possible that one of our allies, or some other country, could have been working in secret on some kind of new weapon that got out of hand. We also can't deny the possibility of...so called extra terrestrial interference."

The President shook his head and said, "Wonderful. Now we're talking about aliens."

"The cause of the radiation is NOT the source of our problems right now." Grayson snapped. "The point is, Project Behemoth was created from one of the affected. A boy who lived on the streets, a mean kid who had had about the hardest life you can imagine. When he started growing he took full advantage of his size, beating people, robbing stores for food and cash, mugging people, the works. He's not afraid of getting his hands dirty. He was the perfect subject. We took him in and offered him work. If he agreed to help us we'd pay for food, clothing, water, facilities, shelter, the works. In addition, he'd get to fight, when the time came. He has violent tendencies and we've had to keep him busy. We've...lost a few men against him."

The President looked horrified. "This is by far the most reckless thing I've heard of in my years in the Presidency. How tall is this boy?"

The General and the Admiral exchanged a look and Shepard said, "Sir, the boy has been growing faster than any other boy on record. He's already about one hundred and forty feet tall."

The President closed his eyes and massaged his temples. He was at a loss for words. "And this boy will do what we say?"

The General held up a remote and said, "This remote is connected to a shock collar. We've got it tied around his neck, made with a special metal that expands with his body. So far its held. All we need to do, is get these giants under control and then...well, we'll take him down."

The President nodded and said, "Very well...I have no other options. My hands are tied. Let's meet this kid."

No one talked for the rest of the trip, the helicopter landing at the Pentagon shortly thereafter. The three men walked into the building, heading for the elevator. As soon as the doors closed, Grayson pushed a key card into a slot underneath the buttons. Instantly, a light went on below the basement buttons. Grayson pressed his thumb against it and the elevator instantly started moving down. After a few minutes went by, the doors opened again, revealing a sprawling underground warehouse like structure. People were running left and right, each one having their own task to complete. A large crowd was gathered around a huge glass window. The three men walked over to this window and the President got his first look at Project Behemoth. He was a towering boy, looking to be around twelve or thirteen years old, his body more muscular than an average boy his age. He had been taken good care of, his body built to be a fighting machine. His hair, which had once been long and ragged, was now buzzed short, dark black. A gleaming metal collar was wrapped around his neck. His expression was harsh and petulant, his eyes dark and cold. He had seen and done things in his life, horrible things...and judging by his posture and expression, he knew it...and he didn't care. The President shuddered. He didn't fancy the chances of anyone or anything standing up to that monster.

"Where are the giants currently?" he asked, turning to Grayson.

Shepard answered. "They were last spotted on the move in the West sir. We're not sure their exact location, but we're preparing to deploy Project Behemoth to the area. There...will probably be casualties.

The President nodded, his expression grim. "For the greater good, we'll have to proceed."
135231212121221.title: Mysteries on top of Mysteries

choices: Noah and Troy begin to act strangely.
Everything continues on as normal... For now...
1352312121212211.content:
A shadowy figure wrapped in a brown parka trudged across the snowy landscape, carrying a small brown envelope. If you followed its footsteps back half a mile, you would see that they led from a snowmobile, which had stopped working. "Bloody Russian engineering," the man thought to himself as he continued through the snow, which was falling at a brisk pace.  

He was heading towards a shack, which couldn't have been more than ten feet by twenty. Silently, he hoped that it wad the right shack, but then again, how could it not be? He was out in the middle of Siberia, and this was the only shack for miles in any direction. His handheld gps unit matched the coordinates written down on the envelope, so if this wasn't the right spot, it sure wasn't his fault. 

Breathing heavily, the man stepped onto the small porch of the shack and knocked on the door. He banged several times before it opened with a creak, and he stumbled in. 

He removed his parka and looked around. The inside of the shack was just as sparse as the outside, except for a large machine that covered the far wall. At least it was warm, the man thought, as he removed the hood of his parka from covering his head. 

The man was in his forties, short dark hair with a mustache, just beginning to  turn gray. He wore thin-framed glasses. Beneath his parka, his uniform bore the insignia of Her Majesty's Royal Air Force, though he didn't want to bring attention to that now.  

As his eyes adjusted from the bright brilliance of the snowy landscape to the dark interior of the shack, he could make out a man standing in front of him. This man was over six feet tall and looked like he could bench press a tree. It was hard to make out his age, since he looked at once like a young adult and an old man. He was completely shaven bald, and wore an inappropriately thin-for-the-weather tight green shirt which accentuated his muscles even more. 

The guest had heard about how intimidating his host was-- he must be, he thought, to maintain control over a shadow organization like this one-- but nothing prepared him for actually meeting him. His teeth chattered, from the cold, he pretended, and not from his nervousness, as he began to talk.
 
"Privyet, ti--" he said, before he was interrupted by the large man. 

"Spare me your bad Russian, Lieutenant," the man said. His voice had a thick Russian accent but he spoke surprisingly good English. "Just tell me: do you have it?"

The British man gulped, and nodded, handing over the package. "Here it is, Novikov" he said, "but I don't think you'll like it."

"I'll be the judge of that," Novikov said, as he ripped it open. Inside was a disc, some sort of fancy, high-security CD or DVD, which he inserted into a slot in the machine at the far end. Turning on the monitor, he quickly perused the data, staring intently at the screen in front of him. 

The British man was nervous; he knew what the data said but he didn't know what Novikov was going to want to do with this information. The past two years of being involved with this underground operation, using his rank in the Armed Forces to gain access to sensitive information, then smuggling it out to various operatives, it had all taken its toll on him psychologically. Fixing the world's problems like this made sense on paper, but now he wasn't so sure of his organization's motives  He was considering leaving the group, making a run for it and fleeing to America, when the news arrived of the mega growth finally kicking in. It seemed the plan was getting even closer to completion, now... If he even knew what the plan was anymore. 

After a few moments, Novikov stood up and let out a loud, hearty laugh. "This is fantastic!" he said. "Not only have all twenty subjects been responding to the growth commands we have been sending out, but the governments already consider them a threat!  We may be closer to Judgement Day than I even imagined."

"But," the Lieutenant said, "didn't you see the part about the Americans manipulating and growing a subject themselves? That's going to cause everything to go to bollocks, isn't it?"

Novikov just smiled, a cold, menacing smile. "That is inconsequential," he said. "They only have one versus our twenty, and their method of controlling him is... primitive, to say the least. They don't have the ability to simultaneously direct multiple subjects at once, like we do. No matter," he said, as he stood triumphantly in front of the machine. "We have our advantage now, and now is the time to use it!"

The British man gulped. He knew by the sound in Novikov's voice that he meant business, and was going to act now. He just hoped that he didn't live to regret what he had helped bring about.
1352312121212211.title: Behind it all...

choices: Troy wants to talk to you about Noah
13523121212122112.content:
"Noah...hey Noah!" you shouted from your position on his shoulder.

Noah snapped to attention and looked down at you. "W-what is it?"

You smiled ruefully and said, "You shouldn't be spacing out at a time like this. I think we should stop for tonight. Troy's getting tired and it's getting dark out."

Noah looked up and saw the sun was almost set, stars visible in the sky. Behind him, Troy was sweaty and out of breath. He had to run twice as fast to keep up with Noah and it was taking its toll on him. Noah looked around and saw an abandoned barn in the distance. He pointed it out and said, "Let's go over there! We can hide inside!"

Troy nodded and you all made your way to the barn. It only took a few minutes to reach it, but you noticed a rather pressing problem. Noah was twice the barn's height. He shrugged and pushed open the door anyway. He got down on his hands and knees and crawled inside. He went to the back of the structure and wedged himself inside. He had to be bent slightly and he looked a little uncomfortable, but it hid him from sight which was a big plus. Troy crawled in after him and was able to sit comfortably inside. He pulled the doors closed and a tiny bar fell down, locking the door. You felt your head bump into something hanging from the ceiling and touched it. You found a small knob on one side of it and turned it. A dim light suddenly appeared in the darkness. It appeared that you had stumbled on an old fashioned gas lamp. You had no idea why it was up here but you weren't about to complain. You turned the knob further and the light brightened, filling the barn with a dim glow. You sighed and looked down at Troy who was still breathing heavily.

"You okay Troy?" you asked.

Troy shook his head and said, "I'm a giant freak on the run from the police! I've never ran so much for so long! Of course I'm not okay!" Tears started forming in his eyes and his body was shaking. Noah scooted closer to him and held him in his arms, his hand gently holding the back of his friend's head, leaning him against the shoulder you weren't on. Troy started sobbing, wrapping his arms around Noah, their warm bodies pressed together. You leaned over and patted Troy on the shoulder, trying to comfort him in any small way you could. It could be easy to forget, thanks to their massive sizes, but these were still just little kids. Troy wasn't as brave or confident as Noah and it showed in moments like these. Noah held Troy for a few minutes, until the tears stopped flowing. When he was done crying Troy leaned back and rubbed his eyes, smiling up at Noah. "Thanks...I needed that."

He scooted away, a slight blush on his cheeks. It seemed he had just remembered that both Noah and he was naked. Noah smiled and said, "So what now big bro?"

You sighed and said, "Now, we get some rest. We probably should stay awake in shifts in case anything tries to mess with us."

Noah nodded and said, "I'll take the first watch. You two try to get some sleep."

"Okay, but I'll go after you and then Troy." you said. "You can handle that right Troy?"

Troy nodded and said, "Don't worry. I can do it."

Noah smiled down at you and said, "Alright then, get to sleep big bro. You can count on me!"

You smiled up at him and nodded. He picked you up in his hand and put you down near Troy. Troy grabbed you in his hand and held you close. "I'll keep you safe while Noah watches." he whispered to you

You gave a whispered thanks in response and closed your eyes, trying to get some sleep.
13523121212122112.title: Rest for the Night

choices: An hour later, you see headlights turn off of the road, right towards the barn!
The rest of the night is peaceful, and you wake up the next morning refreshed.
135231212121221121.content:
Sleeping on a pile of hay wasn't all that uncomfortable, and you quickly dozed off. Of course, it helped to be lying next to Troy's large, warm thigh and being covered like a blanket by his hand. As you slept, you dreamt of a huge battle between a large group of humongous boys like Noah and Troy. It seemed like a battle from medieval times, like you would see in the movies, but the giant boys didn't have any weapons. Instead, they punched, kicked, clawed, and bit until they were able to take down their opponents. It was a bloody battle, and you had a slightly disturbed feeling when you awoke.

You were woken up by Noah's hand jostling you back and forth. You figured Noah was trying to be as gentle as he could, but it actually shook you up quite a bit, and you were very disoriented. "Little big bro," he whispered as he shook you, "wake up!"

You sat up, then jumped to your feet. "What's wrong?" you asked. "Is something the matter?"

Noah shook his head. "No, nothing like that," he said. "It's just that--" he was interrupted by a large yawn coming from his lips, which he covered his mouth for and tried to keep as silent as possible, so as not to wake up the sleeping Troy next to you. "Well," he continued, "as you can see, I'm getting pretty tired, and I can't really keep my eyes open, so..."

"Say no more," you say, smiling. "I'll go ahead and start the next shift."

"Thanks," Noah said, as he lifted you up to the loft. You wiped the sleep from your eyes and worked your way up to the window, where you could look out and see the highway in the distance. Noah lay down on the ground, curling up into a ball next to Troy, and covered his eyes with his arm. "Good night, little big bro!" he said, his voice trailing off into sleep.

You smiled down at him. No matter how big he got, he still was your brother, and he still acted like the kid that he was. Turning back towards the window, you prepared yourself for a few hours of hopefully nothing.

After about fifteen minutes or so, you heard rustling down from the floor of the barn. Looking down, you saw that Troy was sitting up, his eyes wide open, staring at you. You looked right back at him, not saying a word for a few seconds, until finally he broke the ice. "Hey..." was all that he said.

"Hey, yourself," you said in a friendly tone. "You know, you really should be sleeping. I'm not gonna be able to last the rest of the night, and we'll need another lookout in a couple of hours."

"I know," he said, as he leaned closer, so that his face was right next to your body. "I just-- I'm having trouble sleeping."

You nodded and turned towards him, positioning yourself so that you could look at him and still keep one eye out the window. "Something on your mind?" you asked.

"No," he said, trying to dodge the question. "Well, yes. It's-- it's about Noah."

"What about him?" you asked, slightly surprised.

"I-- I don't know." he said, blushing. "I really can't explain everything I'm thinking and feeling right now."

"Just say what comes to your mind, Troy," you said.

"Okay," he thought for a moment. "I guess you know that I've known him for a while now, right?"

"Yeah," you said, not quite sure where this was going.

"Well, we used to be pretty close friends. But then the whole growing thing started two years ago or whenever, and he suddenly began to be a lot more interested in sports and outdoors, and stuff, and I was still interested in books and reading. We just drifted apart. I guess friends do that."

You nodded, thinking back on your best friend from when you were that young, Chad. You remembered that you were always over at his house or the other way around, seemingly every week, up until when you turned ten. Then he went out for football, and you didn't, and every free moment of his started being about practice and working out and getting ready for the game. It wasn't anything bad, you thought, it's just what happened. "You're right, Troy," you said after musing, "it happens with everybody."

Troy continued, "Right, and I had come to accept that. But now he's back, and we're off on some sort of adventure or whatever, and -- I guess it feels like we're becoming friends again. And, I'm beginning to have feelings towards him, of friendship, or something different, I guess, I'm not really sure. But I can't help asking myself, 'Is it only because we're both bigger than all the other boys?' 'Will this go away too?' I don't want to put myself into this if I'm just gonna be left alone again when Noah finds another friend who's bigger and better."

Wow, you thought. This kid was kinda deep for an eleven year old. You began to realize a little bit about why Troy thought the way he did. You decided you needed to say something comforting, even if you weren't necessarily sure of it yourself. "Don't worry, Troy," you say, trying your best to sport a comforting look on your face. "Noah really is a good kid at heart. I'm sure that, as long as you put some effort in to try to keep the friendship going, he'll respond in kind."

Troy sighed, "I guess. I just with I could know if he felt like I did."

You let a moment of silence pass, allowing Troy time to think. Finally, you said, "Tell you what, Troy. Tomorrow morning, when we're back on the road, try talking to Noah about it. Let him know how you feel. I know the worst decisions I've made as far as friendships and relationships go is when I kept something to myself, hoping that by ignoring it the issue would go away. If you're open with how you feel, then you'll always win out, in the end."

Troy smiled, at least half-heartedly. "I guess that's a start," he said.

You smiled back. "Now, why don't you get back to sleep. I'll wake you in a couple of hours for your shift, and then everything will be better in the morning."

Troy nodded and lay back down, his hands folded together behind his head. Within a few minutes, he had closed his eyes, and begun to snore slightly. You turned back towards the window, hoping that the advice you gave was sound, and hoping that the rest of the night would pass smoothly.
135231212121221121.title: Troy's feelings

choices: The sun rises on a new day...a mysterious plan is put into action
You fall off Noah's shoulder and the two giants run off without you!
1352312121212211211.content:
After talking with Troy, you focused your efforts to watching. You were tempted a few times to lay your head down on the windowsill to rest but didn't trust yourself. If you did that there was a good chance you'd fall asleep. You were really the best equipped to take the longer shifts at night. Troy and Noah both had to run during most of the day, while you rode on Noah. If nothing else, you could sleep during the day. That being said, you were also the main decision maker, being the oldest and all. Still, you weren't going to let your brother or his friend down, especially after he opened up to you so willingly. The barn you were currently staying in was out in the country, way off the main roads so you figured you'd be safer out here than anywhere. You weren't expecting anyone to be out here.

That's why you were so surprised when a pair of headlights suddenly turned the corner and headed straight for the barn.

Your eyes widened as you saw this but you waited a few minutes to absolutely sure. It was entirely possible that the car was only passing by and wouldn't stop here. You didn't want to wake the boys up and start a ruckus for nothing. Unfortunately, it became increasingly obvious a vehicle was heading your way. You had turned out the oil lamp luckily so to all who passed it would appear to be nothing but an abandoned barn. You couldn't tell from this angle what kind of vehicle it was, or how many people were getting out, but it didn't matter. You needed to wake the boys up, to be ready for anything. You jumped down from the loft and landed on Noah's chest. You ran over to his face and started hitting his face lightly, whispering his name.

"Noah! Hey! Noah! Wake up!"

Noah stirred and moaned a little, rubbing his eyes. "Whazzamatter?"

"Someone's coming! Come on, wake up!"

This got Noah's attention. His eyes snapped open and he quickly sat up, knocking his head into the ceiling. He grabbed his head and grit his teeth, holding back a shout of pain. He had sat up so fast you had gotten flung over onto Troy. He picked you up and shook Troy awake. His eyes filled with dread as they focused on Noah. "Is something wrong?"

"Someone's coming!"

Troy nodded and sat up, holding his legs, trembling slightly. Everyone was deathly quiet, listening. No matter how you strained your ears, however, you couldn't hear anything. Time slowly passed, and nothing happened. Then, the doors to the barn shook a bit, followed by a male voice cursing loudly. "It's locked."

Another voice answered, indistinctly, then the doors rattled again. Silence...then the sounds of someone beating on the door with a blunt instrument of some kind, the old wood cracking and splintering. Someone was trying to force their way in! Without thinking, Troy suddenly pushed his foot out with full force, the door bursting open. You heard a yell of pain and surprise, followed by the sound of two bodies hitting the ground. Time to go!

"Run Troy! Run!" you shouted, urging him to leave. Troy quickly crawled out, while Noah just stood up, bursting out of the building, the barn collapsing around them. Troy looked around and you shouted, "Left! Left!"

Troy instantly ran in that direction, Noah right behind him. You heard the sickening crunch of twisting metal as Noah's huge foot landed on top of the vehicle that had come here. You had no idea if it had been police or just some random people trying to get into the barn for whatever reason, but you couldn't stay here now. They would report this to the police and they'd be on your trail in no time. You needed to make tracks and get as far away as possible. Troy blindly ran down the road and Noah followed him, you standing on his shoulder and hanging on to his ear lobe to steady yourself. It was hard to see in the darkness but you were pretty sure they were headed in the right direction. You had no permanent destination in mind but you knew you needed to keep moving until you could figure out a better plan than "avoid detection by the police".

You looked at your glow in the dark watch and saw it was 2:00 in the morning. No one had gotten much sleep but you had to press onward.
1352312121212211211.title: Panic in the Night

choices: Noah and Troy both receive the signal, but try to fight it off
Troy receives the signal but Noah does not.
13523121212122112111.content:
Large, thick fingers type a command into a keyboard: EXECUTE PROTOCOL 24. Return

The small green and black screen, a relic from the '80s, flashes back: PROTOCOL 24 ARMED. PLEASE CONFIRM.

"What are you think?" Novikov asked his British guest. "Are you ready for history to change again?"

The Lieutenant gulped. "Sir, if I may ask..."

"What is it, comrade?" Novikov swiveled around in his wooden chair and faced the British man, who was pacing on the opposite side of the room.

"What is the ultimate purpose of all this?" The man was so nervous, that he had to wipe the sweat from his brow, despite the temperatures in the shack being freezing. "I mean, I know the Plan was designed to control these giant children in order to take down the various local governments and unify the globe, but it seems like our plan has changed from a peaceful one to one of war and violence. That may just be my opinion," he added at the end.

Novikov looked at the Brit sternly, as the man's breathing seemed to become faster as he grew more scared. Finally, Novikov laughed out loud, standing up to his full, impressive height.

"Of course there's going to be war and violence, comrade!" he said, slapping the other man on the shoulder. "How else do you better the world but through strife? Millions may day, but it's for the greater good, don't you see?"

The British man's face changed of one of fear to one of outright horror. "Millions?" he asked, shocked. "I--I can't be a part of millions dying! That's not what I signed up for."

Novikov's smile dropped slightly, and he turned back around and typed something else into the keyboard. "Are you sure of that?"

The Brit started walking towards the door. "I'm sorry, but this has all gone farther than I am comfortable with. I won't get in your way, but I cannot stay here and just watch you start a -- a genocide!"

Novikiov nodded his head. "Well, if that's the way you feel, then fine."

The British man opened the door to the outside. "You were right about one thing, though, comrade," Novikov called after him, causing the British man to turn back around for a moment.

"What is that?" he asked.

Novikov furrowed his brow, and a look of anger filled his face. "You won't get in my way," he said, sternly. Quick as a flash, he pulled a pistol hidden on his belt behind him and lifted it up, firing a single shot straight into the British man's forehead before he even had time to react. The last thing that passed through the British man's head, before the bullet anyways, was "What have I done?" He then collapsed in a heap face forward on the floor.

Novikov sat the gun on the table next to the keyboard, slowly walked over to the now lifeless body, lifted it up and threw it outside, next to the porch. It quickly got covered up by the snowstorm. He then walked back inside, shut the door, and went back into the computer. On the screen were the words he had typed: CONFIRM PROTOCOL EXECUTION. With a firm but quick stroke, he hit the enter button.

From that shack, satellite signals instantly relayed the order into the air, where it was picked up then broadcast to the subjects around the world. All at once, each of the twenty or so boys who had been experiencing extraordinary growth over the past forty-eight hours received and began following the instructions that had been broadcast into their conscience, and those instructions, in a dozen different languages, were simply this:

Start Takeover of Government.
13523121212122112111.title: The sun rises on a new day...a mysterious plan ...

choices: Troy grows bigger than Noah and breaks free
Project Behemoth is one of the affected. He turns on his "masters".
135231212121221121112.content:
Troy, Noah, and you had been walking peacefully down the road (well...within wooded areas, the road in sight) for once out of the sight of any authority figures and able to relax when Troy suddenly stopped moving. Noah walked a few more steps before he noticed that Troy wasn't moving. He stopped and looked back, seeing Troy standing in place, staring into space. Noah walked over to him and put his hand on his shoulder. "Troy? Are you okay? Is something wrong?"

Troy stared blankly at Noah. Somewhere, deep in the fuzzy recesses of his mind, he realized that Noah was a friend, someone who he had relied on for a long time, who he had planned to continue to rely on as a source of support, but these memories and feelings were being buried under a powerful impulse: Start Takeover of Government. He shook his head, the thought lodging in his mind like an annoying insect, buzzing and compelling him. The thought repeated over and over again in his mind. Intertwining with those thoughts was another one, one that made Troy want to obey: Start Takeover of Government...and these thoughts and feelings...will go away...Upon completion of your directive...it will go away. Troy suddenly jerked backward and started jogging away from Noah and you.

"Hey! Hey Troy! Where are you going?" Noah chased after Troy and held him back, the smaller boy easily held back, but struggling wildly. You grabbed onto Noah's hair for dear life and tried to keep from getting yourself tossed off of his shoulder. Troy continued to struggle wildly, though fruitlessly thanks to his smaller body. Eventually, Noah had his friend pinned to the ground. Troy moaned and grabbed his head, jerking back and forth. Noah tried to hold him still and question him but it was to no avail. Troy just refused to held still.

"Little big bro...what's going on? Why is he acting like this?" Noah asked, fear in his voice.

You shook your head. "I don't know! I've never seen anything like this!" You were lying slightly. You had indeed seen things like this. It looked like he was having a fit or a seizure of something. You weren't familiar with Troy's medical history but you had the feeling that, close as Noah and him are, your brother would have mentioned something like this. With that line of thought it made you think that perhaps this was something recent. Could if be a connection with his growth? No, that couldn't be...Noah would be acting the same if that were the case. Then what? You leaned over and shouted, "Troy! Try to clear your mind! You can trust me! Tell me what's going on!"

Troy stopped thrashing, his chest rising and falling with his rapid breathing, his eyes flickering back and forth. Deep in his mind he remembered the heart to heart conversation you had had with him. He was holding back on the impulses in his head to listen to you. He was only hearing every other world. "Tell...what's....on!" was all he heard. Luckily, he managed to piece it together. He opened his mouth and said, "Government...take....over!"

He started thrashing again almost instantly after saying this. Government take over? You felt a chill run down your spine. What did he mean? Was it possible that his actions were being controlled from a remote location? No...that was ridiculous! It was pure science fiction! Then again....this whole situation was pretty screwed up. What if the growth wasn't some natural space anomaly but something that was created? Something that was premeditated? Was this...all some sort of government take over plot? It seemed too ludicrous...but everything had been pretty ludicrous lately. You filed away the information for later. Right now, you had to focus on settling Troy down or restraining him in some way.

Meanwhile, far away in the arctic wasteland, Novikiov was reviewing the read outs on the computer. He frowned. Something...wasn't right. The signal had been activated, but it wasn't affecting all the giants. It seemed to only affect one in every two boys. Something must have been wrong with the programming of the signal. He quickly began searching through the diagnostics. It could take awhile to figure out exactly what was causing this hindrance. In the mean time, he had to compensate. He began to send out growth signals to the giants that had been affected by the control signal. Until he had complete control over all the giants he was going to have to make the affected giants larger, to make up for the lack of numbers. When the signals were done being broadcast he began to decode the control signal. He would probably be able to fix it within a few hours. It changed his plan slightly, but everything should still go as planned.
135231212121221121112.title: Inner Demons

choices: Meanwhile, Troy is now Noah's height and is still fighting the signals
Project Behemoth comes upon our heroes!
1352312121212211211122.content:
As the massive truck drove down the road, the driver, a Marine, kept looking at his side mirrors. He knew exactly what cargo they were carrying and how dangerous it was, and, though he would never question his orders, he had a horrible feeling about this mission, like it was destined to be a disaster. He had been through both gulf wars, being shot at and wounded twice, but this time was the first in his life that he had truly felt scared. Not even the fact that they were surrounded by ten other armed vehicles helped.

In the back of the truck, what basically amounted to a moving building that stretched a long ways down the interstate, fifty soldiers were manned, each holding their rifles, ready to fire if necessary. They kept their eyes riveted on their cargo, Project Behemoth, who was kept down with dozens and dozens of titanium chains, wrapped around his torso and his legs. His head was kept stationary with a huge metal band that clamped down across his forehead, tight enough so he couldn't move a muscle. He had his eyes closed, and the soldiers all assumed he was asleep.

They were wrong.

While the convoy was driving through a dense, unpopulated forest area, the soldiers with Project Behemoth began to hear a loud creaking sound. They looked around, seeing that the structure of the cargo area of the truck was fine. Suddenly, they all saw that the chained boys was now beginning to move back and forth slightly, the chains beginning to give way.

"Impossible," the squad leader said. "Those chains can withstand 5000 tons of pressure!"

As soon as he said that, the chains began to pop loose, flying across the truck and striking several soldiers, killing them. In what seemed like a flash, Project Behemoth was loose. He reached up to his head band and snapped it off like it was made of tinfoil.

Terrified at what was happening before their eyes, the soldiers began shooting at the boy. Most of the bullets hit the titanium chains that were still on his chest and bounced off, but some of them did make their way through to his skin. This only served to enrage him even further, and he quickly lashed out at them, striking them with his massive hand.

The driver in the front of the truck heard the commotion, and radioed back to the squad leader. "Hollaway, what the hell is going on back there?"

Static answered him for a few seconds, until he heard the voice of a terrified private answer, "Sir, Hollaway's dead!"

The driver slammed on the brakes, radioing back, "What?! What's happened?"

It seemed that only a few words were making it through on the radio now. "Project... is loose...our weapons...ineffective...weapons--" At this point, the voice on the radio cut off, replaced by only static.

The driver jumped out of the cab of the truck just in time to see the sides of it bend and then finally break open, revealing two massive, muscled legs. The driver, too terified to move, just stared in awe as Project Behemoth burst out of the truck and stood to his full height. Incredibly, he was much bigger than he was when they started the trip. The look in his eyes was one of pure contempt for the lives of the soldiers and delight in the destruction and havoc that he was causing.

The gigantic boy started stomping the other vehicles, flattening them with his massive feet. Any soldier he saw he made quick work of, either crushing them where they stood, kicking them and sending them flying to their deaths, or grabbing them and squeezing them to death. The driver of the truck was paralyzed with fear, but the boy seemed to ignore him as he made quick work of the rest of the squad. After a few moments of incredible destruction, everyone was dead, save for the driver.

Project Behemoth looked down at the driver, sneering. The driver cowered before him, realizing that he was about to die, and closed his eyes, praying his last rites. Project Behemoth leaned down towards him until his massive face was right above him, sneered, and said, with a low voice. "Tell them that we're coming."

With that, he turned around and ran off into the forest. The driver opened his eyes back up and saw that the boy was gone, and that he was the only survivor in the midst of incredible chaos. He stood there for what seemed like years, trying to comprehend what had happened and what the hell he was going to do next.
1352312121212211211122.title: Project Behemoth is one of the affected. He tur...

choices: Noah catches up with Troy and tackles him.
The three boys run all the way to Washington D.C.
13523121212122112111222.content:
Project Behemoth tore through the forest without care, knocking aside trees, grinding stones and logs into dust beneath his massive feet. The ground rumbled and shook underneath his impressive tonnage. This boy obviously had no care for being quiet and subtle. If anyone or anything tried to stop him in his mission they would be taken of swiftly and without mercy. His destination, in order to overthrow the government, was to head back the way had come, to Washington D.C. They had been traveling for quite a few hours and had managed to make a lot of ground to get where they were and while it would take Project Behemoth less time to get there with his huge size and lack of needing roads to travel on, it would still be a few hours before he reached the capitol. Once there, the compulsion in his head was telling him to surround the White House. He may have grown up on the streets but he wasn't an idiot. He knew he couldn't take on the entire U.S Army by himself so whatever was telling him to do these things in his head must know there would be someone there to help him.

And of course he was right. At this moment, all across the country, giant boys were being forced inexorably against their will to be marched with all haste to Washington D.C. Once there, they had been instructed to merely wait. Some had already arrived. While the people of the city panicked at first and wondered what was going on, the boys did nothing but stand there, staring. When they had tried to be moved they had reacted, staying rooted to their spot, attacking those that tried to move them. The higher ups were aware of them but, since Project Behemoth had already been deployed and the boys weren't actually doing anything, they decided to let well enough alone. If the government started randomly attacking children like this, even massive ones, they would be viewed as monsters. So the boys continued to stand there, never talking, never moving. The people, while still very nervous and panicky (many had left town, ignoring all statements that the boys were perfectly harmless and the situation was under control), were doing their best to ignore their huge visitors.

What they didn't know, however, was that the boys had very, VERY ill intentions and were merely waiting for further orders from their unseen master. They were instructed to hold still until all the boys in America who had been affected had arrived. Hopefully, by that time, the signal had been fixed and everyone would be under control. If so, once all the boys around the world had gathered around their government buildings, the growth signal would be broadcast, allowing the boys to grow large enough to be able to withstand any assault that may be made against them. Once they were large enough, they would be instructed to attack, without mercy, wiping out ever single super power in the world. The world would be plunged into chaos, and with the power of the giant boys, a new world order would be molded from the ashes! If the signal still failed to control some of the boys, then the growth signal would merely be amplified to make up for lost bodies. Either way, the outcome was still the same. Nothing and no one could do anything to stop it.

Not knowing his full part just yet, Project Behemoth continued running toward his destination, his face expressionless. He was planning on running, totally uninterrupted, until he reached Washington D.C. He was surprised when he happened upon a strange sight. Two giant boys, both around the same size, were wrestling against each other. Luckily for you, he failed to see you on Noah's shoulder. He came to a halt in front of the two boys, watching them in disgust. Noah looked up as the shadow fell over top of them and gaped in shock. Project Behemoth stood about twice his height, and had a mean look on his face. His eyes were the dead, cold eyes of one who has taken life without mercy, his body muscled and strong. Noah's heart began to pound. This was not someone they wanted to mess with. Project Behemoth saw Troy was still struggling while Noah was staring. He grabbed Noah roughly and hauled him off of Troy. He shoved Noah aside, the boy stumbling back a few steps before landing hard on his backside. The massive criminal helped Troy to his feet and then coldly glared at Noah. Noah got to his feet and stared back defiantly. Troy stood, looking between the two boys, unsure of what to do. The signal in his head was telling him to run, as fast as he could, to the capitol. This giant boy seemed to want to do the same thing. But Noah, his best friend, the one he cared so deeply for, the one who was always there for him, didn't want him to. He was conflicted.

"What the hell are you two doing? We don't have time to be fighting like this. We need to get going." Project Behemoth said, cracking his knuckles.

Noah frowned and said, "No way! We're not going anywhere with you!"

Project Behemoth smirked and said, "Heh, what an idiot. Why are you ignoring the signals? Don't you know what they're telling us to do? Death! Destruction! This is major payback for every bad thing this shitty country did to you! Don't you get it?"

Noah shook his head and said, "This country hasn't done anything wrong to me! Why would I want to hurt it?"

Troy suddenly said, "Yeah? What about the police, huh? They came in and tried to hurt us! We've been on the run for hours! They want to experiment on us! If this is the kind of country we live in then it deserves what it gets!"

Troy turned and ran. Project Behemoth laughed and ran after him, soon overtaking him. Troy picked up speed to compensate, but it was difficult. Noah stared after them in shock then ran himself. He wasn't about to let Troy just run away like this, to do something horrible! He needed to stop him!
13523121212122112111222.title: The Gathering Storm

choices: You trying to break his grip on Noah's neck
Troy attacking his feet, trying to knock him over
135231212121221121112221.content:
Noah began to panic as he saw Troy and the larger boy pick up speed and begin to get out of sight. If what they said was true, then when they got to their destination, there would be some major bad news for everyone. And if there was another boy even bigger than him out there, who knows what else would be in store for them.

It was all too much. Noah began to slow down, his eyes filling up with tears. "I can't do it," he said. "There's too many of them, and I'm just not strong enough."

At that moment, you realized that your brother needed your help as much as ever. You leaned over from for resting place on his shoulder and tugged his ear, causing him to look over at you. "What are you saying, Noah? What do you mean you're not strong enough?"

"That boy... he's just so big!" Noah exclaimed. "And I won't be able to fight them both off!"

You looked at Noah straight in the eye, with the most serious, earnest look you could muster. "Noah, you are strong where it counts. Yes, they're bigger than you in size now, but don't forget, you're still a massive beast of a boy! And you are stronger in wits, intelligence, and, most importantly, heart, than they could ever hope to be. I don't care if you have to fight a hundred boys all ten times your size, you can beat them if you try!"

Noah wiped the tears from his eyes, and looked at you. You weren't sure if you believed it yourself, but at that moment, Noah could feel your faith in him, and it made him feel better. "You're right, little big bro," he said, "I have to try... as long as you'll help me, right?"

"Of course!" you said, patting him on the shoulder. "Now let's get after them and stop them! I've seen how fast you run playing soccer, and I know that you can run laps around both of them!"

Noah smiled, and then his face turned into a look of determination. He quickly started running again, angling his form to be aerodynamic, and summoning strength and energy from some unknown place inside of him. Faster and faster he ran, leaping over fallen trees and rivers, roads and, eventually, as they got closer to the city, a few buildings. Finally, he could see Troy and the other boy again. This gave him a second wind, and he sped up even faster. In a few minutes, he had caught up with Troy, and he leapt at him and tackled him to the ground. The momentum from their running caused the two naked boys to roll around on the ground, crushing a few cars that were on the road they were near. You nearly slipped off his shoulder entirely, and grabbed onto Noah's shaggy hair, which was flying in the air. Finally, they came to a stop, with Noah on top of Troy, pinning him down.

Troy looked up at Noah, shocked. Noah had a fiery look in his eyes, a look of passion and determination. "W-what are you doing, Noah?" Troy asked.

"I'm doing what's right!" Noah said. "I'm here to stop you. You have no right to destroy anything, Troy!"

Troy struggled to break free, but Noah was able to easily keep him down. Finally, Troy looked up at him, his eyes starting to water. "You don't know what it's like to be shunned by everybody. My brother treats me like a freak, all the people I thought were my friends don't care about me anymore, and now we're being hunted down and trying to be exterminated. Of course I have a right to destroy! It's the only thing I have left!"

Noah shook his head, and said, "I know that your life has not always been the best, but you can't go around blaming your family, or your circumstances, or even the government. You have to take responsibility for your own actions, and destroying the city isn't going to do anything to help that. And besides, you do have a friend who cares about you -- me."

Troy sighed. "I wish I could know that for sure..."

At this moment, Project Behemoth had noticed that Troy was no longer with him, turned back around and caught back up with the two boys. He stood there, towering over both Noah and Troy, staring menacingly. "Let him go. Allow him do what he was meant to do."

"No!" Noah said, defiantly. "I don't know why you guys are so set on destroying everything, but I'm not going to let you!"

Behemoth laughed. "Really?" he said, "and how exactly are you going to do that?" He began flexing his muscles, and Noah quickly saw that, even if the boy wasn't twice his height, he could easily handle any physical attack from Noah or Tory.

"I don't care how big you are," Noah said, trying to hide the fact that he trembling slightly, "What you're doing is not right. I know it!"

At this point, Project Behemoth leaned over, and picked up Noah by the neck. Noah tried to claw and fight, but he couldn't prevent the much larger boy from lifting him up like a little kid. He brought Noah right to his face, and snarled. "I don't care if it's right or not!" he said. "The fact is, I'm going to do it because I can. Because of what they did to me."

Noah was swinging away, trying to make contact and get himself free, but Project Behemoth's grip was too strong. From Noah's shoulder, you were within reach of the larger boy's fingers. Maybe... just maybe there was something that you could do.

"And if you're not going to help me," Project Behemoth continued as he raised his other fist, aiming it at Noah's face, "then I have no choice but to--" He couldn't finish his sentence, because his words were cut off by...

choices: Kyle comes down before it's ready. He's too hungry to wait!
Kyle manages to wait until dinner is ready but he's ravenously hungry!
13523221.content:
You opened the door to your house and sighed. Another day of school done. Thank goodness. You kicked off your shoes and headed upstairs to your room. After dropping your back pack off, filled with books for all the homework you had to do tonight, you headed back downstairs to have a little after school snack. As you entered the kitchen you saw your little brother, Kyle, rummaging through the fridge.

"Hey Kyle, what are you looking for?" you asked as came up behind him.

"Nothing special...I'm just hungry." he replied looking at all the different food.

"Well, why don't I make you a sandwich?" you offered, grabbing the meat, cheese, and condiments.

His face lit up and he nodded. "Yeah! Thanks! That would be great!"

He sat down at the table with a big smile on his face, happy that his older brother was so willing to help him. You two always had a great relationship with each other. Kyle looked up to you as a role model and tried to emulate you in any way possible. It had annoyed you at first but you couldn't fault your little brother for seeing you as something to work toward. So you decided to do your best to show your little brother the best way to live through life. He was quite different looking than you. Whereas you had blond hair, he had darker brown, your eyes were a bright blue and his were a more subdued greenish blue, though you had the same kind of build: skinny, kind of on the short side, but lean, not bony. He was eight years old to your sixteen, your parents conceiving him as a "happy accident" as they called it. Doctors had thought that your mother wouldn't have been able to have anymore kids. He was a miracle baby of sorts. You laid out the sandwich ingredients on the counter and started making a ham and cheese sandwich. "So, how was your field trip yesterday?"

Kyle attended an all boys primary school in the area. It was literally the only logical choice your family could make since the only other primary school was miles and miles away and the buses didn't come out to where your house was. Luckily, in order to cater to students who were in such a position, Kyle could go to the school for the same price as he would the regular school. He was also a very smart kid so he didn't feel out of place amongst the richer, "gifted" children. Yesterday, they had gone on a field trip to a nearby laboratory where new genetic experiments were being performed. Absolutely nothing going on in there was against any laws and all the research was going towards bettering humanity and the human lifestyle as well as making sure no lasting damage would be done to the Earth.
