It was incredibly famous for this reason and only conducted tours once in a great while. The school was very lucky they had gotten in.

Kyle shrugged, seeming kind of distracted. "It was pretty cool. A really nice lady led us around and showed us all the different experiments and stuff going on. It was weird though. The air was really tingly in one room. When I talked to my friends about it they said they felt the same thing but none of the adults did."

"Tingly huh?" you said, only half listening, focusing on the sandwich. "That does sound odd. What was going on in the room?"

Kyle shook his head and replied, "Don't know. It was some kind of experiment to...to...something. I can't remember. There was a big machine that was always running though and we had to stay behind a a big wall. We only felt the tingling in that one room though."

You set the sandwich down in front of him and he happily picked it up and started eating. "I wouldn't worry about it squirt." you said, ruffling his hair. "That place has passed every safety inspection since it opened. It's a model of perfect safety. There's no way you would get hurt in there."

Kyle had finished off the sandwich in record time. He licked the mayo off his fingers and said, "Yeah, you're right. Hey, can I have another sandwich? I'm still really hungry..."

His little tummy growled as he said this. He gave you the old puppy dog eyes until you relented and said, "Alright. But just one more. I don't want mom yelling at me for spoiling your appetite before dinner."

Kyle grinned and said, "Don't worry, I won't tell! I don't want you to get in trouble!"

What a great kid. You made up another sandwich for him and he ate it down just as fast. You still hadn't even made one for yourself yet! Kyle drank a glass of milk as you sat down with your own sandwich. He looked sadly at it as you picked it up. You noticed and said, "You want this don't you?"

Kyle nodded, his stomach gurgling again. "Geez, you're really hungry today! Alright, why not? You can have it."

You pushed the plate over to him and he eagerly devoured it. He burped when he was done and patted his slightly distended belly. He never ate this much! He got up and said, "Thanks big bro! That was really good!"

He ran off upstairs to his room, leaving you to scratch your head in perplexity. Your little brother was a notoriously picky eater. It was one of the reasons he was so skinny. But now...he had just eaten three sandwiches, one of which had pickles on it, something you KNOW he hated. Why the sudden change in tastes? You shrugged and just decided it was because he was growing up. His tastes were bound to change. The phone rang suddenly. You got up and answered it. "Hello?"

"Hey sweetie, it's Mom. Listen, something major just came up and your father and I are going to have to be out of town for the next two weeks. I know this is really sudden, but can you take care of Kyle while we're gone?"

"Sure! Don't worry, I've got everything under control!"

"Thanks so much for understanding sweetie. We'll make it up to you and Kyle when we get back, promise."

"Don't worry about it Mom. I can handle it!"

"Okay. See you in two weeks. Love you."

"I love you too. Bye Mom." you hung up the phone and smiled. Yes! Two whole weeks without parents! It was like a dream! Today was Friday too, so that meant the whole weekend was ahead of them, plus, the coming weekends! This was going to be fun! His parents were hard workers, working at the same law firm. They often had to be out of town for business reasons so you had gotten used to cooking, cleaning, and taking care of everything while they were gone. You didn't mind at all and your parents always made it up to you and your brother by spending time with you, so these situations were always fun.

You ran upstairs and knocked on Kyle's door. "Hey Kyle! Mom and Dad are going to be gone for awhile! It's just going to be us for the next two weeks!"

The door opened and Kyle said, "Really? You mean it? Awesome! We're going to have so much fun together!"

You laughed and ruffled his hair again. "You bet we are!"

Kyle ran back into his room to his desk and started writing on his calender. "There are all sorts of things I want to do! We can go camping, swimming, go to the movies, play video games, watch T.V...."

He wrote quickly, rattling off things to do as he did so. It was getting closer to summer so the weather was getting pretty warm, plenty warm enough to do all the things Kyle wanted to do. As you watched Kyle write you noticed something odd. His shirt seemed to be too short. It was riding up in the back as he leaned over to write on his calender. Strange...it had been fitting fine before when he was bending over to get food out of the fridge...maybe it was just the way he was sitting. Yeah, that was probably it.

"So! I'm going to start dinner Kyle. Is there anything in particular you want?"

"Yeah! Lasagna! With garlic bread!" He shouted out.

"Okay, but that might take awhile. Can you be patient and wait?"

"Yup! I can always wait for lasagna!"

"Alright, I'll call you when it's done then."

You walked downstairs and started preparing the dish. Italian was Kyle's favorite food and he always chose lasagna or spaghetti, or some other kind of pasta when he got a choice. You didn't mind. It was easy enough to make and you enjoyed it too. It took about twenty minutes to get the lasagna in the oven. The garlic bread would go in when there was about five to ten minutes left to cook properly. You dusted off your hands and started setting the table.
13523221.title: Just the Two of Us

choices: You go to bed...Kyle eats the rest of the food in the house!
You drive to the grocery store to buy more food. You're going to need it!
135232212.content:
You had some time to kill now before dinner so you decided to head upstairs and see what your little brother was up to. You knocked on his door and he yelled out, "Come in!"

You walked in and found him sitting impatiently at his desk, his pencil tapping on the desk repeatedly. He smiled and said, "Is it ready? Is it ready?"

You laughed and said, "Sorry squirt but you're going to have to wait awhile. I just put it into the oven."

Kyle groaned and rubbed his belly. "But I'm hungry now!"

You put your hands on your hips and looked somewhat stern. "Now Kyle...you said you could wait until the lasagna was done. Remember? If you wanted something quicker you should have said so."

He sighed and said, "Sorry...I'll wait..."

He had a melancholy air as he did his homework. You took pity on the little guy, and his weirdly large appetite as of late, and went back downstairs. You made up another sandwich, with some chips on the side, as well as a Pepsi and took the whole plate upstairs. When Kyle saw what you had in your hands his whole face lit up like a kid on Christmas morning and said, "Wow! Thanks big bro! I can't believe it! Mom would never let me have this!"

You patted him on the head and said, "Well Mom doesn't need to know. This is our two weeks together so let's make them fun!"

"Yeah!" he eagerly agreed, messily eating the sandwich. The chips disappeared just as quick, the can of Pepsi emptied out into his stomach after that. He let out a loud belch and then quickly covered his mouth. "Excuse me." he said politely.

"Don't worry about it Kyle. I'm not going to yell." You gathered up his plate and the empty can, carrying it out of his room. "Hey...big bro?"

You stopped and turned to face Kyle, his face holding an expression of guilt. "What is it?"

"Can...can I have some more? Please?" The puppy dog eyes again...this time you were firm. "Nope! Sorry squirt but you have to have an appetite for dinner. This was just a little snack to tide you over."

Kyle's stomach growled audibly. It almost seemed like an ominous sign. "Okay..."

You went back downstairs and rinsed off the plate. You'd do the dishes properly after dinner. The lasagna was starting to smell really good. You had some time before dinner would be done so you went into the living room and opened a book. You had to have this thing finished by next Friday and you'd been slacking off. If you wanted to get through it, you'd have to start now. No more procrastination. The minutes ticked by and you read the somewhat dry book, ears pricked for the sound of the oven alarm. Once it went off, you were going to put in the garlic bread and then reset the timer for about seven minutes. That would be enough time for the garlic bread to cook and the lasagna to finish cooking as well. As you turned the page you suddenly heard footsteps upstairs. It sounded like Kyle was pacing around up there. He had been acting very strangely all day..what was going on with him? He seemed much more interested in food and eating than he had ever been before. Was this some weird stage of growing up that you just don't remember? Or was something wrong with him? He had looked perfectly fine, and the fact that he was eating so much kind of proved he wasn't sick. So what was it? You shook it off. It was obvious you were just being paranoid.

About ten minutes later you heard a loud *ding!* sound. You put a bookmark in place and stood up, moving over to the oven. You popped it open, the delicious scent of cooking pasta and cheese and meat sauce wafting out as you stuck the garlic bread in. Your stomach was starting to rumble it smelled so good. You wound the oven timer after closing the oven door. Just seven more minutes...

You went back to your book though it was getting hard to concentrate. Kyle was pacing even more frantically and it was starting to become annoying. He had never been so jittery before. You were less worried about this and more annoyed at the fact that he was so active today. He was usually such a quiet kid, doing his homework, then reading or playing video games, all in almost perfect silence. It was a godsend when the timer went off again. Finally. Now he could settle down. You pulled the lasagna out and cut it into squares, putting two squares on your own plate and one on Kyle's. You hesitated then put another square on his plate. He usually only had one or one and a half squares but with how he had been eating lately this probably wouldn't be enough. You put two pieces of garlic bread on his plate as well, leaving two for your plate. You went to the foot of the stairs and shouted, "Kyle! It's ready!"

The door to his room was instantly flung open and Kyle came barreling down the stairs like a mad man. He quickly sat down, picked up his fork and started eating. You stared in disbelief as the two squares of lasagna disappeared within a few minutes, the garlic bread following suit. Kyle wiped his mouth and said, "More!"

You put two more squares on his plate and just watched as he gobbled those down just as fast. He burped and said again, "More!"

Almost in a daze you put four squares on his plate this time. Kyle's eyes shined as he dug in, taking longer than before but swiftly finishing off this food as well. He moaned, clutching his stomach in pain. At first you thought he had simply eaten too much but this was proven false by a loud growling sound that filled the air. He was still starving! He looked up at you and shouted, "MORE!"

You set the pan of lasagna down in front of him, a total of sixteen squares left. His fork was a blur as he ate and ate and ate, the pasta slowly but steadily disappearing, Kyle barely chewing as he ate. He was like a machine, never stopping, never tiring, just eating and eating and eating. Soon, the pan was empty. Kyle wiped his mouth yet again and pushed the plate aside grabbing yours as well. Without a second thought he gobbled up the two squares and two slices of garlic bread and leaned back in his chair, rubbing his stomach worriedly. "Big bro...I'm still hungry!"

You sat down in disbelief. No way...how could he possibly still be hungry? "Hey...are you listening? I said I'm still hungry!"

You stood up mechanically and went to the fridge. "W-what do you want Kyle?"

Kyle's belly, round and tight on his lean frame, growled fiercely and he moaned. "Anything! Just feed me!"

You pulled out an assortment of food items, pickles, lunch meat, bread, left over dinners of pork, chicken, beef, leftover desserts of pies and cakes, all set out before your little brother. As each food item was placed before him he quickly ate it, leaving no trace behind. The fridge being empty of any decent food, you moved to the cupboards and started pulling out chips and other snack items, all of which Kyle ate up. Finally, halfway through a bag of Doritos, he suddenly stopped and said, "Ugh...I'm full now."

He got up, his shirt riding up his potbelly as he sleepily headed for the stairs. You ran up to him and grabbed him by the shoulder. "Kyle...what the heck is going on?"

Kyle just smiled and said, "I'm just a growing boy I guess. I need a lot of food." He suddenly grabbed a few bags of chips and a few cans of soda. "I'd better take these with me for snacks. I don't want to have to wait and get really hungry again."

You watched him as he headed for the stairs noticing something disturbing. His shirt, while riding up due to his engorged belly, was also looking a few sizes too small. You looked lower and saw that his pants were riding up as well, looking more like Capri pants than anything, his socks bulging as though the feet that were inside them were too big for them to contain. It was impossible but...your brother had grown! Quite a bit! Did this have something to do with the food? You sat down again, not even hungry anymore. This was all too weird. You jumped up and started doing dishes. You needed to do something rational, something you always did, anything to take your mind off this impossible situation.
135232212.title: A Force of Nature

choices: Big bro?  My clothes feel funny.
1352322121.content:
You wake up the next morning to a loud ringing. With a sleepy groan, you reach out your hand and - gently - try to smash your alarm clock to death. When that doesn't work; you sit up, squinting, and shuffle over to the phone.

"Hello?" You mumble.

"Good morning, Mr.-"

"Oh!" You cut in, waking up a bit. "I'm not my dad. My parents are out of town. Can I take a message?"

"I see..." There was a slight pause on the line. "I'm Mrs. Fritsen, Kyle's teacher. I'm calling about the field trip our students took yesterday."

Your eyes shoot open; it's suddenly all coming back to you. Your little brother's suddenly ravenous appetite; how he seemed to have almost grown out of his clothes in just one afternoon...

"Um, yes?" You clear your throat; hopefully your voice will stop shaking like that. "Is something wrong?"

"Actually I'm calling in part to ask you." The woman on the line answered. "You see, it seems that a large number of the children who went on the tour showed some...odd...symptoms last night. About half of them, as far as I can tell. They all began eating like they were starving, not stopping even after finishing three times what they would normally eat. Their parents were frantic."

"I'll bet." You say honestly; you were still freaked out by tiny little Kyle practically eating his own weight in lasagna last night. "Did anything else happen?"

"Well they were sick, of course." Came the surprised answer over the phone. "A child can't hold that much food. But the sudden appetite was troubling. I've contacted the research facility, and they've asked that all children showing odd symptoms be taken to them for a checkup."

Now that was scary. It sounded like your brother was the only kid in the class that was growing; the rest just got sick. What would the doctors make of that?

You had a sudden, terrifying vision of Kyle, crying, strapped to some lab table as a bunch of masked doctors stuck needles and probes into him. Your hand shook slightly.

"Hello? Are you there?"

"Um..yeah, I'm here." You answer, as calmly as you can.

"So does Kyle seem alright? Should I send a car to pick him up?"

"No!" You shout quickly. "Er, no. He's fine. Perfectly normal."

"Oh, that's a relief." Mrs. Fritsen said with a sigh. "Just call the school number if you notice anything at all. We've put someone on the phone constantly until we figure this out. Also, I'm sorry to say that we've canceled your brother's classes for at least a week. Is that going to be a problem, with your parents out of town?"

"I'll figure something out." You say quickly, already worried about your little brother. "At least it's the weekend right now. I've got to go."

Hanging up, you drop the phone and run down the hall to Kyle's room. Throwing open the door you quickly turn to see...

An empty bed.

Absolutely frantic, you tear downstairs, arriving panting in the kitchen. You blink.

There's Kyle. Asleep on a sort of...nest...of empty wrappers, cans, jugs, and boxes. All around the room are open, empty cupboards. Your little brother just ate everything that counted for food in the house! In one night!

Setting that thought aside, you turn your attention back to more important things.

Kyle looked fine, but any question of whether he was growing was now completely, utterly gone.

It looked like he'd changed into his pajamas before bed, because the normally loose, breathing fabric was stretched tight over his chest and stomach. The arms opened up closer to his elbow than his wrists, and the pajama pants were hugging tight to his calves. The slow rise and fall of his chest was met with a soft, tearing sound as thread by thread, the overstretched fabric of his pajama top slowly tore apart.

You did your best to gauge his size, while letting him sleep. You were going to have to keep him calm (and clothed...and fed...oh no) when he woke up. Better to get as much information as you could.

Like you, Kyle was a bit on the small side. He hadn't even passed four feet tall yet! Or at least, he hadn't before.

He wasn't a giant, at least. Not even close. And he seemed to be the same shape as before. He was just...big. He might even still pass as a normal, if overgrown, eight year old. Eyeballing how much skin he was showing below his pantlegs, you guessed he'd grown less than a foot taller, putting him a bit over four and a half feet tall. Pretty tall for an eight year old, but yeah, he could pass.

Your thoughts were interrupted by a loud RIIIP! Kyle's shirt had finally given up, and split right down the middle. You watched, as his still slightly rounded stomach seemed to pop up a bit now that the shirt was gone.

Kyle stretched on the floor and let out a big yawn. Blinking his eyes, he looked up at you and said -
1352322121.title: Big For His Age

choices: The laboratory where Kyle had his field trip at
13523221211.content:
"Your clothes?" you asked, smiling slightly to mask your worry. You weren't quite sure what was going on now or what was going to happen, but you didn't want to get your brother unnecessarily anxious or upset. 

"Yeah," he said as he sat up and wiped his eyes. Looking down at his bare chest, a smile crept across his lips, and he began to giggle. "I guess I'm getting my growth spurt, huh, big bro?"

You slowly nodded, and he jumped to his feet, his pajama pants giving a short but loud ripping sound as he did so. Kyle turned around and saw that the back of his pants had ripped, revealing his checkered underwear. He laughed louder. "Oops," he said, grinning widely, "I guess I should be more careful."

He stretched his arms high above his head, and you saw his muscles flex slightly. You breathed a sigh of relief. Other than his height, everything seemed to be normal now. Or so you hoped. "How are you feeling, Kyle?" you asked.

"Pretty good!" he exclaimed. "I wanna go do something, actually. Ooh! Big bro, can we go to the pool today?"

You shook your head, laughing. "Perhaps later," you said, then brought up the subject that gave you the most apprehension. "Are - are you hungry at all?"

Kyle thought for a second, then shook his head furiously. "Nope! In fact, I still feel kinda full from yesterday. What did we have again?" He looked around, and at this moment he noticed the wrappers and empty boxes surrounding him. "Uhhh, what happened here?" he asked.

You scrunched up your nose and tilt your head. "You mean you don't remember?"

"Not really," he said. "I remember having a little lasagna--"

"A little?!" you interrupted. "Kyle, you ate the whole pan! Plus a whole bunch of bread and chips and meat and everything! And apparently the rest of the food that's around you. You really don't remember it at all?"

Kyle grinned sheepishly. "Uhhhh... Not really, no." At this, he let out a loud belch, as if to drive the irony home.

"Hmmm, weird," you said, then shrugged. "At least you're not hungry any more." 

As you said that, a much longer ripping sound came from Kyle's pants, and some of the fabric fell off to the ground, leaving him wearing only bits of fabric of his shirt and pants, as well as his ever-stretching underwear. His smile only seemed to be getting wider, and you were certain of one thing: he was definitely still growing. "Kyle, hold on one second."

You went over to the drawer next to the refrigerator and started rummaging through it. Finally, you found what you were looking for: the tape measure. You motioned to Kyle and brought it over to the wall. "Lemme check something," you said, having him stand straight, flat on his heels, as you extended the tape measure. "Kyle, do you remember how tall you were the last time you measured?"

"Yeah!" he said. "Mom measured me last week, and I was three feet, eleven inches.". How big am I now?"

You finally lined up the tape measure with the tip of his head, and were shocked by what you saw. "61 1/2 inches. That's, uh..." your jaw nearly drops the floor. "Five feet one-and-a-half!"

"Wow!" Kyle said. "I grew over a foot in a week!"

"Actually, Li'l Bro," you said, "I think most of that was in the last day." You stepped back and examined your little brother's body. He was now definitely too big to be a eight-year-old, and could pass for eleven or twelve, or even older. As you looked closer, you noticed that his stomach, which had earlier been so round from his gorging, was now fit and lean, and his chest was beginning to develop the slightest bit of muscular definition. Your eyes travelled down to his feet, which looked exceptionally big. You placed yours next to his and noticed that they were nearly the same size!

"Wow that's awesome!" Kyle exclaimed. "Big Bro, why are my feet the same size as yours if you're still taller?"

"I dunno," you said. "I suppose if you're growing proportionally, that might make sense. Not that anything about this really DOES make sense."

"Well," Kyle said, beginning to jump up and down a little in excitement, "whatever the case, I'm glad it's happening! I've always wanted to be a little bigger!"

You nodded, but inside you knew that something was wrong, and you had to figure out what was going on. You didn't quite know where, but you knew that you had to take Kyle to some experts, whoever they were.

As Kyle began to check himself out in the full-size mirror in the kitchen, you went upstairs to your bedroom, looking for clothing he could wear to go out in. At first, you thought to grab some clothes from a year or two ago when you were about as tall as Kyle is now. As you thought harder, however, you realized that if Kyle had grown thirteen inches in just under fifteen hours, and what seemed like about six inches in the last hour, then by the time you got to wherever it was you were going, Kyle would probably be even bigger, and you'd have to go through all this again. Of course, that assumed that he kept growing at the same rate. His growth could slow down or even stop. Or, the opposite could also be happen. You shuddered at the thought.

Finally, you grabbed some clothes, a pair of basketball shorts that were a little baggy even for you now, a very large sleeveless t-shirt, some boxers and a pair of flip-flops, and began to head back. As you passed your parents' room, you thought that maybe you should have a backup plan. Your dad was a very tall man at 6' 7", and some of his clothing was bound to fit Kyle, in a worst case scenario. You went in and grabbed a button-up shirt and khaki pants, and a pair of his size 19 sneakers. Just in case, you thought to yourself.

Going back downstairs, you handed your clothes to Kyle. "Put these on," you said. 

Sure enough, they were a little baggy, and Kyle laughed at how he looked in them. "Why am I wearing these?" he asked.

"Because," you said, "I need to take you somewhere. Just to make sure everything's all right."

The two of you head out to your car, and you try to decide where you should go. Finally, you make up your mind and head to...
13523221211.title: Big bro?  My clothes feel funny.

choices: A quick snack on the road, then shopping for food and clothes
135232212112.content:
There was no way you were taking Kyle to a bunch of strangers, you decided as you slid into the driver's seat. While it was true, you supposed, that someone working for the lab might know more about what was going on, you were just to scared of them taking Kyle away from you to risk it. It wasn't worth it; at least not yet.

Thump.

"Oof!"

Startled, you look over to the passenger seat and...up...to see your brother's head denting into the felt ceiling! Had he just grown that much again? You track your eyes down to see...

"Eheh...Kyle, I don't think you need that booster seat anymore." You chuckle nervously.

Whew. For a second there, you thought your little brother was going to burst out of the car. But after Kyle managed to pull the booster out and get back in, it was still a shock to see his head resting in the exact same spot it would have yesterday...with the booster!

It was a good thing Kyle only ever got a checkup once a year, before school started. Since it was almost summer, maybe they wouldn't think a more than one foot change over nine months was too scary. At least they probably wouldn't call the military or something.

"Big bro?" Kyle asked hesitantly as he watched the scenery. "Where are we going?"

Deciding that keeping Kyle calm and informed was more important than anything for the moment, you quickly signal a turn and park outside a small outlet mall. Turning to your little brother, you pause and gather your thoughts.

"Look, Kyle." You began. "I'm not going to lie to you. What happened last night, how much you're growing...I've never heard of anything like that before. I got a call from your teacher, and she said that a lot of your friends at school got sick from being in that lab. They were eating a lot, like you were."

"So they're bigger, too?" Kyle asked, sounding a bit excited.

"No, they're not." You answered. "They just got sick from eating too much. You're the only one who's growing like this. And I'm worried about you. So I'm going to take you to see Mr. Hendersen for a checkup, just to make sure you aren't getting hurt."

"But I feel really good!" Kyle insisted, looking a little worried. "My feet feel kinda pinchy, but that's 'cause your shoes aren't wide enough. I don't feel sick."

You nodded. Kyle's feet weren't quite as long as yours (yet, you thought), but his enlarged eight-year-old feet were a bit too wide for the shoes. At least his shirt would probably be fine, even if it was a little too long and wide at the shoulders, and the shorts were staying up.

"Just wear the shoes until we leave the office. I don't want you to get hurt, Kyle." Leaning over, you pulled him into a one-armed hug.

"And don't tell anyone how fast you're growing." You told him seriously. "I don't know what they would do if they found out, and if there's something wrong, they can find it without knowing about it."

The rest of the drive passed pretty quietly. You knew Kyle was a little scared and upset because of what you told him, but you thought you were making the right decision to be honest with him. Your parents probably wouldn't have, but you knew Kyle was a smart kid, and you didn't want to lie to him or baby him just because he was half your age.

Your confidence in your plan lasted right up until the nurse assistant pulled out Kyle's old charts.

"Lets see," she muttered, "step up here please. And take off your shoes."

Quietly, Kyle slipped off the borrowed shoes (you noticed he really had to tug on them to get them off) and stepped onto the scale.

"Well you're certainly a big boy, aren't you?" She asked in a typical sugary voice. You noticed Kyle blush and fidget a bit anyway. The nurse smiled and slid the ten pound weighted ball across the slider to the '80 lb' marker.

Thunk.

The balance on the end smacked back up. Kyle was obviously heavier.

"Hm. He is on the big side then." The nurse commented, glancing at the age square on his chart. "He's eight?"

"I'll be nine in three months!" Kyle insisted loudly. The nurse chuckled. She slid the ten back to zero and moved over the one hundred.

Thunk.

Both you and the nurse glanced silently from the weight, to Kyle, and back again. Yesterday, your brother probably hadn't weighed more than fifty pounds, and now he weighed over a hundred! The nurse was looking a bit disturbed. She kept glancing from the chart in her hands, to your brother, and back.

114. Your brother was a hundred and fourteen pounds. And the sliding height measure put him at 5 feet 1 and 3/4 inches. He'd managed to creep up a quarter inch on the drive to the doctor! And now his oversized body was only 15 pounds lighter and half a foot shorter than yours!

The doctor showed up pretty fast. Of course, he took a good minute to stare at your brother, too.

"I wouldn't have believed it." He mumbled, eying him up and down. "Hey there Kyle, looks like you've had a busy year, huh?"

"Yes, Mr. Hendersen." Kyle said shyly, swinging his feet (now just in socks) as he sat on the exam table.

"Thirteen inches in nine months seems like a lot to me." Hendersen said conversationally as he shined a light in Kyle's ears. "And seventy pounds, too! How are you feeling, Kyle?"

"I feel really good. I'm not sick!" He said firmly, looking past the doctor at you.

"Well, just to be sure, I'd like to take a little of your blood. Is that okay?"

Kyle looked a bit hesitant. Your brother hated needles.

"You see," Hendersen explained, "your body makes different chemicals to help you grow. Sometimes it makes too much by mistake, and if you grow too fast it can hurt you. I can look at your blood and see if your body made a mistake, so we can fix it before you get hurt."

"You're gonna shrink me?" Kyle asked, wide-eyed.

"No." Hendersen laughed. "I can't do that. So you might just be a basketball star yet."

Leaving Kyle, grinning, on the table, Doctor Hendersen calmly led you from the room.

"It might be nothing." He said first. "You both always seemed to take after your mother, but I pulled your father's charts and Kyle isn't too far off from those. The sudden growth spurt would still be scarily fast, but nothing to worry about. More likely, though, something's off in his body. I'll test his blood for growth hormone, and see if it's dangerously high."

"Does he seem okay?" You asked, worried.

"That's the strange thing. When someone grows that fast, connective tissues break down, bones get brittle, the skin can stretch and scar. But your brother looks perfectly healthy. Just really, really big for his age."

Doctor Henderson wrung his hands.

"I don't understand it, but the nurse should be done taking his blood by now. We'll have the results in two days."

Shaking the man's hand, but not really feeling much better, you met up with Kyle and together the two of you took off in your car. It sounded to you like the doctor had no idea what was going on with your brother. (You were already starting to leave off the 'little' part.) But you could hope that after he ran the blood test, he might see something that would give him a clue.

Or maybe Kyle was done growing. He seemed to have eased to a stop, and he hadn't had any more weird appetite attacks.

Looking over, you see your brother's face scrunched up in discomfort.

"Kyle," you ask, "are you okay?" If he'd been lying to the doctor because he was scared...if that fast growth had hurt him after all, you were turning the car right around and speeding to the hospital.

"I'm fine." He insisted again. "I feel great."

"Kyle, I know that face." You said in a warning tone. "No lies. What's -"

Grrrruuuummmbbbblllleee

"wrong..." you finished weakly.
135232212112.title: Off The Charts!

choices: "Go to the park to play some basketball?"
1352322121122.content:
"A buffet?" you wondered aloud. You look at what Kyle's pointing to, and see a chinese buffet that advertised "All You Can Eat: only $6.99 for lunch!" On the surface, it didn't seem like such a bad idea. Kyle could get full and it would certainly cost less than trying to buy all that food yourself. But, you knew that if the owner caught wind of what was happening, they might kick you out. After all, you figured, a boy eating tray after tray of food was bad for business.

"But Kyle," you said, realizing something. "Last time we ate chinese you said you hated it and never wanted to have it again."

"I knooooow," Kyle whined a little. "But I'm soooo hungryyyyy." He rocked back and forth slightly in his seat, rubbing his stomach.

"Okay," you gave in, and pulled the car into the lot. As soon as you put the car in park, Kyle unbuckled his seatbelt and bolted out of the car and into the restaurant. "Hey, wait up!!"

As you entered, you shook your head in slight embarrassment as Kyle was already at the buffet, filling up his first plate. "Uh," you muttered to the kind, elderly Chinese woman at the register. "One adult, and one kid," you motioned Kyle's direction.

The woman looked over at Kyle, peered over the edge of her glasses, and then turned back to you. "I'm sorry, but our children's price is for kids ten and under."

"But he's--" you stopped yourself from protesting, realizing it wasn't worth the fight, especially for a two dollar difference. You pulled the credit card out of your wallet and paid the price, then walked over to Kyle, who had piled up the plate with a mountain of sweet and sour chicken. He headed over to the table he had picked out, and without saying anything to him, you grabbed your own plate, and started putting a small amount of food on it.

By the time you sat down, however, half the mountain of chicken was gone, and the rest was vanishing into your brother's mouth at an unbelievable speed. At some point, you put your chopsticks down and just watched him eat. It was amazing, like something you had seen on a nature documentary about certain animals eating five times their body weight at one sitting.

When he finished the first plate, he went back and filled up another plate, this time with beef spare ribs. Again and again he would pile up his plate with enough food for an entire family, and each time he would come back and devour it within minutes. Four, five, six plates piled up on your table, and he kept going. You prayed that the owner or any of the other employees of the restaurant weren't watching.

As he went up for his seventh plate, a middle-aged woman who had been sitting two tables behind you walked by. "Boy, he sure has an appetite, huh?" she asked. "He's your brother?" You nodded. "How old is he?"

You hesitated, not wanting to give away Kyle's true age, especially when it could cause a bit of confusion or commotion. So, thinking fast, you asked, "How old does he look like to you?"

"I'd say twelve, maybe thirteen. I remember when my Alex was that age…"

"You know what," you said, trying to cut the conversation short before Kyle got back to the table, "you're absolutely right. He'll be thirteen next month."

"He sure has a young face," she said. "I'm sure puberty will take care of that, won't it?" She chuckled, and you feigned a polite smile. Finally, the woman left, and Kyle came back to the table.

"How are you feeling, Kyle," you asked. "You full yet?"

He looks up at you, then thinks for a moment. "Almost," he said. "I think this'll be my final plate."

"Good," you said, then looked at your watch. 2:30. It had been over ninety minutes since you had arrived at the restaurant, and you knew that someone was gonna have to come by soon to throw you out.

Kyle actually had two more plates before finally leaning back and burping loudly. "Ahh," he said, patting his protruding belly, "that's better. Okay, big bro, I'm full now!"

"Finally," you said. You threw down ten dollars for a tip. It was almost as much as the meal itself had cost, but you figured you owed the restaurant that much, especially since they had to clean up so many plates from Kyle. You held your breath until you got back out to the car.

"Hey, big bro!" Kyle said as he buckled up. "Is it alright if we..."
1352322121122.title: Look big bro, a buffet!

choices: "Big Bro? I'm feeling these strange new feelings..."
13523221211221.content:
You looked at your brother, almost giving him a double take. "Really?" you asked. "You feel like playing basketball after eating all that much? You're not sluggish or anything?"

"Nah," Kyle said. "I feel like I got tons of energy! Like I'm about to explode or something!" As you drove, you examined him out of the corner of your eye, and you noticed him fidget in his seat a bit, adjusting his shorts, which were tenting up. You realized that something was going on, somehow, to get him excited. You didn't know if it was the hormones or the food, or something else, but you started to worry a bit for your brother.

As you got to the park, you grabbed a basketball you kept in the trunk for situations like this and walked over with Kyle to the courts. They were mostly deserted, so you started playing a game of one on one with him.

"First one to ten wins!" he yelled. You always let him take the ball first, since he was younger, and you were accustomed to going easy on him to keep it competitive and let him win sometimes. But as he started playing, he seemed to burst forth with energy, driving right around you faster than you could defend and going straight for the basket, scoring an easy layup. As you got the ball back, you started dribbling, but than quick as lighting, Kyle was able to steal the ball away from you and run back down the court, laying it in again.

"All right!" he called out. "Two - Zip!"

You decided to step up your game, realizing you might be dealing with more than you could handle. You were able to get a couple of jump shots, but each time you missed, Kyle would jump above you and grab the rebound, and he ran down the court way too fast for you to catch up. After ten minutes, Kyle won - no, he crushed you, at a score of 10-3.

"Wooohooo!" he yelled, raising his hands into the air in victory! He looked up at you and saw a certain level of concern in your face. "Oh, I'm sorry, big bro," he said, as his smile faded away. "I didn't mean to make you feel bad or nothing."

"No, that's alright," you said. "I'm glad for you. You were playing in a different gear or something today."

His face lit up again, and he stepped towards you and hugged you tight. As he did, you noticed that he was now inching closer to your height - the growth had started again. You sighed and cursed silently to yourself. Still, it was comforting, you realized, to know that no matter what would happen with Kyle, you could still depend on him to admire and love you as your little bro. You hoped that would never change.

When you got home, it was nearly eight o'clock at night. You were afraid that Kyle would be hungry again, but as he stepped in the house, he let out a huge yawn.

"Boy, big bro, today's been a long one. I think I'm ready for bed."

"That's a good idea," you said, though in the back of your mind you knew that it meant he might experience another growth spurt in his sleep.

"Hey, bro," Kyle looked at you, his eyes big and innocent. "Would you mind sleeping with me in my bed tonight?"

The question took you aback. He hadn't asked you to do that in years. "Well, sure, Kyle," you said, "but why would you want me to do that?"

Kyle shrugged. "I dunno," he said. "After all that we've gone through today, I think I'd feel better if you did."

"Of course," you said as you patted him on the shoulder.

Thirty minutes later, after showers for both of you and changing into your sleep clothes (which for Kyle consisted of one of your white shirts and mesh shorts, and for you was just your boxers), you climbed in bed with him. He wrapped his arms around you tight, and as he closed his eyes he said, "Good night, big bro. I love you."

"I love you too, Kyle," you said, smiling. "Don't ever forget that."

You slept as soundly as you had ever done before, and only the sunlight seeping in through the blinds would wake you in the morning. Well, that, and a large knee hitting you in the back.

You opened your eyes and turned over to face Kyle. Sure enough, he had grown significantly during the night again, and was lying in a fetal position. You compared your body to his. He was now bigger than you, and substantially so. Looking at his face, you saw that he was still sleeping.

Quietly crawling out of bed, you gently rolled Kyle over until he was lying straight on his back, being careful not to wake him. Your shirt was now starting to rip on his chest, and the elastic band on the mesh shorts was cutting into his waist, and they revealed a lot of thigh.

You needed to figure out something. You quietly walked downstairs and grabbed the tape measure from where you left it on the kitchen table, then went back up to the bedroom. Stretching it out, you measured Kyle from head to toe. Even though you expected it to be big, you weren't really prepared for the number you got.

Seventy-seven and a half inches. That was six feet five and a half. In one day, your brother had grown almost 17 inches, and in the past two, he had grown thirty! You weren't sure how to deal with this.

Your thoughts drifted to your parents, and you realized they were still going to be gone for another twelve days. You had to figure something out. Sitting down at your desk, you grabbed a pencil and a sheet of paper and wrote down some numbers. If Kyle had grown thirty inches in two days (even though it hadn't actually been a full two days), then he was averaging fifteen inches a day. If that kept up, then by the time your parents got back, he would be… you did a few quick multiplication and addition problems, then nearly broke the lead of your pencil when you wrote down the number. Two hundred and fifty-nine inches. That was over twenty-one feet tall! You shuddered as you thought of how he would fit into the house, what he would wear, and, perhaps worse of all, how much food he would need at that size. Of course, the growth could and probably would slow down before then… but it could also get worse…

As you tried to wrap your mind around the situation, you turned and saw your brother sitting up in his bead. Yawning, he stretched his arms up high, then smacked his lips as he looked at you. Smiling, he said, "Good morning, bro!"

"Good morning, Kyle," you returned. "How're you feeling?"

He tilted his head from side to side, then looked like he was thinking, before finally answering...
13523221211221.title: "Go to the park to play some basketball?"

choices: There's no food in the house!
Of course you can take Kyle outside.  Nobody will notice.  Right....
135232212112211.content:
"I feel real good, bro." He smiled at you. "My bed feels kinda tiny though."

As Kyle uncurled on the bed, his eyes widened slightly as first his feet, then half his calves stuck out off the end! Blinking in surprise, your brother quickly threw his legs around to the floor with a loud thunk. The bedsprings creaked as he bounced up (way up) to his new height. His mouth fell open as he looked around his room.

"Everything's so tiny!" He gasped, waddling over to his dresser and staring down at the top of it. It was clear your 'baggy' shorts were doing more to cut off his range of motion now than clothe him; as he walked, you could already hear seams ripping apart. The shirt wasn't doing much better; the tears you saw earlier were slowly spreading down toward the hem, which was settled right above your brother's very slight potbelly.

You frowned; wasn't his stomach flat yesterday morning? You could swear it was; you'd been surprised by how fit Kyle had looked.

Next to the dresser, you saw Kyle's old growth chart. You remembered when, yesterday, Kyle had proudly declared that he was three feet, eleven inches tall. This morning, the thick black mark with last week's date on it barely made it past his exposed belly button! The whole chart only topped off at five feet, and even that was under his chest!

"I gotta go downstairs!" Kyle half-shouted excitedly, accidentally bumping into you as he rushed for the door. "I want to see how small things got!"

Stopping in the doorway, your brother paused in his rush and turned to properly look at you for the first time. You couldn't help gulping a little as you saw his expression of shock when he realized he was bigger than you.

This was the moment, you knew, that might change everything between you and your little...big...brother. It wasn't bad, or even strange, that Kyle wanted to grow; lots of little kids did. But little kids almost always saw their parents, or teachers, or other 'big' people in their lives as always being bigger than them. And they also thought the 'big person' was the one in charge. To be honest, you weren't sure how your little brother was going to react when he realized he was the biggest person in the house.

Kyle was a good kid, and you knew he loved you. But no matter how smart he was, he was only eight years old; he wasn't ready to make important choices for himself yet, or take care of himself. Kyle was...he was...

He was giggling!

Maybe it was the stress of what was happening to your brother. Maybe it was relief that he seemed to still really be HIM, on the inside. Or maybe it was just the image of a giant Kyle that was probably twice your size who filled up the entire doorway to his room, covering his face with his hands and giggling in a high-pitched eight year old voice.

Whatever it was, you were on the floor laughing hysterically in no time flat.

After a few minutes of laughter - from both of you - you finally managed to calm yourself down enough to sit up on the floor and look up at your brother. Kyle was still there, looking down at you and grinning like an idiot.

"Wanna play basketball again?" He asked, putting on his best 'innocent' face.

You snorted. "Right, Kyle. I'm starting to think Hide and Seek will be more fun for me."

Your conversation had to stop there, though, as Kyle's stomach took a moment to gurgle loudly. Your brother looked down in surprise and slightly worry as he tugged on his shirt.

"Um, you hungry Kyle?" You asked hesitantly.

Slowly, he shook his head.

"Not really. I mean, kinda, but not like I was before. Actually," he said, frowning, "it feels more like-

Buuurrrpp!

To your dying day, you would swear you saw the windows rattle.

Kyle blushed, but you figured a burp or two wasn't so bad, considering how much he ate yesterday. In fact, it looked like most of his belly was just gas, since it seemed to be shrinking down before your eyes.

Thunk

"Hey!"

Wincing, Kyle rubbed the top of his head, which had just hit the top of the door!

"Uh, Kyle?" You ask nervously.

"I think it stopped..." Kyle said softly, ducking back into his room and running his hand from the top of his head, to the door, and back.

"Dad has to do that." He said, still quietly. "Big bro, how big am I gonna get?"

Like your visions of lab tables and evil government doctors, pictures of Kyle exploding out of the house filled your head. How could your brother hope to have a normal life, if he just kept growing and growing and growing?

Slowly, you stood and walked over to your brother. Leaning in, and trying to ignore that he now seemed as huge to you as you probably always had to him, you threw an arm around him.

"Don't worry, Kyle. We'll figure this out, I promise. I'll always take care of you."

"Cause you're my big brother." Kyle nodded, smiling at you and hugging you back.

"Cause I'm your big brother."
135232212112211.title: Little Big Brother

1352322121122112.content:
As Kyle headed downstairs to compare his new height with everything, you decided to head to the upstairs study, where the family computer was. Sitting down, you turned on the machine, and after it booted up, logged onto your email. There was the usual spam, a couple of messages from your friends, and, at the top of the list, an email from your parents.

You gulped as you clicked on it to open it. Inside was an explanation of why they had to leave so suddenly: there was a natural disaster on the other side of the country, and your parents (both being FEMA workers) were called to assist at a moment's notice. They were both fine, but were so busy that they probably wouldn't be able to call any time soon. They wanted to let you know they loved you and Kyle. It ended with a plea to "Make sure you take good care of Kyle, so that he's in as good of shape when we get back as when we left!" You chuckled nervously at the last bit, realizing that in a certain sense Kyle was in much better shape than when they left.

You quickly decided not to tell them what was going on with Kyle, reasoning that it was better to wait until you heard back from the doctor and knew exactly what was happening inside of him, so you responded saying that you and him were fine and having fun together (which was true) and that you hoped they stayed safe. You sent it off quickly, then shut down the computer. As you did, you heard a loud crashing sound come from downstairs, and you leapt to your feet.

Running downstairs, you saw Kyle standing next to a bookshelf in the living room which had apparently been knocked to the floor. He had a horrified look on his face, and seemed petrified in fear. You walked over to him, and he turned to you, nearly crying. "I-I don't know what happened! I just bumped into it a little accidentally! Aw, Mom and Dad are gonna kill me!!"

Inwardly, you were amused by the thought of your parents trying to spank a nearly seven-foot-tall boy, but you stifled your laughter. Instead, you gently placed your hand against your brother's side and turned up towards him with a calming look on your face. "Don't worry about it, Kyle," you said. "Look, nothing's broken! We can just pick it back up and put the books back in order."

Kyle seemed to relax a little, and breathed a sigh of relief. "You're right, bro," he said. You walked around to try to help lift back up the shelf, but Kyle was able to bend over and grab the shelf with one hand, pulling it back up with ease. It was quite an impressive feet, since the shelf was made of solid oak and (you knew from the last time your family moved) was quite heavy.

You gathered up some of the books that had fallen and handed them to Kyle, who placed them on the top shelf. In the next few minutes, you filled in the rest of the shelf until everything was back in order. "There!" you said. "Good as new!"

Kyle giggled, and then turned and gave you a big hug, surprising you a little. "Thank you, big bro, for making me feel better and for helping."

You grinned sheepishly and hugged him back. "I'll always do my best to, buddy. That's my job as your older brother!"

Kyle ended the hug and then looked into your eyes with an excited look. "So what're we gonna go do today, huh?"

"I dunno... Is there anything you want to do today, Kyle?"

He thought for a moment. "I dunno..."

Suddenly, you remembered something. "Hang on a second." You walked over to the desk in the kitchen and opened the drawer. Digging around, you searched until you found... "Here it is!!" You held up four tickets.

"What's that?" Kyle asked, cocking his head to the side slightly.

"Tickets to Adventure Mountain!" Your parents had won four tickets to the local amusement park from a work raffle last year, but had never used them. You figured that, given the circumstances, they wouldn't mind if you used them now.

Kyle's eyes lit up and he started to jump up and down in excitement, inadvertently shaking the entire house and throwing off your balance a little. "Oh boy, Oh boy!" You couldn't blame him for his excitement. The last time you both had gone, Kyle was too short for most of the exciting rides. That... wouldn't be a problem now.

"Well, we have two extra tickets," you said. "Do you wanna invite a couple of your friends?"

Kyle's eyes opened up even wider. "Are you sure? You wouldn't want to bring any of your friends?"

Appreciating Kyle's selflessness, you smiled and shook your head. "Nah," you said, "this was your weekend, remember? Besides, I've been there with my friends before; they don't know how to have fun like we do!" You grinned a little devilishly, and Kyle giggled.

"Yeah! Okay, then, can we go with Lukas and Mark?"

"Sure! Lemme just call their parents and see if it's okay. Why don't you go upstairs and try to find something in Dad's closet that fits?"

Kyle nodded excitedly and ran up the stairs, his footsteps pounding loudly, and causing the entire house to creak and groan under the weight. After a few minutes on the phone, convincing both Lukas's and Mark's parents that you'd be careful and take good care of them (and not mentioning anything about Kyle's extra two or three feet of height), everything was all set.

Hanging up the phone, you turned around … and started to laugh. Kyle was standing on the foot of the stairs, wearing a pair of tight cargo shorts and a black Led Zeppelin t-shirt that left about a half-inch of his stomach exposed, along with a pair of sneakers that looked like they were about to burst at the toes.

"Those are Dad's clothes?" you asked. "I've never seen him wear them before."

"They were the biggest things I could find," Kyle admitted. "I guess that maybe tomorrow I won't have much to wear at all!" He looked at you in the eyes, the corners of his lips turning up slowly.

As you looked at him head to toe, you realized how ludicrous the whole plan of going out was. This wasn't like yesterday when Kyle could possibly pass for a young-faced teenager. Anyone who looked at him would know that something was out of the ordinary right away. For a moment, you thought of the scene in the movie Honey, I Blew Up The Baby where the main character tried to pass off his six-foot tall infant as a visiting adult relative by hiding him in thick, cumbersome clothes and a hat. But you knew that wouldn't work in real life, especially with going to an amusement park. People were just going to have to get used to the idea of a giant in their midst. Yeah, like that would happen.

"Okay, Kyle," you said, breathing in deep and hiding away your hesitation about your plan for now. "Let's get going! Lukas and Mark are waiting!"

The two of you headed out to the car, Kyle getting in first. As you climbed in, you saw Kyle having to scrunch down to avoid hitting his head on the ceiling. "Are you gonna be comfortable, Kyle?" you asked.

"Yes. Well, n-- yeah, I'll be fine." He was definitely trying to act like everything was okay, and so you followed his lead, put the car in park, and headed to pick up his friends.

Lukas' was the first house you got to. You begged Kyle to stay down low in the car, as you didn't want any of his friends' parents to see him. You figured they had also gotten the call you did about the incident at the laboratory tour, and would report anything even slightly out of the ordinary.

Lukas answered the door on the first ring, already holding his backpack and itching to go. He was a few inches taller than Kyle had been (before the growing started) and very skinny, with a shock of bright red hair and freckly skin. "Hey," he said to you, obviously excited. "Where's Kyle?"

"He's in the car. Are you ready?"

"Yup!" He turned around and called into the house. "Bye Mom! Kyle and his brother are here! I'll be back later!"

He shut the door behind and ran out to the car. He hopped in the backseat without looking into the front, and didn't notice Kyle until he had already buckled up. When he looked up at Kyle, his mouth dropped open, and his eyes bulged like dinner plates.

"Hey, Lukas!" Kyle said, turning around and waving.

"K-Kyle? Is that you?"

"Yup! Who else would it be?"

"What happened to you?" Lukas asked, still trying to comprehend the situation.

On the drive over to Mark's, you and Kyle explained what had happened. The situation repeated itself when Mark, a short, olive-skinned, half-Korean boy with long thick black hair, got in the car, but by the time you arrived at Adventure Mountain, all three boys were too excited about all the rides they were gonna go on to care at all.

From the moment you all got out of the car, though, you could feel people's eyes fixed at your brother. No one said anything, but it was obvious enough that everyone noticed and were whispering about the seven-foot tall child in their midst. You gulped, hoping nothing would come of it, but imagined swarms of police and military vehicles descending on the park.

Once you got inside the gates, Lukas and Mark each tugged on your shoulder to go a different direction. Kyle, however, placed a hand on each of his friends' shoulders, saying, "Hey, guys, why don't we let my brother decide where we go first? After all, he did find the tickets and drive us all here."

Lukas and Mark reluctantly agreed, and so you pulled out the park map, studying it. Finally, you decided to first head towards...
1352322121122112.title: Outings

choices: To the Roller Coaster!  Before Kyle's too big!
13523221211221122.content:
"How about Go Karts?" You asked, looking up to see the closed track, which sat closer to the entrance than a lot of the larger, faster rides.

"Yeah!" Kyle cheered, pumping his arm in the air and rushing forward.

"Whoa, Kyle!" You called quickly, bringing him up short. In barely any time at all, your brother's long legs had carried him halfway there!

"Sorry," he mumbled as he walked back to the rest of you. "I'm just real excited."

"It's fine, Kyle," you quickly reassured him. "But remember, Lukas and Mark can't go that fast. And we shouldn't run around in the park anyway."

Kyle nodded obediently, but was grinning a bit when he saw his friends looking at him in awe. Almost faster than you could see, your brother suddenly swooped his arm around and yanked a shrieking Lukas into the air. Your brother's friend laughed as Kyle carefully settled him over his shoulders and stared walking beside you.

"I'm so high!" Lukas exclaimed, looking around with big eyes.

"I know!" Kyle giggled. It was probably still so new for him, too. He was easily head and shoulders above almost everyone around him; if you thought Kyle made you look short, his friends looked even smaller.

"You don't weigh anything at all!" Kyle giggled, jumping up and down as Mark hurried on his other side to keep up. Looking down, you saw the constant jumping was putting more strain on your brother's already stressed shoes; the sides were already giving out.

Fortunately, Kyle settled down when you reached the Go Kart track, and he carefully set Lukas down so he wouldn't smack his face against the sign. (Kyle had to duck)

"Welcome! Please grab a Go...Kart..." the attendant trailed off a bit as he caught sight of your brother, who looked like he was getting used to the reaction.

Rolling his eyes, Kyle dragged you with him to a pair of cars.

"I get the red one!" He declared, moving in to sit down.

"Oof!"

Looking over from where you were strapping yourself in, you watched as your brother tried to cram himself into the small race car. When he got settled, Kyle's knees were practically up by his ears. He'd already taken the seat as far back as it would go, and he was having a lot of trouble getting the harness down. Finally, with a tight squeeze you could tell was painful, he managed to force the clasps together.

Lukas and Mark came in first, since their small bodies barely taxed the Go Kart engines. Not wanting Kyle to feel bad, you let up the gas a little on the last lap and let Kyle slide ahead of you. It was a near thing. There was a steep slope at the end of the track, and you could practically hear Kyle's car gasping for air when it made it over the top.

Kyle didn't seem to mind though. He was all grins as he wriggled his way out of his car. Looking around, he grinned even wider and pointed to another ride.

"Look, it's the Moon Mansion!" He exclaimed gleefully, already off with his friends.

By the time you caught up, Mark and Lukas were already inside, bouncing around on the inflated rubber floors like maniacs. Kyle, though, was leaning against the wall with a dejected look on his face. Beside him was a marked sign that said 'You must be this tall or shorter to enter the Moon Mansion.'

"Oh, Kyle," you murmered, walking over to him. "I'm sorry."

Kyle sniffed.

"That's okay. It's a stupid ride anyway, right?" He asked, trying to look tough.

"Right. That's for little kids." You tried to sound dismissive as you took your brother's hand. "Come on. Let's go sit down over here."

You quickly led your brother over to a nearby food stand. Hoping it would make him feel better (and not make him grow, at least not too much) you ordered a pair of chocolate sundaes. A young woman quickly appeared with a pair of glasses and two spoons. After a quick, shocked glance up at your brother, she left the two of you alone to your thoughts and drinks.

Kyle mechanically spooned ice cream into his mouth as he watched his friends bouncing and laughing across the way. It was so depressing. You pushed your sundae away for the moment; you needed to cheer up your little brother.

"Hey, cheer up." You patted him on the arm. "If it makes you feel better, I know they can't ride Death Mountain yet!"

Death Mountain was the newest, most intense roller coaster in the park, built along the 'Adventure Mountain' theme. Because of how sharp many of the turns and drops were, the height restriction was pretty - well, high. Heck, you were only just tall enough last year when it opened!

Kyle grinned at the reminder, and scooped up some more ice cream with his -

Stick?

"Huh?" Kyle mumbled around a mouth full of sundae.

In your brother's hand was the handle of his spoon, but the scoop was gone. Looking at it in surprise, you suddenly heard an odd crunching sound from your brother's mouth.

"Kyle!" You exclaimed. "You're chewing on it! Spit it out!"

Eyes wide, your brother quickly spat his entire mouthful (and for him a mouthful was becoming quite a lot) onto the table. Lying in the middle like some strange centerpiece was a twisted, mangled hunk of metal. Your brother had completely crushed it with his teeth!

"Are you okay?" You asked, worried. "Do you taste any blood?"

Eyes still wide, Kyle slowly shook his head.

"No. I didn't even notice." He said, surprised. "What if I'd swallowed that?"

Kyle's stomach gurgled hungrily.

The two of you just looked at each other, worried.

"You, uh, want me to buy you something?" You asked as you passed him your spoon.

Kyle quickly shook his head again.

"No, not right now." Your brother's stomach gurgled again, more loudly. "I'm getting hungry again." He said, quietly.

"Should we go home?" You asked, worried.

"No!" Kyle insisted. "I wanna ride the roller coaster! You know," he looked over at the Moon Mansion, "while I still can. I think the ice cream should last a little while."

You just nodded, and turned to watch the other two kids as Kyle spooned up his sundae. This really might be the first, last, and only time your little brother got to ride a roller coaster. As Mark and Lukas ran out the exit toward your table, you promised yourself you'd make this Kyle's best amusement park trip ever.

"Hi, Kyle! Sorry you couldn't - whoa!" Mark exclaimed, looking at the table in awe. Hadn't you gotten rid of the spoon?

"You ate two whole sundaes by yourself?" Lukas asked.

Both you and Kyle started, and looked down. At some point, Kyle's bowl had run empty; he must have switched to yours without realizing.

Lukas was poking Kyle's belly, which you noticed was very slightly sticking out.

"Those were the big ones, too." He said, picking up one of the glasses; it was too big around for his hands to touch.

Kyle looked over at you, worried. His stomach let out a slight rumble.

"Uh-"

"-oh" You finished
13523221211221122.title: You Must Be This Tall...

choices: Kyle stifles his hunger and wants to go again!
135232212112211221.content:
Kyle jumped to his feet with a determined, if uncomfortable, look on his face, and started heading out in the direction of Death Mountain. He walked quickly, with purpose. You got up and followed him, having to jog a little to match his pace, as Lukas and Mark ran behind you, trying to keep up as best they could.

"Kyle, wait!" you called out, but he didn't turn around. Running, you got in front of him and put your hands up, stopping him for a moment. "Look, Kyle. I know you really want to go on this ride, and I want you to do it too. But we gotta be concerned about your health. If you start going into shock or something because of not getting enough food--"

Kyle put his hand on your shoulder and cut you off. "Don't worry about it. I'll be fine for a little bit, I know. Besides, I've never been on a real roller coaster before. I can put up with being hungry for a while in order to do that."

With that, he stepped around you and headed to the entrance of the ride. You followed right behind, worried but understanding of your brother's determination.

When he got to the entrance, Kyle stopped, looking up at the wait time sign next to the queue entrance. "Thirty minutes wait?" he said, disappointment obvious in his voice.

"Yeah," you said as you caught up. "That's what kinda lines these big rides have, if not more. Are you sure you can last that long."

Kyle nodded hesitatingly, then walked into the line. As you followed behind him, you heard the attendant say to you, "Sir, those two aren't tall enough to ride." You saw he was pointing at Lukas and Mark, who looked down, dejected.

You weren't sure what you should do. Splitting up the group was bad either way. You knew you couldn't leave Lukas and Mark alone for half an hour; you'd probably get arrested for child abandonment. Kyle probably wouldn't get bothered by anybody if he waited in line and rode on his own, but you knew he wanted you sitting next to him on the coaster itself to give him courage. "Can they at least wait in line with us?" you pleaded with the attendant. "I promise I won't try to sneak them on the ride or anything."

The attendant sighed, then nodded. "Okay, fine. They'll have to get out of the line right before you two get on, then, and they can wait for you at the exit." You sighed in relief, thanked the attendant, and the four of you continued into the queue area.

As the minutes ticked by and the line crawled forward, Kyle's stomach gradually began to growl again. At first, it was soft, barely audible, but after about fifteen minutes of waiting in line, it had gotten much more noticeable, to the point where the people in front of you turned around when they heard it. Each time it rumbled, you saw Kyle's face wince, as if in pain, and you thought about calling this whole thing off. But you knew how much riding Death Mountain meant to Kyle, and you wanted him to be the one to call the shots on it, not you. Besides, you weren't sure if you could force him to do much of anything at this point

When you got to the front, Lukas and Mark slipped out the path towards the exit. "Wait right at that bridge," you told them, pointing to a walkway that went over the track at the last big drop. "We'll be there in a few minutes."

"Alright," Lukas said, shouting over the sound of the brakes of a train just coming into the station. "We'll be there watching!"

"Have fun, Kyle!" Mark yelled, waiving. You were impressed that, though the two boys were obviously sad they couldn't go on the ride with you, they seemed to be happy and excited for Kyle's first trip and for coming so close to the coaster itself. They ran over to the bridge, and you kept them in your peripheral vision until you got on the train, making sure they were okay.

The cars were four seats per row, with a bicycle-style seat that left the riders' legs hanging in the air. You let Kyle get in first. He sat down in the seat and pulled the shoulder restraint down. Kyle slouched down in his seat so that the restraint would go down as far as it could, but it still seemed to be not enough. There was a seat-belt-style buckle that was supposed to connect to a strap attached to the bottom of the seat. Kyle stretched and stretched that strap, trying to make himself small enough for it to fit, but try as he might, he couldn't get the restraint to come down far enough to allow it to connect.

When the attendant came over, he looked back and forth between Kyle and the seat restraint for quite a while, then finally said, "Umm, it looks like you might be too, uh, big to fit in our normal restraints."

At this, you saw Kyle's face begin to grow red, and you could tell he was about to let explode all the frustration of the day, as well as the hunger pain he was in. You put your hand on his shoulder, hoping it would comfort him a little and reign him in. However, the attendant, noticing Kyle starting to get upset, quickly said, "Don't worry, we've got some seats in the front row of the next train that are specially designed for our, um, guests with bigger body types. If you don't mind waiting one more time, we'll get you on that one."

Kyle's eyes lit up again, and he quickly jumped out of the seat over to the platform. You followed behind him and the two of you waited in a holding area the station attendant had led you to. Watching the train leave the station caused Kyle to start jumping up and down a little in anticipation, knowing he was only moments away from his first ride on a true roller coaster.

"How're you feeling?" you asked, smiling up at him. "Excited?"

"You bet!" Kyle exclaimed. "And we get to ride in the front row, too! I can't wait to -- Ohhh!" His face contorted as he clutched his stomach, nearly doubling over. The churning sound his stomach was making roared over the noise of the station platform. Your smile quickly vanished and you grabbed on to your brother's waist, steadying his balance. After a few seconds, the growling stopped, the episode passed, and Kyle straightened back up, trying to look as normal as possible.

"Are you okay?" you said.

"Yeah," Kyle smiled weakly, "but as soon as we get off this thing, we need to find some food FAST!"

You nodded, and the next train pulled in. As soon as the gates opened, Kyle sped to his seat, which was larger than the previous one and allowed him to adequately, if not comfortably, close the shoulder restraint and fasten the buckle. The station attendant came by to check out the restraints, smiled, and gave him a thumbs up, which Kyle returned.

As the train pulled out of the station and around to the first lift hill, Kyle swung his legs freely in the air and threw up his hands. "Woooohooooo!" he called out. Happy to see your brother enjoying himself, you did the same, and as you did, Kyle clasped your hand with his.

Finally, you were at the top, and the train pulled around a small curve towards the big drop. Looking down, you felt your heart skip a beat. You had been on your share of roller coasters before, but few were as menacing as Death Mountain, and no matter how brave one was, staring at a 300 foot drop with nothing in front of you was nothing to sneeze at.

"HERE WE GO!!!" Kyle screamed.

The train began to speed down to the ground, and your and Kyle's screams grew louder and louder as you went faster and faster. At the bottom, the coaster flattened out to level track for a bit then hit a banked curve, the G forces throwing Kyle's body against yours slightly. You looked into your brother's face as you swept around the track, up the hills and through the loops and corkscrews, and each time it had a look of sheer wonder, joy, and amazement. You were relieved that he got to experience this while he still could.

Finally, after two-and-a-half minutes of non-stop screaming, the coaster came to a stop, and Kyle giggled ecstatically. As the train pulled into the station and the restraints popped loose, Kyle jumped up and grabbed you, lifting you out of your seat and twirling you around, giving you a big hug. "Thank you so much, big brother!" he exclaimed. "That was sooooo much fun!"

After the initial shock of being spun around, you chuckled and patted his back. "Yeah, it was! I'm glad you enjoyed it."
135232212112211221.title: Kyle's First, and Last, Roller Coaster

choices: Head to the supermarket and load up on bulk meats and foods to take home
Kyle was growing to fast and to much, ( He ends up out growing the car)
1352322121122112212.content:
As you headed out the exit, Lukas and Mark came running up towards you. "That looked sooooo cool!" Mark said. "Didja have fun?!"

Kyle grabbed Mark and nearly threw him up in the air in his enthusiasm. "Of course I did! I can't wait until you guys are big enough to try it!"

Mark laughed as Kyle sat him back down. As he did so, however, you heard Kyle's stomach roar with hunger. Kyle collapsed to his knees, nearly gasping. Lukas's and Mark's eyes went wide with fright. "Kyle?" Lukas asked. "What's wrong?"

Kyle looked up to you and grabbed your shirt by the collar. Only one word escaped his lips: "FOOD!"

You helped him back to his feet, and the four of you headed towards a food stand. Looking at the prices listed, you realized that buying enough food here to keep Kyle's hunger satiated would bankrupt you. "Listen, Kyle, we gotta go find some food outside the park. There's no way I can afford it here."

"But," Lukas protested, "we've only been on like two rides!"

"Hey," Mark said as he jabbed Lukas in the side with his elbow, "look at Kyle. He's not feeling good. We have to get him some help."

Kyle's eyes widened, and he began to frown. You could tell that your brother wanted to agree with you and be obedient, but his empty stomach was controlling him now. "Just-- just get something here to hold me over, even if it's just for a few minutes. Please, big bro." He looked at you with slightly watery eyes, and you felt your insides begin to twist in anguish.

Finally, you nodded in reluctant agreement and ran up to the stand, buying a large pretzel and a foot-long corn dog on a stick, setting you back eight dollars. Running back to Kyle, you offered it to him and he grabbed them feverishly. "C'mon," you said. "Eat while we head to the exit."

You started moving, jogging a little to keep up the pace. Behind you, Lukas and Mark watched in amazement as Kyle ate.

"Wow, you finished off that pretzel in like three seconds!" Lukas exclaimed.

"And, are ya -- oh my gosh!" Mark cried. "You ate that entire corn dog in one bite! Stick and all!"

You gulped, hoping that the stick Mark was referring to happened to be biodegradable, if not entirely edible. At this point, it would probably be helpful if Kyle's magic stomach could somehow digest things like that.

Finally, you exited the park, heading to your car. Kyle jumped in, and his stomach growled once more, only slightly less loud than before. He closed his eyes and let out a moan. "Let's get going!" he said, a little more forcibly than before. You could tell that the pretzel and corn dog wasn't helping much if at all, and you needed to find something for Kyle, and fast.

As you headed out the lot onto the main road, you began to think about all the things you were going to have to do for Kyle now. You hoped that the credit card your parents left had a high enough limit to be able to afford the increasing amounts of food he was needing. You had no idea where you were gonna find clothes for him tomorrow, or the next day, or after that. And, as you thought more, you realized that as he got bigger and bigger, he was going to be able to enjoy less and less of the things that a normal-sized kid takes for granted: hanging out with his friends, riding in the car, even just playing and having fun. They all were going to be harder, if not impossible, as Kyle continued to increase in size.

As your mind snapped back to driving, you glanced into your rear view mirror and noticed something. A black van had pulled out of the parking lot of the park at about the same time you did, and seemed to still be behind you now five minutes later. It kept the same distance from you at all times, about ten to twelve car lengths, and took all the same turns that you did. Your mind filled with thoughts of who it could be: the media, the police, people from the laboratory that Kyle had visited. Of course, maybe it was just someone who happened to live near you and was going the same direction. Whatever the case, it was one more worry that you now had to be concerned of.

Kyle continued to writhe in pain in the passenger seat, and you knew you had to find food fast. You couldn't go to the same buffet as yesterday, that was sure. And any other kind of restaurant wasn't much of an option, financially speaking.

"Big bro!" Kyle screamed in pain as his stomach rumbled again. "Please! I need food! NOW!"
1352322121122112212.title: Little Brother Needs FOOD, Badly!

choices: Camping out in the Garage! ("Look Kyle, a toga!", "That's...a bedsheet.)
"Lukas, what are you doing?!"  "Getting a ladder and a measuring tape, duh!"
13523221211221122122.content:
You almost swerved off the road when you heard your brother scream like that. Looking over in panic, you saw him sobbing quietly in his seat as his fists clenched over his growling stomach. Forget searching, forget creepy black vans, you were pulling over at the first place that said 'food'! Your brother needed you.

Turning off at practically the next light, you parked the car and told the three panicked - or pained - boys in no uncertain terms to stay in the car. Having given the order, you quickly dashed across the lot into a large, warehouse-looking building that was apparently called 'Bulk Produce and Surplus'. Hoping they didn't require memberships or something, you hustled past the carts and looked around, trying to hide how frantic you were getting.

A display just ahead looked promising. It held what looked like large boxes of surplus military ration bars. Thinking back to when an army rep last came to your school, you remembered that each bar had enough protein, calories, and nutrients for a grown man to live on for an entire day. You also remembered that they tasted like crap, but if Kyle was eating corndog sticks, you seriously doubted he cared.

Giving a heave at the surprising weight - those things were dense - you quickly hefted two boxes and ran over to the registers. Ignoring the curious looks you were getting from the cashier, you swiped your parent's credit card and tore out of the store the second she passed you the receipt.

You gasped for breath as you stumbled up to the passenger side of your car and thrust the boxes through the open window. Kyle was on them like a starved animal, ripping the cardboard apart violently and tearing wrappers with his teeth to get at the food. Thinking fast, you decided to try and get ahead of this thing a little, while you still could.
