"You three stay here; I'm going to got buy a lot of cheap bulk foods for later." You said, carefully looking Lukas and Mark in the eye. You knew Kyle wouldn't be going anywhere for a while.

When they nodded, you headed - at a saner pace - back into the store. Spending as little time as you could, you filled one of the large shopping carts they provided with what was probably half a cow and a year's worth of bread. Thinking about it, you also dumped in a chunk of their fresh produce section; you weren't sure, since he seemed fine, but Kyle might need the vitamins.

The cashier was definitely giving you some odd looks this time, but you just smiled and reloaded the food.

On the way back to your car, you paused, remembering something. Scanning the lot, you noticed a suspiciously familiar black van parked about as far from the building as it could get. Narrowing your eyes, you casually loaded up the back of your car and hopped in.

Total carnage. Horror stories could be written about the hideously dismembered boxes and wrappers piled up around your brother's gasping, sated frame. The goofy shirt he'd worn to the park, too small when he put it on, was bunched up above a serious gut. Mark and Lukas were both sitting silently in the back, wide eyes never leaving your brother; you hoped they weren't scared for life or something. And every last ration bar was gone.

Kyle looked over at you, an odd hung-over like look on his face, and smiled goofily.

"Thanks, bro." His grin got wider as his stomach seemed to purr. "Those bars are awesome! I didn't think two boxes would be enough, but - hic - wow! I never felt so full before in my life!

Kyle hiccuped again happily, and pulled on the side lever, lowering the seat back into a resting position. Mark scooted out from behind him and slid over to the middle seat, his wide eyes never leaving your brother.

"I'm glad you feel better, Kyle." You said, eying his stomach warily. "But I'm going to need all of you to buckle up and be ready; I think someone might be following us."

"Kay," Kyle murmured lazily as Mark and Lukas quickly checked their seatbelts.

Eyes on the van, you slowly pulled into the lot and headed to the side of the building. When the van quickly started and began to follow you, you knew you had to do something. Whoever they were, Kyle could not be caught this way; it was too dangerous. You needed to ditch them, fast!

"Hic!" SNAP!

Swerving slightly at the distraction, you slowly pushed the accelerator and shot a glance at your brother. Still in his reclined position, Kyle was shooting a half-worried, half-accusing look toward his belly button.

"My shorts popped." He said, in a slightly offended tone. His stomach gurgled.

"Well ya got kinda fat." Mark offered, earning a pouting glare from your brother.

Whipping around the building, you aimed your car at a rear access road, trying to look as far ahead as you could to see where you should turn next.

"Don't look like that Kyle," you said as comfortingly as you could while engaged in a low to high speed chase. "He's got a point; besides, that's better than if-"

"Hic!" BOOM

Everyone in the car jumped a bit, and you almost had a panic attack before you realized it wasn't the tires. Glancing to your right as you made a dangerously fast left turn, you saw Kyle looking towards the glove compartment with a slightly frightened look on his face.

"I think those were my sho-OOS!" He yelped out as his seatbelt suddenly dug into his waist and chest and his head fell off the back of the - fully extended - headrest.

"He's growing!" Lukas shouted as you made a right down a narrow ally.

"There's no room in here! We'll get smushed!" Mark yelled, shoving himself into Lukas as he pushed away from your brother.

"Calm down!" You shouted, hitting the break before you were sideswiped by a truck heading down the next road. Not even slowing all the way down, you pulled out behind it and floored it toward the highway.

"Big bro, can I open my seatbelt yet?" Kyle asked, in a pleading, wheezy voice while his fingers fumbled at the clasp. "There's no more room up here, I need to -"

Gurgle -

"Hic!"

SNAP

"Never mind," Kyle finished meekly as he pulled the remains of the seatbelt off and pushed himself back on the seat. With his legs stretched out, Kyle's waist was now resting halfway up the backrest, and everything from his shoulders up was lying on the back seat next to a nervous, crowded Mark.

Pulling onto the highway, you cast a nervous look behind you. The van was gone. You breathed a sigh of relief; so long as they didn't already know who you were, you were safe. You looked over at your brother, all seven and a half feet of him with a gurgling very-much-still-there stomach, and still growing.

"Kids, I've gotta take Kyle home first, then I can drop you two off." If you didn't hurry, you weren't sure Kyle would be able to squeeze out of the car! Already his arms were both draped along the footrest area of the back seats, and his legs were overfilling the front.

"No way I'm going home!" Lukas said, staring. "I wanna stay with Kyle. This is so cool!"

"Um..y-yeah." Mark stammered, looking over at your brother, who's arm was almost as long as the back seat was wide. "I wanna stay too."

You sighed a bit, turning toward home. The clincher of course were the pleading puppydog eyes your brother was shooting you.

"I'll call your parents and ask them." You caved. "Kyle could use some friends right now. Just don't tell them anything, okay?"

"Thanks big bro." Kyle murmered, slipping back into that contented fatigue he'd fallen into before the panic with the van started.

"You're welcome, Kyle."

"Hic-" THUNK "oowwww..."

"Cool." Lukas muttered as he watched Kyle rub his head.
13523221211221122122.title: Buying Bulk

choices: You wake up in the morning up to the sound of the phone ringing.
You wake up in the middle of the night to the sound of the house collapsing.
135232212112211221221.content:
Once you pulled onto your street, you looked around to make sure that the black van (or any other suspicious vehicle, for that matter) hadn't caught back up with you and resumed their pursuit. You weren't sure what you would have done if they had; another high speed chase with Kyle in the shape he was in probably wouldn't have turned out very well. Luckily, you were all clear.

Turning into your driveway, you hit the garage door opener and parked your car inside, quickly closing the door behind. You sighed in relief. At least for tonight, Kyle was safe.

You stepped out of the car and opened the back door for Lukas and Mark to get out, which they did in a hurry. Looking at your brother, you noticed that he had actually started dozing. Realizing in the back of your mind what that could mean, you ran over to his side, opened the door, and shook his shoulders. "Kyle!" you said loudly. "Wake up!"

Kyle jumped up a little, causing the seat to make an unwelcome CRAAAACK sound. He looked over to you with a bit of a panicked look in his eyes, only to relax when he saw your face. "Oh, sorry big bro," he yawned. "I just got kinda sleepy."

"Well," you muttered as you tugged at his arm, "try to get out of my car first! I don't think it'd be good for the resale value for you to burst through the ceiling and destroy the interior." You shot him a wink, and he giggled softly.

As he tried to get up, though, it became clear that getting out of the car wasn't going to be so easy. "Oooof!" he groaned. "I think I'm stuck!"

"Uh oh," Mark said, wide-eyed. "You might have to cut the metal open to get him out!"

"You mean like with the jaws of life?" Lukas asked, getting excited. "Awesome!"

You frowned at the boys. "Stop that. We're not cutting up my car. Kyle's not that big… yet," you gulped at this last word. Turning your attention back to Kyle, you tried your best to calm and reassure him. "Now, Kyle, you need to just try to squeeze yourself as small as possible. It might feel really tight and pinching, but you can do it, just one step at a time.

Seeing your confidence, Kyle nodded, and began to twist and turn, eventually getting his legs out on the garage floor, then slowly sliding the rest of the way until he was free, sitting on your floor. Seeing him squeeze and contort his body to get out sorta reminded you of the clown car at the circus. You rolled your eyes at this thought, chuckling.

"Ahh, that's better," Kyle said. He started to stand up, but he did so a little too fast, and you heard a loud RIPPP as his t-shirt tore up the back and sides, falling to the ground in tatters.

"Oops," Kyle said with a sheepish grin on his face, "I guess that's the end of that shirt." Bare-chested, you could see that his belly still was pretty rounded from the feasting of the protein bars, though it had shrunk somewhat during the car ride. Kyle tugged on his shorts, the only article of clothing he had left, which themselves were looking like they might tear apart at any moment.

"Wow, Kyle," Mark said, craning his neck upward to look at his giant friend, "how much did you grow?"

"Your head can touch the ceiling!" Lukas exclaimed, pointing.

Sure enough, when Kyle stood all the way up, if he got on his tiptoes his hair would brush against the ceiling of the garage. You weren't quite sure how high the ceiling was in here, but you knew it certainly was higher than anywhere else inside. You figured Kyle had to be close to nine feet tall. Thankfully, your house had a three-car garage, so he had a little bit of room here.

"Um, Kyle," you said, scratching your head, "how do you feel about sleeping in the garage with Lukas and Mark tonight?"

"Oooh, that sounds fun!" Lukas exclaimed. "I've never slept in a garage before."

"Are we gonna sleep on the cement floor?" Mark asked, cocking his head to the side slightly.

"I think we have a few sleeping bags for you two," you said. "As for Kyle, well… we'll figure something out."

Asking Kyle to stay as close to the back of the garage as possible, you opened the door again and backed your car out, parking it on the street to free up the maximum amount of space available for the sleepover (and, you realized, for Kyle's probable growth spurt during the night). Quickly running back inside, you closed the garage door for the final time of the evening.

You ran up to your room to grab the sleeping bags and brought them downstairs, tossing them to Mark and Lukas. Thinking of what you could do for Kyle, there was only one idea that seemed reasonable. One at a time, you brought the mattresses from Kyle's, yours, your parents', and the guest room's beds down, laying them out side-by-side to form one long super-mattress. You then went up and grabbed all the linens you could find, bringing them down and stretching them across the mattresses, forming a makeshift bed for Kyle to lie down on. For a moment, you thought that your parents would get upset at you for dirtying up all of the mattresses and bedsheets in the house, but you realized that was probably the least of your worries.

"Thanks, big bro," Kyle said as you finished orientating the sheets. "That'll work fine."

"Don't mention it, Kyle," you said with a tired smile.

"It's just…" you saw Kyle's face begin to get serious, and you tilted your head, waiting for him to collect his thoughts. "You've been so great these past few days while I've been going through these… changes. I … I don't know what I'd do without you. I … I love you, big bro. And I promise, whenever I'm able to, I'll make it up to you."

Your eyes were watering, and you were speechless. Kyle had never been so open, so honest, so kind to you before. Sure, you knew that he always saw you as a role model and that he loved you, but there was something else here, something that made you realize your connection had grown deeper over this experience. Despite everything that had happened, despite all of the headaches and the fright and the work you had to put into taking care of your growing brother, the bond you two had formed made it all worthwhile.

Leaning against his side, you wrapped your arms around his chest, barely able to encircle his torso fully. "Kyle…" you looked up at him and notice that he was starting to cry too. "You don't know how much I needed to hear that, how good that makes me feel. I promise that, as long as I can, I'll keep taking care of you, no matter what."

Kyle wrapped his arms around you and softly gave you a squeeze, apparently becoming more aware and considerate of his size and strength. Pressing your face against his soft, smooth chest, you could feel the beating of his large heart, a beating that comforted you greatly.

"Awwww," Lukas said, a tinge of sarcasm in his voice, "how sweeeeet!"

"Shut up," Mark hissed, punching him in the arm, "they're having a moment!"

Chuckling, you turned around and put your hands on both boys' heads, mussing their hair. "Now, I think it's time for you three to go to bed, hmmm?"

"Already?" Lukas whined. "It's only 9:30."

As you nodded, the room was suddenly filled with what sounded like a lion's roar. Spinning around, you saw that it was just Kyle yawning, stretching his arms up in the air as he did. He noticed that the three of you were staring at him, and he covered his mouth, grinning. "Sorry, guys," he said.

The boys lied down for the night. Before closing his eyes, Kyle turned, looked at you and asked, "Hey, big bro? What are we gonna do about clothes for me tomorrow?"

"Ummmm…" you stammered. You hadn't really thought that far ahead.

"You could wrap the bedsheets around you, like a toga," Mark suggested.

"Well," you said as you sat on the steps leading to the rest of the house, "we'll figure that out tomorrow. In the mean time, it's lights out. Good night, boys." You flicked the light switch, blanketing the garage in darkness, save for a small window in the back where moonlight trickled in.

"Good night," all three boys said in unison.

Staying seated, you made sure to watch until they had all fallen asleep, just to be safe. As you did so, you realized something. The past couple of days, Kyle hadn't grown a whole lot (relatively) immediately after he had eaten, with the majority of his growth coming while he slept. Today, however, he had grown at least a foot and a half, probably more, in the car ride home. Some of that could possibly have been due to the nap he had taken in the car, but that had only been for a few minutes.

You also remembered that Kyle said, after he had eaten both boxes of protein bars, that he'd "never felt so full before in my life." You knew that the two boxes represented over a month's worth of rations, which would be way more food than Kyle had eaten until now. You hoped against hope that wouldn't make matters any worse than they had to be.

As you heard loud snoring coming from Kyle, and noticed that Lukas and Mark had each stopped tossing and turning, one more thought came to your mind: tomorrow was Monday, and you had school. Somehow, you thought as you smiled, you didn't think you were gonna be able to attend.

Standing up and slowly opening the door so as to not wake the boys, you headed into the living room and collapsed onto the couch, exhausted from the day's activities. Within minutes, you were fast asleep.
135232212112211221221.title: Garage Slumber Party

choices: The boys are still sleeping, but Kyle's body has filled up the garage!
The garage is empty! All three boys are gone!
1352322121122112212211.content:
A ringing sound woke you up in the morning. At first, you thought it was the alarm next to your bed, but then you remembered where you were. Opening your eyes, you saw the daylight pouring through the windows, and the clock in the living room read: 8:15. "Man," you said to yourself, "I must've been conked out for a while."

Sitting up, you slowly realized that the ringing sound you were hearing was the telephone in the kitchen. Jumping to your feet, you rushed over to pick it up, only to hear a dial tone at the end. "Must've just missed 'em," you said. "Oh well, if it's important enough, they'll call ba--."

You stopped mid-word as the phone started ringing again. Now slightly worried, you picked it up and brought it to your face. "Hello?" you said.

"Oh, thank god it's you!" You recognized the voice as Dr. Hendersen, Kyle's pediatrician. There was a hint -- okay, more like a truckload -- of panic in his voice.

"What's the matter?"

"We got the results back from Kyle's blood tests this morning, and as soon as I opened them, I knew I had to call you first thing." This didn't sound good, you thought. "Tell me, has Kyle been eating at an excessive level, maybe even gorging, recently?"

"Ummm…." you trailed off as you tried to think whether or not you should let the doctor know the truth. One one hand, if he knew, he'd probably call the cops or worse. But, if there's something in Kyle's blood-work that's causing the doctor to get in hysterics like this, he might already know more than you do.

"Hello?"

"Yes," you finally said, deciding to answer all the doctor's questions truthfully. "Yes, he has."

"That's what I feared. Listen, I don't quite know how to explain this -- in fact, I'm not sure I even understand it myself -- but there seems to have been some sort of massive change in Kyle's metabolism, one that's previously unheard of. The enzymes that break down nutrients from food and fuel growth were found in astronomical numbers in his blood. That, in turn, has led to an unbelievable amount of growth hormones."

"How bad is it?" you asked, twisting the phone cord in your hands.

"We're talking tens, if not hundreds, of thousands times the normal amount. I've never seen anything like this before, and it might explain why your brother grew so much over the past year. It's truly remarkable and amazing, but being something that there's never been any medical experience in, there's really no telling what could happen to him or how much it could end up hurting him. I mean, thirteen inches and ninety pounds in less than a year is unheard of!"

"Well--" You started to say something but then stopped yourself, unsure of how to put your thoughts into words.

"What?" Dr. Hendersen detected the hesitation in your voice. "Is there something you haven't told us?"

You sighed, partially relieved to finally be telling an adult this, and partially terrified. "It wasn't thirteen inches in less than a year. It was thirteen inches in less than a day."

There was a pause at the other end. "What?!" Dr. Hendersen dragged out the word, somewhat dramatically, you thought.

"Kyle's gorging, and his growing, only started the night before I took him to see you. Before then, he was only a little more than what he had been at last year's checkup."

"H-how could this be? That's unbelievable! Why didn't you tell me at the appointment?"

"Well," you gulped, "partially because I was afraid Kyle might get turned over to the military or worse if someone found out. Partially because I figured if something was seriously wrong you'd find it out anyways."

"Yeah, but…" Dr. Hendersen stopped, and for over ten seconds there was silence on the other line. "…Well," he finally said, "What happened happened. I don't understand how it happened, but it happened. We just need to try to take care of it before it gets out of hand."

"Umm, about that…"

"There's more?"

You nodded, then realized that did no good over the phone. "Since seeing you on Saturday, he's grown substantially more."

"How much more?"

"As of last night…" You did some quick math in your head, then gulped again. "…approximately four more feet."

After a little bit more silence, you could've sworn you heard the sound of a body collapsing to the floor. You hoped you didn't make Dr. Hendersen faint. "Doctor?" you asked.

"Do…" his breathing had become heavier, he was clearly frightened and upset, "Do you mean to tell me that Kyle's nine feet tall?!"

"At least," you confirmed. "I haven't checked on him this morning yet, though."

"Where is he now?"

"Out in the garage. That's where he slept last night."

"Listen," Dr. Hendersen's voice suddenly got lower, "I need to see Kyle immediately. Don't worry, I want to help keep him safe. But if this growth continues to keep going on unchecked like this…"

As Dr. Hendersen's voice trailed off, you noticed an odd clicking sound. At first, you thought it was a bad connection. But then, you remembered what you had learned about phone tapping from studying the Watergate hearings in school. "Did you hear that?" you asked.

"Hear what?" Dr. Henderson replied. CLICK CLICK

Horrified, you immediately hung up the phone. Your head swirled as you tried to figure out what to do. The laboratory, the black van, the phone tapping, Dr. Hendersen -- there were too many components to straighten out, not to mention Kyle himself.

"Kyle!" you exclaimed, realizing that you hadn't checked up on him yet. Rushing to the garage door, your heart pounding in your chest, you flung it open, only to see...
1352322121122112212211.title: Important Call

13523221211221122122111.content:
Kyle.

You saw Kyle. Lots of Kyle. Lots of him.

The room almost seemed to vibrate with his light snores. It was way hotter and more humid in the garage than it had any business being. And your little brother was taking up both car stalls, on his side with his back pressed to the wall and his feet and ankles sticking past the ends of the super-mattress you made for him last night. Curled into his side, looking like a pair of pet kittens, were Mark and Lukas.

You did some fast mental math. Two beds by two beds was between twelve and fourteen feet long and eight feet wide. To make that fit in the garage, you'd had to follow the shape of the room, which was wider than it was deep. Your brother now stretched almost from one end of the room to the other, and was taking up half a car length from side to side. He was at least fifteen feet tall, double his height from yesterday!

You were never giving him military food again. Ever.

The food!

Cursing under your breath, you quickly tore outside to your car and threw open the trunk. After all the excitement yesterday, you completely forgot to put away all of the bulk food you bought! Eying the packaged raw meat warily, you began the slow, laborious task of dragging it all inside.

Kyle seemed to sniff the air in his sleep as you passed with the food. His giant tongue darted out and licked his lips for a moment, before he rolled slightly, mumbling to himself in sleep.

"Ugg...he....hey! HEEELLLPPP!" Lukas yelped as he was pressed into the mattress by your brother's rolling weight. Eyes wide and awake in a second, the small boy tore out from under Kyle and was halfway across the garage before he'd even blinked. Then he looked back and blinked. A lot.

"Whoa..." he breathed, walking slowly back toward your brother. From side to side, Kyle was actually as tall as his friend, or at least very very close. He must look like a big, breathing wall to Lukas. You hoped he wasn't too scared.

...Was he poking your brother in the gut?!?

"Hehe..." he laughed, sinking his fist slowly into Kyle's side. "Poke. Wakey wakey Kyle...Don't kill Mark, he likes you...oof!"

Kyle shifted in his sleep and his arm smacked down, pinning Lukas to the mattress. Lukas shoved up futilely, trying to move out from under it.

"You deserve that." You stated in a calm, dry tone. Ignoring his increasingly loud protests, you dropped off the groceries and went back to the car. One good thing about the trip; it was giving you time to once again reprocess your brother's size.

When you next came into the garage, all three boys were awake. Evidently even if Lukas couldn't move Kyle's arm, he could still be loud and annoying until he woke up. The smaller boys were now sitting away from Kyle in the garage and looking up into his eyes. Kyle was sitting on the mattress, wearing a bed sheet around his waist and an exaggerated expression of innocence on his face. There was a brand new hole in the ceiling and bits of sheet-rock in his hair. You decided not to say anything.

"Um, hi, bro." Kyle's voice sounded...odd. Not deeper, exactly, but it had a strange echo effect, like if Kyle were normal sized but speaking loudly in a big room. It was strange. And it looked like he could hear it too.

"Morning, Kyle!" You slapped on a grin and ducked into the kitchen quickly. "Hungry?" You called, putting food away.

"I am!" Lukas shouted from the garage.

You grinned. Of course, everyone else had to eat, too.

"Nope." Kyle called out. "I don't think so. But it's kinda hot in here, can we open the door?"

"Um," you hesitated. "How about I push the button and open the door a crack? That'll let the air flow a bit."

"Okay..." Kyle answered dubiously as he watched you start and stop the door. From his point of view, the crack you made was probably really tiny.

Sighing, you decided you really couldn't put off dealing with your brother's increased...ness anymore. Looking up into his solemn expression, you calmly plopped down on the concrete steps leading to the kitchen.

"Kyle, you are really, really big." You stated simply. All three boys looked at you like you were stupid.

"Uh, yes." Kyle nodded, looking down at his friends. "Yes I am. Um, thank you?"

You rolled your eyes.

"What I mean is, that yesterday was apparently the last day we were going to be able to hide this outside. I didn't know you were going to get this big, but now that you are, things have changed."

Now Kyle was looking a bit worried.

"Remember how I wanted to keep this a secret?" You asked. Kyle nodded. "I want to keep you safe, Kyle. And happy. I thought maybe you'd slow down or stop growing. But you aren't stopping. You even seem to be growing faster, and I don't have any way of predicting a pattern or a reason or anything. Dr. Hendersen called and even he was confused and concerned. There are already severe material problems with being your size," you gestured toward his 'toga', "and that'll only get worse if you keep growing. And even if we wanted too, we can't keep hiding anymore."

Kyle sniffled. Eyes wide, you ran over to his side and hugged him. Nope, those hands of yours were not touching. No way.

"It's okay, Kyle. I'm not mad. But I'm scared, and it's okay if you are too. But we need to do something. Find a way to make this stop without hurting you. I don't ever want to see you in as much pain as you were in yesterday ever again."

Lukas and Mark both nodded firmly at that.

"Wh-what are we gonna do?" Kyle asked nervously, biting his lip.

"I...don't know." You admitted. "We could talk to the lab people after all; maybe they can fix this, or stop it. Or we could go to Dr. Hendersen and see if he has a plan. But I think someone is watching him, it sounded like his phone was being tapped. You know what that means?"

Kyle nodded, and quickly explained to Lukas and Mark.

"So like, James Bond or something is after you?" Mark asked, looking up.

"Or something." You nodded, not really sure if that was true. At least it gave them the right idea.

"It should be your decision, Kyle," you added softly, "even if you decide to let me decide. I'm your big brother, but it's your life."

"I'm scared." Kyle admitted, shaking slightly. The windows rattled a bit.

"I know. Me too."

"I thought getting really big would be so cool." Kyle said, looking down at you. "But now a bunch of people are chasing us, and I don't like how it feels to get so hungry. It hurts so bad."

"Hey," you smacked his side. (He might have felt that, you weren't sure. You definitely did. Ow.)

"It'll be okay." You promised. "We'll find a way to stop you from getting so hungry. We'll make it stop hurting. Then we'll sign you up for the NBA and all get super rich."

Kyle giggled a bit as you hugged his side.

"Okay." He said firmly, putting on a brave face.

"Let's -
13523221211221122122111.title: Double Parked

135232212112211221221111.content:
"Let's go see Dr. Hendersen," Kyle decided after a moment's thought. "He's always been nice to me, and besides, you said he already knows, so he'll be less likely to freak out."

You nodded, smiling up at your brother's eyes. "Those sound like as good of reasons as any." Now you just had to figure out how to get there.

As you considered the matter, a low rumbling sound filled your ears. Oh no, you thought, not this again, not this early! You started to panic, but when you looked up into Kyle's eyes, he didn't show any signs of pain like before. You tilted your head to the side, trying to figure out what was happening.

Kyle saw your questioning look and his eyes widened. "Don't look at me!" he protested. "I'm completely full!"

"Then who...?"

The two of you looked over at Lukas, who's face was contorted in grossly exaggerated pain. "That was MEEE!" he exclaimed. "Mark and I didn't get anything to eat last night, and we're starving!" His friend emphatically nodded his head in agreement.

Grinning, you shook your head, burying your face in your palm. After what you had been through the past few days with Kyle, somehow dealing with two normal 8-year-old boys' appetites didn't seem like that big of a deal.

"Go into the kitchen," you instructed Lukas and Mark, "and help yourselves to some breakfast. There should be some cereal boxes in the pantry next to the refrigerator, and milk's on the bottom shelf."

Lukas and Mark jumped up and raced to the kitchen, nearly running into each other as they bounded up the steps out of the garage. "I hope they have Cocoa Pebbles!" Lukas exclaimed.

"Eww, yuk!" you could see Mark stick out his tongue. "I hope not. I want Froot Loops!"

You smiled, turning back to Kyle. He also had a smile on his face, but there was a tinge of sadness in his eyes. You sat down in his lap, looking up at his sparkling greenish-blue eyes. "What's wrong?"

Kyle looked down at you for a moment, then looked away, towards the kitchen. "Well...I was thinking of what it'd be like to be four feet tall again."

You were a little surprised by this, but it made sense after all that had happened. "Is that what you want, Kyle? I thought you had said you enjoyed being big."

"At first. Now it's just getting too hard. I want to be able to go play with my friends like normal, run around - be a kid, not a freak."

"Hey," you stood up in his lap, trying to get to Kyle's eye level, but only coming up to his neck. "Don't say that. You're not a freak. No matter how big you get, you're still my brother, and you're still one awesome boy."

"I guess so…" Kyle's voice trailed off. You could tell that he was still depressed, and it tore you apart inside to see him like this. If only...

You realized that now was the time to tell him your big secret. "Hey, Kyle," you said, sitting back against his crossed feet and looking into his face, "do you remember a year or so ago when you asked me why I would spend more time with you than your friends' older brothers?"

Kyle looked at you curiously and he nodded. "Yeah, I think so."

"Remember what I told you then?"

"Ummm…."

"I told you that you were special. That something was different about you than all the other boys."

"Right," Kyle rubbed his chin with his hand, beginning to remember. "But you wouldn't tell me why."

"That's true," I answered. "Do you wanna know now?"

You now had your brother's full attention, his eyes fixated on you. "Of course."

You breathed in deeply. "Okay. Well, when I was 7, I had begged and begged Mom and Dad to make a little brother. I wanted someone to play with, someone to look up to me. But Dad told me that they weren't able to have any more kids, that there was something wrong with Mom that would keep her from getting pregnant again."

You saw the gears turning in Kyle's head and knew he was still with you. "Well, that night, I went into my room, and I knelt down and just prayed. I didn't know who or what I was praying to, but I prayed and wished so hard that Mom would get better, so that I could have a baby brother."

Speechless, Kyle's eyes began to mist up slightly. You yourself weren't too far behind. You could feel both your hearts beating a little faster.

"The next week, Mom went to the doctor and found out she was pregnant with you. I knew right then that my wish had been answered, that you were a gift, you were special. And you know what, Kyle?" You wrapped your arms around his stomach, giving him the biggest hug you could. "You're still special. To Lukas and Mark, to Mom and Dad… and most importantly, to me."

Tears falling down his cheeks now, Kyle picked you up off of his lap, bringing you close to his face and giving you a tight but tender squeeze. "Thank you, big bro," he said.

"No, Kyle," you said as you looked into his eyes, "thank you. For being you. An energetic, outgoing, fun, and most of all loving little brother. Or, I should say now, bigger little brother."

Kyle giggled at this, then sat you back down on your feet. He wiped his eyes with his hands, as you did the same. After a few moments of silence, he asked, "Do you think that Dr. Hendersen will be able to shrink me back to my old height?"

"I don't know," you said, rubbing your hand lightly against his back in a comforting manner. "People typically aren't able to shrink down once they've grown tall." You shrugged a little, then looked back up at him, trying your best to convey hope through your eyes. "I guess we'll just have to find out when we see him."

"Well, it's okay if he can't, but I still hope he can. I want to be able to have fun with Lukas and Mark again."

As if on cue, you heard footsteps galloping down the stairs. You spun around, only to see Lukas rushing towards you with seemingly manic eyes. "CANNONBALL!!!!" he screamed, jumping up at Kyle and landing against his stomach.

"OOF!" Kyle grunted as he fell back a little.

Lukas buried his head in Kyle's belly button for a few seconds, then bolted up, grasping Kyle's skin tightly. "KYYYYLLLEE!" Lukas yelled. "You're soooooo huuuge! It's awesome!" The small boy began to laugh hysterically, and Kyle, laughing too, picked up Lukas under the armpits and began swinging him through the air.

Mark stood in the doorway, shaking his head. "He found the Cocoa Puffs," he said, grinning in embarrassment. "And the sugar packets. And the Mountain Dew."

Rolling your eyes, you swore to yourself that you'd never let Lukas go through your food supplies unsupervised again. It was great, though, to see how excited and energetic he was, and how happy he had made Kyle. It seemed like your brother had completely forgotten about the worries he had expressed just moments before.

Leaving the three boys in the garage for a few minutes longer, you walked into the house and over to the kitchen phone, trying to decide how the heck you were going to get Kyle to see Dr. Hendersen. With his phone tapped, calling him at his office was completely out of the question. Hopefully, your parents had some other way of contacting him. Thumbing through your Mom's address book, you found Dr. Hendersen, his main office number listed first. Underneath it, thankfully, was a cell phone number, with "EMERGENCIES ONLY" written in red ink and underlined three times. You figured the doctor probably wouldn't have a problem considering this some sort of emergency.

You punched in the number. It rang twice before you heard the other line pick up. "Hello?" It was Dr. Hendersen's voice. You listened closely to make sure you didn't hear any clicking sound this time, and after several seconds of silence, you said, "Dr. Hendersen, it's me."

"Thank God," he exclaimed. "I had no idea what had happened to you."

"Listen," you said, "we can't stay on long. I think someone's tapping your office phone."

"Tapped?" The surprise and skepticism in his voice was obvious.

"Yes. I can't really explain right now. But you need to see Kyle. I'm not quite sure how though."

"Did he grow again over night?" His voice seemed a little less shocked by the idea than during your previous call.

"Yes," you confirmed. "He's now over fifteen feet tall."

Dr. Hendersen whistled. "Wow. Unbelievable. Well, the way I see it, there's two options. You can steal a pickup truck, throw Kyle in the back, drive the twenty minutes across town to my office and hope against hope that no one sees you…"

You waited a few seconds for him to finish, having to finally say, "…Or?"

"Or I can make a house call."

You breathed a sigh of relief. "That'd be great, Dr. Hendersen."

"Give me ten minutes to get my patients rescheduled then another twenty to drive over. So I'll see you two at, say, 9:30?"

"Got it," you said, and hung up.
135232212112211221221111.title: Getting Ready For The Doctor

choices: Back with Kyle...A Stranger at the Door!
Back with Kyle...Dr. Hendersen Finally Arrives!
1352322121122112212211112.content:
"Ms. Johnson?"

A young woman in a white lab coat irritably blew a strand of hair out of her face and continued typing at an elaborate workstation.

"Ms. Johnson?"

Satisfied with her latest entry, she pushed up her glasses from where they'd fallen from her admittedly bad typing posture and saved her progress. Only - she grimaced - fifty more stacks of data to go. Yay.

"Caroline?"

"Hm?" Blinking to adjust her eyes, Chief Geneticist Johnson sat up and spun her ergonomic chair toward the door. Wincing as several joints popped, she quickly rose and met her assistant.

"Sorry, Lee, I didn't hear you." Her expression became concerned. "It isn't one of those kids, is it?"

"No, miss. They're all responding to the appetite-suppression treatment, and we've had them set up for free annual checkups and injections for life. And promised a permanent genetic shutdown as soon as we figure one out. We might still get out of this without a major settlement."

"Thank god." She muttered, taking the stack of papers Lee was holding out.

"So what is this about, then? We've already explained there should be no further HOLY-"

Mouth gaping, Caroling stared at the photo in her hand; a young boy wandering through an amusement park with friends. One of whom was on his shoulders...seven feet in the air.

"How did this happen?" She - quietly - shrieked, rushing over to her computer and pulling up a class register from last week's sponsored tour.

"Our best guess is the boy had enough of the right genetic markers for the modifications to fully take." Lee answered promptly. "We've already compiled a list of every child who hasn't been brought in for a checkup. It was under the photo."

"Oh..." She muttered distractedly. Spinning back around, Caroline threw her head into her hands.

"This is terrible! He could be in terrible danger; the BabeGen comlex was meant for cows! What if something's already gone wrong? It could be killing him!"

"He looks alright." Lee offered consolingly as he crouched down beside her chair and wrapped an arm over her shoulder. "I already had our best diagnostician look at the photo; it isn't much to work with, but she didn't see anything off...other than the size, anyway."

"Why didn't he come in? This is definitely what I would call an 'odd symptom'" She shivered. "And there's other problems to consider. What if our competitors find him? What if the government gets wind of potential human applications for our work? I don't want to make super soldiers; I just want to end world hunger!"

"If it comes to that," Lee mused, "better our competition finds him. They might at least have the resources to stop this."

"Lee, you sweet naive fool." Caroline looked at him with a mix of fondness, exasperation and fear. She pointed at the photo. "We're looking at billions of dollars in genetic advancement. And the only way to know everything that the modification is doing, so they could replicate it, would be," she shuddered, "dissection."

Lee paled.

"They wouldn't..."

"It only takes one greedy immoral scientist." Caroline sighed. "And we have more than one working for us. We have to find him. We have to fix this."

"Can you fix this, Miss Johnson?"

"I...don't know." She finally admitted. "The cows stop growing when they reach adulthood; that at least gives us a last-ditch plan. But inducing puberty in an eight-year-old is never pretty, and I don't know how the treatment would react with the genes. Our appetite inhibitors should slow the process down, and that would buy us some time. But we have to find him first, and get him to trust us enough to help."

She growled. "And hire Barry back, so we can fire him again."
1352322121122112212211112.title: Interlude: At the Lab...

choices: Mr. Hendersen, come in.  Yes, Kyle is stuck, nice of you to notice
13523221211221122122111121.content:
Half an hour can be a very long time for an eight year old. It seems way longer for someone watching an eight year old. Or at least, that's what your friends from school tell you. You've never really had a problem watching Kyle, or hanging out with him. And this morning, at least, things were so weird you didn't think you could get bored if you tried.

Your little (ginormous) brother was currently amusing himself by arm-wrestling Lukas and Mark. That is, Lukas and mark were both pushing as hard as they could, with their whole bodies, against Kyle's raised arm as he lounged across the back of the garage. The smart money was on Kyle.

"Errg...can't go on...too...much..." Kyle moaned theatrically, hamming it up as he let his friends push his arm back. Then, quick as lightning, he popped his fist back up to the middle position. Lukas and Mark almost fell backwards to the floor.

"Help us!" Lukas shouted, giggling.

"Yeah, let's get him!" Mark cheered, redoubling his efforts.

Shrugging, you rolled your shoulders, locked a challenging gaze with your brother, and prepared to charge.

Knock Knock Knock

Kyle dropped his arm. (Which he then had to use to catch his friends, who hadn't stopped pushing and started to fall over his wrist.) Gulping nervously, he turned to the door.

"That was fast." You muttered. "I thought it'd take longer to..."

You caught a glimpse through the window. It wasn't Dr. Hendersen.

"Kyle." You said as loudly as you dared. "There's a stranger at the door. You need to hide."

"Where?" He asked desperately. Good point. You cast your eyes around the room; maybe there was a tarp or something to cover him, he was way too big to fit through the...

Wait.

Kyle was far too tall for the door. And far to wide. But on his side...you tried to picture it. It looked alright.

"Go through the door." You hissed, making a gesture to hurry. "Go sideways, you should fit. Just...crawl through the kitchen and into the living room."

Nodding, wide-eyed, Kyle scrambled over to the door and slithered through into the kitchen. On his side, he was quite tall in the doorway, but there was easily enough room. Just when the knocking became really insistent, he'd vanished. Sweating, you grabbed the knob and cracked the door; you made sure the security chain was latched.

"Y-yes?" You asked, taking a breath.

In front of you was a friendly looking man in some sort of work outfit. He offered you a bright smile and brought up a clear wallet with an ID.

"Hi there! My name's Todd, and I work for the electric company. We've noticed some odd fluctuations in your usage, and the boss sent me down to check your breakers for problems."

Looking past him into the street, you saw a van on the opposite curb that looked like a pretty common generic repair van. It even had a cherry picker.

Still...

"I'm sorry," you stated calmly, "my parents aren't home a the moment, is there any way I could schedule an appointment?"

For a second, the man looked frustrated, and a bit angry. But as quick as it appeared, the expression smoothed out into disappointment and worry.

"That's a shame. I really need to see the box; electrical shorts big enough for us to notice could be really dangerous. It's your call, kid, but you need to get an electrician in here right away."

"Oh!" You smiled. "Well we have an electrician we've used before; I'll make an appointment with him. Nothing personal, but my parents don't want me to let people in the house that they haven't met."

"...Right." Quick as the wind, the man bent forward and peered into the dark inside of your garage.

"You all alone out here? I thought I heard voices."

"Slumber party." You answered shortly, your hand now firmly gripping the door. "I really need to get back inside now, guests to think about and stuff."

Before he could answer, you shut the door and turned the bolt. As slow as you dared, you walked into the kitchen. Lukas showed up at the same time, rushing in from the living room.

"Quick, you have to help!"

"What is it?" You asked, running into the living room. You froze, staring.

There, at the stairwell, around eye level was Kyle's bedsheet-covered butt.

"He wanted to go see his room again." Mark called from upstairs. "And...well.."

Kyle fidgeted, shuffling his feet and generally looking miserable and embarrassed.

"I'm stuck."
13523221211221122122111121.title: Hide and Seek

choices: You try to find food for Kyle to eat.
135232212112211221221111211.content:
"Kyle..." you buried your face in your hands, your nervousness only increasing as you tried to figure out what to do about your stuck brother. As potentially dangerous as the situation was getting, you couldn't help but smile. Your mind drifted to that scene in Winnie the Pooh where Pooh got stuck in Rabbit's door for a whole week after eating too much honey. You knew you couldn't let Kyle be in this position for that long; at the very least, the house would soon not be able to hold his steadily-growing frame.

"Why'd you think that you could fit up the stairs, as big as you are?" Mark asked, shaking his head and chuckling a little.

"I don't knooooow!" Kyle let out a small whine. "I...I was just trying to... Ughhhhh!" The frustration was clearly getting to him. He started squirming back and forth, trying to wiggle himself free, to no avail.

As your big-brotherly instincts took over, your nervousness melted away, and you walked up to Kyle's legs, patting him gently on the back of his thigh, surprised to feel how tense his leg muscles felt. "It's gonna be okay, Kyle. C'mon, we'll get ya outta there!"

You turned to the two small boys, who were looking at you, eagerly awaiting instruction. "Okay, Lukas and Mark, you climb over Kyle's body and try pushing from that end. I'll pull from here, and Kyle, you can try to flex and wiggle free as we do so. Got it?"

"Got it!" all three boys said in unison. Lukas quickly jumped up Kyle's leg and climbed onto his back, then turned around and hoisted up Mark, both boys then hopping dan to the top of the stair landing. They got into position, one at each of Kyle's shoulders, as you grabbed ahold of both of his feet, each one now almost as big as your torso, in your hands.

"Okay, boys, on three! One, two, THREE!!"

The four of you grunted and wheezed as everyone put everything they could into getting Kyle free. Both Mark and Lukas closed their eyes and shoved Kyle down the stairs with as much force as their little bodies could generate. Your brother wiggled his body as much as he could, trying to break himself free. You could see the plaster on the walls begin to come off as Kyle's hips pressed against them.

"Ow! Owwwowowow!" Kyle's cries boomed throughout the entire house.

"Hang on there, bro!" you called out, trying to pull even harder.

But it was no use. Kyle was stuck, and the walls wouldn't seem to give way. "Okay, guys," you finally huffed out, "hold on for a minute."

The boys all stopped pushing, each one taking a deep breath. "We're going to have to figure out something different here," you said, rubbing your hand with your chin. As you did so, though, an unwelcome sound began to fill the air.

RUUUMMBBLEEERUUMMMMBBLEEERRRRRUUUMMMBBBLLLEEEE!!!!!

The walls of the house shook so hard that the glass in the window at the top of the stairs started to crack.

Mark and Lukas looked at the broken window, then at each other, and finally at Kyle's face. "Uh oh..." Lukas said. 

"Uhhhh," Mark called down to you, "we might want to hurry!!"

You didn't have to be told, but you had no idea of what you should do. "Kyle," you asked meekly, "you're hungry right now, aren't you?"

"...not really, bro." You could hear the hesitation in his answer and knew Kyle was lying, even apart from his stomach's cries for attention. Just for good measure, though, another house-shaking roar filled the air, and from behind you could tell that Kyle was unintentionally flexing his muscles as a reflex. "Well... Maybe a little."

"We need to get you out of there and we need to get you fed," you said. Of course, saying it was the easy part.

"I've got an idea!" Lukas exclaimed. He leaned over Kyle's shoulder and shouted back down the stairs at you, a huge smile on his face. "Let's give him a whole bunch of food right now so he'll grow even more and he can burst through the walls then! Do you have any more of those Army bars?"

"NO!" you said firmly. Having Kyle this big was problem enough, you didn't want to have to worry about hiding your giant brother AND dealing with a hole in the side of the house.

"But we have to do SOMEthing," Mark pointed out. "You can't just let Kyle sit here and STARVE!"

He was right. Your little brother was in need. Whatever it took, you knew you had to help him out. You just weren't sure what that was gonna be yet.
135232212112211221221111211.title: Sticky Situation

choices: Back with Kyle, you're still waiting for the doctor, and Kyle needs to eat NOW!
Back with Kyle, the doctor has finally arrived, but so has someone else.
1352322121122112212211112112.content:
RIIIIIIINNNNNNGGGGGGG

Slow footsteps echoed down a long hallway, in rhythm with the clicking of a cane rapping against the wood floor.

RIIIIIIINNNNNNGGGGGGG

The footsteps paused. A large, heavy oak door creaked open, and then the footsteps resumed their steady march.

RIIIIIIINNNNNNGGGGGGG

A hand reached for the black receiver of an ornate-looking desk phone, picking it up.

RIIII--

"Yes?"

"Sir, it's Fredrickson."

The old billionaire took a deep breath, sitting down at his desk. "What do we know?"

"Not much, sir. Our agent wasn't able to infiltrate the interior of the house on the first attempt. He reported talking to a teenager at the door who seemed to be hiding something, but didn't see anything unusual. No signs of the... the, um, target."

He began to rub his forehead with his hands. "What about the doctor?"

"He left his office twenty minutes ago. We have a car following him, but he doesn't seem to be heading in this direction." The voice on the other line paused as the sound of shuffling papers came through. "Perhaps, sir, he's heading over to--"

"The target has to be in that house, Fredrickson," the gruff voice interrupted. "The phone number we traced points to that address, and we've confirmed through school records that a boy who lives there is the only one of the five we've yet to encounter."

"I know, sir, but we can't get in there without--"

The old man furrowed his brow and began to shout. "I don't care what you have to do to get the target. Break down his fucking door, if you have to! I just want you to get him!" He took a breath, trying to calm down, his next words more controlled but also more menacing. "We're looking at something that could make us billions! Militaries of a dozen countries would pay out the nose for this kind of breakthrough. This could single-handedly make us the wealthiest corporation in the world. Do you understand?" He almost growled these last words.

"Y-yes, sir."

"Good. Now I don't want to hear back from him until you are on the road with the target and are bringing him to the lab. Got it?"

"Yes. Yes, sir."

"Good."

CLICK
1352322121122112212211112112.title: The One Who Runs It All

choices: Kyle's belly starts to shrink, he's growing inside the truck!  Hurry!
13523221211221122122111121122.content:
Okay, you could admit it. You were stumped. Every bit as stuck as poor Kyle was. You had no earthly idea how to get your brother out of the staircase without feeding him. Which might destroy your house.

Your parents would not be pleased.

Thankfully, before you committed to anything...drastic, there was a knock at the back door. This time, with a very familiar voice.

"Hello? Please let me in, quickly! It's Dr. Hendersen. And um..guest."

You froze, inches from the door, and peeked through the window. Standing beside your family doctor was a short, petite woman with short red hair and wire frame glasses. Actually, since she was wearing the traditional white coat while Hendersen was wearing a sweater, she looked more like a doctor than he did.

"Wasting time, kid. Trust me, or don't." She spoke quickly, but offered a friendly smile despite her words.

Gulping, you decided that if collapsing your house was on the table, trusting someone Dr. Hendersen looked okay with wasn't too extreme.

The mysterious woman wasted no time. The second you opened the door, she tore through to the living room where Kyle was still stuck and jammed a large syringe into his butt.

"OW!" Kyle shrieked in surprise.

"What was that?" You shouted.

"Quiet." She ordered in a firm, commanding tone.

"Did a girl just stick me in the butt?!" Kyle asked incredulously, shifting his feet around.

He paused.

"I'm not hungry..." He said slowly, sounding very unsure.

"Good." The woman nodded with satisfaction and offered you her hand.

"Nice to meet you; I'm Doctor Johnson, top geneticist at Combinico International Labs. I was hoping you'd let me try and help your brother before he needs his own zip code."

"Uh, right..." you mutter, glancing sideways at your brother. "You really feel better, Kyle?"

"Well I'm still stuck in a tiny hallway going uphill, with my butt in the air in front of a bunch of strange people. But other than that...yeah. I guess so."

"Listen," Dr. Johnson cut in, "I'd love to answer every question you have, but there just isn't time right now. There are people, very dangerous people, who want to figure out how to make someone grow like Kyle. So far, they've only trailed you; they're afraid that trying to capture Kyle might cause a scene, and they don't want the public to know anything. But that isn't going to last much longer. I think I can help him back at my lab, but we need to go now."

"Wha...people? What people?" You asked, looking between the two doctors. You'd been running the show for a few days now, and suddenly having two adults around to make some decisions was a huge relief, but really confusing. You still weren't sure they wanted what was best for Kyle, either.

"They're outside right now." Dr. Hendersen said. "Caroline here stopped me at my office and filled me in. There really isn't time right now, just know that if it comes to it, they don't need your brother alive."

And that settled it. You trusted Dr. Hendersen, and if Kyle was in that much danger-

"Kyle, we need to go." You echoed them. "Um, how do we do that?" You asked the doctors.

"We drove my car to a moving company. There's an extra large moving van parked behind the house."

"I think he meant the 'stuck' thing." Lukas called down.

"And we're coming too!" Mark added. "There's crazy people outside!"

"Alright. I can fix that, too." Dr. Caroline grimaced, and pulled out a second, much larger syringe full of a slightly yellowed clear liquid. "And of course you're coming! But Dr. Hendersen should take all of you to the van first. I'm not sure what this will do to the house."

"What is it?" You asked warily as Lukas and Mark slowly hiked over your brother's back and over to Dr. Hendersen.

"Concentrated minerals and protein, and a B-vitamin cocktail." She answered. "Good for three or four extra feet, or my money back."

Perfect, the cavalry arrives and already the plan is back to 'destroy the house.'

"I know it's a bad plan. Horrible, actually. But I'm out of ideas."

You hesitated.

"Big bro?" Kyle asked softly. "I don't really want to grow any more, but I really really don't want to be stuck. Or captured by the bad guys."

"I don't know if these are the good guys." You confessed weakly.

"If they get me out of the stairs, that's good enough for me."

Sighing, you give Caroline a nod.

"Brace yourself." She ordered, before jamming the needle in.

"OW!" Kyle shouted again, jumping slightly. The floor gave a loud thump.

"Oh..." He let out a breath, and it seemed like he suddenly clenched every muscle, from head to toe. The walls cracked.

A red flush spread across every visible scrap of skin. Reaching out, you found it hot to the touch.

"That's normal. We should wait outside." The doctor insisted.

"I'm not leaving him."

An odd, soft creaking noise filled the room. At first, you thought it was the floor, but as you leaned closer, your ears tracked the sound to Kyle. Leaning in, your eyes widened as you saw what was happening.

"This feels weiiiiirrd." Kyle groaned as with an odd crunching sound, you watched as the long bones in his legs started to stretch longer...and longer. His knees both gave an odd pop as the crept up from the height of your waist, to the top of your stomach, the bottom of your chest...

"Errrg." The walls cracked and split and an odd screech filled the room. From above, you heard a rumble as the ceiling started to dip.

"We have to go!" Carolien shouted, racing for the door. "The stairs are between the metal support beams for the house! That's why Kyle couldn't move! The house is going to collapse!"

A part of you heard what she said, but the rest of you either refused to abandon Kyle or was just too fascinated by what was happening right in front of you. Dust fell from the ceiling as Kyle's feet clenched, cracked, and grew before your eyes, his toes inching along the floor even as his expanding torso pushed them away.

"Too...tight..." Kyle huffed; his voice sounded even louder than before, that odd echo quality picking up echoes upon echoes until even his whispers sounded like shouts in a canyon. The metal beams groaned. Steps cracked and split as he dropped his full weight on them, wriggling furiously to get loose.

Finally the steel weakened enough for him to turn on his side; even then, he was now almost impossibly big in the doorway, much wider than before from front to back, with his shoulder almost hitting the top of the frame. Bracing with hands the size of trashcan lids, Kyle pushed his upper body back into the living room. The floor creaked ominously. Actually, so did everything else...

"We gotta go!" Kyle, eyes wide in near panic, reached out without thinking and grabbed you in his hand. It was still very small for this, but to your surprise, Kyle was now big enough to grip you.

Shifting his body out along the floor, with his legs bunched up by the front wall at the knees and his feet almost reaching the top of the door, Kyle pushed you forward and into the kitchen. The sudden motion seemed to break you out of your funk, and you raced ahead of your brother into the back yard.

There, as promised was the moving van. With a fifteen foot cargo bay already opened and waiting, you hustled up and jumped inside.

You only hoped it was big enough as Kyle quickly turned on his side and started squeezing his way through the kitchen and back door. In the past two days, he'd gone from reaching up to the nob, to banging his head on the top, to crawling through, and now you watched as he squirmed, almost getting stuck, trying to get through the (to him) tiny hole into the outside air. There was a close moment as his slight gut (when did that come back?) skidded through, popping out on the other side, before he managed and crawl up into the truck.

The truck bed sank dangerously low as it absorbed his massive weight. Carefully, you squeezed past him and slid down the door.

"GO!" You shouted, slamming it closed with a snap. After that, there was only the sense of motion, speed, and the stifling presence of lots and lots of Kyle.

"I'm sorry." You eventually mumbled. "If I'd just taken you to the lab in the first place.."

"It's okay." Kyle said bravely, from somewhere near the front of the cargo area. Even in this long space, he couldn't lie down; he had to sit, with his feet spread more than halfway down the bay and his head stooped to keep from smacking it into the ceiling.

"You didn't know; you were just trying to protect me. And I'm still safe; and I'm not stuck or hungry anymore."

"I'm still sorry, Kyle. I should have tried to fix this that first night. I screwed up."

"It'll be okay, big bro." Kyle promised. "You'll keep protecting me, just like always. And now..."

You felt in the dark that somewhere over your head, Kyle was clenching a fist.

"Maybe now I can protect you too."
13523221211221122122111121122.title: Worth a Shot

choices: You are safe at the lab, you just need to get Kyle inside
You're surrounded by half a dozen cars, with people glaring at Kyle menacingly
135232212112211221221111211222.content:
Riding in the back of the cargo bay was uncomfortable to say the least. There were no windows, which meant the only light was the sliver that leaked through the crack of the door, and no sense of how fast the vehicle was traveling or when to expect turning and deceleration. You imagined that Kyle had to be less comfortable, being cramped up in such a tight space, the only thing separating his naked butt from the dirty metal of the van floor being nothing more than a thin bedsheet that to him had to be barely more than a dishrag at this point.

It would've been hard for someone else who was watching the scenario from the outside to think that a giant as big as Kyle actually needed someone else, but you had no doubt that your brother needed you here. And you needed him. Everything that had happened since Friday when this whole ordeal had started, all the headaches and craziness and wondering if things would turn out okay-- it was getting to you.

You crawled into Kyle's lap, resting your head against the warm, soft skin of his lower chest. At first, he seemed a little surprised, but he quickly adapted, taking his large hand and placing it on your back in a comforting manner.

"Thanks for being here with me, big bro, and for not running out on me when I was stuck back in the house," he said, softly as his booming voice would let him.

"Kyle," you said solemnly, looking up to him even though you couldn't see his face in the darkness and you knew he couldn't see yours, "I wouldn't dream of leaving you anywhere. I'm gonna be by your side no matter what, until we get this whole thing completely over with."

You could feel Kyle's body shake slightly as he nodded in affirmation. "And I won't leave you either!"

Wrapping your arms around his midsection, you buried your face in his skin. Kyle responded by simply patting you on the back. The feeling of being with someone so huge, so much larger than you, was oddly comforting, and you wondered how Kyle felt having someone sitting on his lap embracing him the way you were doing.

Those idle, happy thoughts were short-lived, however. As you hugged him, you noticed that the size of his gut seemed to be diminishing right under your fingers. You ran your hand along the formerly round stomach, noticing that it was getting smaller and smaller as you touched it, reverting back to it's flat state from before. Uh-oh.

"Big bro?" Kyle asked, uneasy. "I'm starting to feel a little funny..."

Suddenly, you heard a familiar creaking sound, followed by a large BANG. You pulled out your cell phone and flipped it open, the light from the screen partially illuminating the interior of the van. You were stunned to see Kyle's foot now pressed up against the opposite end of the van where the door was, whereas before it only reached halfway. He bent his legs at the knees, trying to make more room for himself, but he was quickly filling up the space, at a much faster rate than any previous day.

"Kyle..." you couldn't hide the alarm in your voice. "Please, buddy, hold off on that as much as you can!"

"I-- I don't think I can control it!" His back now had to bend over halfway down his spine in order for his head not to hit the roof of the van. His shoulders were being pressed tight on either side; he was rapidly running out of what very little room he had to maneuver in at all.

Jumping off of his lap, you squeezed around his form to the wall facing the truck cabin, banging on the metal loudly. "HEY!" you shouted, hoping your voice could be heard above the noise of the engine, "we've got to HURRY! Kyle's still getting MUCH bigger back here!"

After a second's delay, you heard the engine rev louder and the van begin to accelerate as much as possible. You prayed that this lab you were heading to was close, and that the van would arrive there in one piece.

Looking back at Kyle, you thought you could make out a look of panic on his face. "Big BRO!" he called out. "I'm out of room!" He had managed to turn himself around so that his head was opposite your end of the truck, and was now lying on his side in a fetal position, his knees at his chest and his arms wrapped around his legs. The makeshift loincloth had ripped loose, so he was lying there naked. Naked, huge, very frightened, crying slightly... and still growing.

"Don't get upset," you said, mostly to Kyle but also a little bit to yourself. "We're almost there! Just hang on a bit longer!" You noticed that you yourself were now running low on room, about to be forced to the wall by Kyle's feet.

"Okay," Kyle nodded between sobs.

But his body had other ideas. It continued its growth cycle, until Kyle was unable to keep from pressing outward against the sides of the van. The metal began to bulge, making odd stretching sounds as it did. "I-- I can't do it!" Kyle finally yelled, putting his hands flat up on the ceiling. "I've got to get OUT of here!"

"No! Wa--" your voice was muffled as the sole of Kyle's left foot pressed against your face, pinning you against the far wall. You tried to continue your screams of protest, but they couldn't be heard amongst the sound of the metal warping and Kyle's grunting.

Finally, Kyle pushed upward with as much strength as he could muster, and the metal began to tear apart. Light poured in from the outside as the cargo bay's ceiling broke away, eventually peeling off as the vehicle continued to speed along. The van swerved a little, and you nearly went flying, but Kyle reached out and grabbed you firmly around the shoulder with his hand, making sure you were safe.

It only took another moment or two for the cargo bay to fall apart completely. The van skidded to a stop as all the walls ripped loose, and you were left sitting only on the floor of the van bed. Kyle's weight had ultimately forced the end of the van down, the bumper scraping against the asphalt and pinning the vehicle in place.

As your brother stood and stretched, you craned your neck to
look up... and up... and up at him. You weren't quite sure how tall he was, but there now would be no way for him to fit inside a normal-sized building. He seemed to be slightly embarrassed at his nakedness, attempting to cover it up as best he could. Taking a deep breath, you started to examine your surroundings, trying to quickly figure out where the van had stopped (or, rather, where Kyle had stopped the van).
135232212112211221221111211222.title: Squeeze Play

135232212112211222.content:
"Alright Kyle, we have to get you something to tide you over for at least a little bit" You said looking across the table at your brother, "I know you said you could wait, but it can't possibly get better if you wait longer to eat."
Your brother looked graciously over at you "You're sure Justin? I think I can wait a little lon----" His stomach let out another long rumble.
"Nope thats it, we're definitely getting you something, what do you want, chicken fingers? A hot dog? Nachos?"
"You're sure Justin? Are we still gonna ride Death Mountain?"
"Sure Kyle, just as long as you eat something," You walked up to the concession counter, pulling out the credit card you parents had left in case of emergencies and for food and started to order, looking back at your brother, "What do you want Kyle?"
"Uh, can we have three orders of chicken fingers, two hot dogs, and another sundae?" He said sheepishly, and looking down at the rest of you, "Do you guys want anything?"
You stared shocked at your brother, after all, he had just polished off two sundaes. That is, until his stomach growled even louder. You quickly put the order in.

As you all sat down with your food, a serving of nachos shared between Lukas a Mark, and a hot dog for you, Kyle walked up with his final tray of food. He had amended his order as you were telling the cashier to have another sundae, and a serving of nachos. Because of that, he was forced to carry three trays of food over to the table the four of you were sharing. As soon as the tray hit the table, he started to dig in at an alarming pace. You watched for the first few seconds, as he quickly ate through the first hot dog, but then started to concentrate on your own lunch. By time you finished, Mark and Lukas looked to be full, though they had only finished half of their nachos, and alarmingly Kyle was finishing up his third serving of chicken fingers. It didn't look like he was letting up either, keeping up at his tireless pace. You looked back to the two smaller boys, who gazed up with wonder at their formerly small friend.

"So Kyle, I think once you finish up we'll be able go on Death Mountain" He nodded appreciatively as he finished up the last of his food, "And you two will wait for me and Kyle while we're on it, got it?"
Lukas looked at you, "Yeah, yeah, of cou--HEY KYLE I WAS GOING TO FINISH THAT!" You looked over at your brother, who was slowly munching on the remaining nachos.
"Calm down, if either of you were going to finish that, you would have, and Kyle clearly still has room in his stomach." With that came a rumble. You looked over at your brother incredulously, he couldn't STILL be hungry. He gave you a slightly amused smirk, "Don't worry Justin, I'm pretty full, think that was just the food settling in my stomach" he said as he stretched his arms above his head. In doing so, his shirt pulled up a bit, exposing his slightly distended stomach. Crossing his arms, which seemed to be hugged by the sleeves of your dads t-shirt a hair tighter, behind his head, he started to stand up, letting out a long, loud belch.
Before your eyes, your brother's stomach flattened out. Even so, a sliver of his stomach was still exposed, same as it had been this morning, maybe even more. "Hurry up guys, before I grow even more, ha ha!" he jokingly yelled back to the rest of you. You didn't find the prospect of Kyle growing even more, remotely funny, but hurried nonetheless to catch up with your younger brother. As you approached the ride, you realized the line was relatively long, which worried you, but Kyle was so dead-set on riding it, that you didn't even consider trying to stop him. Not that you'd even be able to.
"Alright, you guys wait over at the exit, so you see us as soon as you exit the ride, got it?" The boys nodded, and ran ahead. You could see them from line, and gave them a thumbs up. The "You must be this tall to ride this ride sign" barely came up to Kyles expanded chest now, it was roughly up to your chin, highlighting the disparity in your heights. You looked up to your little, no, younger brother. Something was different, you couldn't put your finger on it though. "Hey Kyle, are you feeling ok?"
A lazy grin spread over his face "I've never felt better JustIN," his voice cracking a bit at the end "I was SOO-oo hungry before, but I did-NT want to make you use too much monEY" he said, his voice lowering at the end. Kyle stood up and your couldn't believe your eyes, he looked like he had grown another 20 feet! He was definitely taller than most skyscrapers in the city now, and this worried you.

Kyle grabbed his belly as it started to rumble and an evil smile came upon his face.
"Breakfast time!" exclaimed the boy, eyeing the big city before him.
"Kyle, listen to me, you have to stop eating people! Think about their lives!"
"Sorry big bro, but I'm a giant now. All of these people are gonna be in my belly, and there's nothing you can do to stop me!"
With that he stomped off, mindlessly crushing houses and cars as he made his way to the doomed city.

"Kyle, wait!" You screamed to get his attention, but it was no use, he was too blinded by his hunger to listen. You ran to catch up with him, but your lack of sleep depleted your energy quickly and you only made it about a football field until you collapsed to the ground, passed out from exhaustion.

Kyle was now getting closer and closer to the city. It was about 7 A.M. and people were just settling into their offices, preparing for the work day. Little did they know that a giant 11 year old boy was going to make them his meal.

One of the biggest skyscrapers in the city was already bustling with people, constant phone calls, loud yelling; there was so much noise that no one paid any attention to the small tremors getting closer and closer to the building.

Kyle stomped his way over to this busy building crushing a few smaller buildings and many cars under his feet as he does so. Back in the building, everyone was still busy, too oblivious to realize a giant boy was standing right outside.

Kyle shoved his hand through the window of the skyscraper, grabbing many people as well as some chairs and desks and shoved them all in his mouth. He tilted his head back and gulped and looked in for another handful. Grabbing another handful of people he could hear the fearful screams.
(Oh my god! He's gonna eat us! No! Noo!) Kyle heard these screams as he shoved the tinies into his mouth and he got horny. He looked into the building again to see people running away, but he reached his other hand inside and scooped all of them up in his fist. He held his fist high above his face and slowly released his grip, letting the people fall one by one into his mouth. All of them were now in his mouth, and he proudly tilted his head back and swallowed.

Kyle let out a pleasured moan as he felt the citizens squirm down his throat and in his belly. He now had a full boner and was getting antsy.

"Ooooh, I wanna shoot again!" he moaned.

What does he do?
