14512.title: Growth Challenge

145121.content:
Jeremy Wright was a lot of things. He was friendly, and at least a bit smart. He was pretty good at sports, and tall for his age. He was just one more twelve year old trying to survive middle school.

And he was losing his mind.

"C'mon Jeremy!" His best friend in the world, Ethan Weaver, grinned at him as he cracked his knuckles. "How about best five out of nine? I mean, it's Go Fish, you can't lose every time."

"Ethan," Jeremy groaned, rubbing his forehead. "I've lost four games in a row. Why should I try to win the next five just to beat you?"

Ethan paused, hands full of partially-shuffled cards. Shrugging, the eleven year old set down the cards and hopped to his feet, eyebrow quirked in challenge.

Jeremy knew better than to fight the look. Rolling his eyes, the older friend kicked back from the card table and climbed to his feet, smirking a bit as he continued to rise higher until he completely towered over his friend. Ethan may have been the most competitive kid ever (he even referred to himself as "the most competitive"!) but dang was he a shrimp. If Jeremy was unusually tall for twelve, Ethan was an absolute midget for eleven. Jeremy was a full foot taller than his friend, and more than twice his weight.

Which was way, of course, Ethan immediately challenged him to a game of HORSE.

"No."

"Pleeeease?" Ethan asked, deliberately standing close so he could emphasize Jeremy's height advantage and Jeremy knew what that smug little hustler was doing, darn it! "You know my dad put a new hoop on the side of the house; it's right upstairs! We could even do best two out of three!"

"No, Ethan. No more games today! Seriously, do you ever stop?" Jeremy exclaimed.

Ethan stared up at him in shock, and maybe looked a little hurt. Darn, now he felt guilty.

"Look," Jeremy said, rubbing his neck. "I get that you're competitive, okay? I mean, how many hours have you spent reading up on card games and practicing shuffles just so you'd beat me more often? How long have you spent practicing trick shots at basketball so you could own me at HORSE?"

Ethan shrugged, looking a little confused.

"I dunno, Jeremy, a lot? I like to win; there's nothing wrong with that." He muttered.

"You care too much, Ethan!" Jeremy exclaimed. "I mean, I heard some other kids talking about it last week; one of them even said you had a Neopolitan complex or something, that you try so hard 'cuz you're so short. It's not just me saying stuff, Ethan, you've gotta lighten up!"

Now Ethan was frowning a bit. Slowly, the smaller boy lowered his eyes until he was looking straight ahead into Jeremy's chest, then he slowly raised his gaze to the top of his head, and finally locked onto his eyes. Jeremy almost had to step back; the kid's gaze was intense.

"I don't compete because I'm short, dummy." Ethan scoffed, stepping back and puffing up a bit in offense. "I compete because it's fun! I don't care about how tall I am!"

"Well good!" Jeremy sniped as he grabbed his backpack and stomped up the stairs. "'Cuz you can't practice getting taller, and no matter how good you get at other stuff you'll never be bigger than me."

Jeremy felt bad almost as soon as he got home. It had been a stupid thing to say. He'd known Ethan for years, and he didn't think his friend cared about his height, but what if he did? Making fun of his best friend wasn't cool, even if he was being super annoying. With a nod, Jeremy booted up the family computer and opened his email account; he'd send a quick message now and apologize in person tomorrow.

Ethan had already sent him an email. Jeremy winced; he hoped his friend wasn't too mad at him. After a moment's hesitation, he opened the email. It only had two words.

Challenge Accepted
145121.title: Challenge Accepted

choices: During study hall, Ethan shows Jeremy his plan
After school, Ethan shows Jeremy his new routine
1451211.content:
Jeremy frowned and checked his watch. Ethan was late; the bus was going to arrive any second! He wouldn't have any time to apologize now, or to ask about that weirdo email his friend had sent. What did Ethan mean, "challenge accepted"? The only 'challenge' Jeremy had offered had been about being bigger than his friend, and Ethan knew that wasn't something he could control. His friend was super-competitive but he wasn't crazy.

Just as the bus appeared a few blocks away, Jeremy saw his friend walk around the corner, munching on what looked like some kind of granola bar.

"Sorry," Ethan mumbled before chewing down the last of his snack. "Slept in."

"You overslept?" Jeremy raised an eyebrow. His friend had a perfect attendance record (because of course he did) and he never overslept!

"No," Ethan said patiently as the bus pulled to a stop. "I slept in. There's a difference."

"Okaaay," Jeremy offered skeptically as the pair slid into a seat. "But why did you 'sleep in', then?"

Ethan quickly shoved his empty wrapper into his bag and pulled out a notebook and pencil.

"Because people do most of their growing when they're asleep." His apparently insane friend answered calmly. "Say, Jer, how tall are you again? Five foot six?"

"Five five," he answered automatically before his brain rebooted. "Hey, wait a minute Ethan, you don't mean that you actually-"

"And you weigh about a hundred and forty pounds?" Ethan cut him off, jotting down notes.

"Yeah, sounds about right," Jeremy offered weakly, peering down at a page of notes. Apparently Ethan was four foot five and sixty-six pounds; the kid was literally half his size and was talking like he was seriously trying to challenge him to a...to a growing contest or something!

"Ethan..."

"Shoe size please."

"Ethan!" Jeremy exclaimed, forcing his friend to close his notebook. "Listen to yourself! You said yourself you didn't care about your height; why are you acting like this?"

Ethan didn't even try to open the notebook back up. Instead, he pulled a thermos from the side of his bag and took a few long sips. He grimaced a bit - whatever it was must have tasted gross - and just stared up at his taller friend.

"I'll assume you're still a ten to my four then, about two inches longer foot and around twice the surface area, matching you being double my weight. And I'm 'acting like this' because you called me out, Jer, and you know I never back down from a challenge."

"It wasn't a challenge," Jeremy argued. "And how do you even know my shoe size or...or foot math or whatever? And what's with the granola bars and what I'll assume is soap water?"

"First," Ethan argued back as he put his notebook away, "it was so a challenge, even if it's a stupid one. Second, I know your shoe size because you started your growth spurt when you were nine, you made a stupid 'act my shoe size' joke for months until you turned ten and then dropped it even though I think you still think the joke is funny. I know 'foot math' because I always do the research when I take on a challenge. And finally the bars are workout bars that I'm borrowing from my dad and the drink is some Pediasure that I'm borrowing from my little sister. It's extra protein and nutrients and it's part of my plan to beat you."

"Beat me?" Jeremy asked incredulously. "You can't force yourself to grow, Ethan, it's genetic!"

"I don't take challenges because I know I'll win, Jer," Ethan grinned up at him, his intense gaze locked with Jeremy's confused one. "I take them because I might lose. I won't know until I try, and I think this will be the hardest most awesome challenge ever! You think I only act like this because all of you are bigger than me?"

Ethan laughed as the bus dropped them off at school.

"I'll prove you wrong when I keep on being me, just bigger than all of you."
1451211.title: Small Changes

choices: Jeremy meets Ethan the next day - Ethan's pants look a bit short
Jeremy meets Ethan the next day - Ethan comes over to borrow some clothes
1451212.content:
Jeremy spent a few moments staring at the email, not sure what it could possibly mean. It was so strange, he decided to skip sending an email; he'd need to talk with Ethan in person. Something weird was clearly going on. Decision made, Jeremy turned off the lights and hopped into bed. Things would work out; with Ethan they always did, eventually.

- - -

Ethan stared at his family computer's screen, frowning at the 'sent' marker on his email. Silent, he turned off the computer and walked to his room. He'd talk with Jeremy tomorrow, but what was he going to say? What was he going to do? Jeremy may not have meant it, but Ethan never, ever, backed down from a challenge. But getting bigger than Jeremy? It was impossible, right? Jeremy was huge for a twelve year old, nearly five and a half feet tall and almost a hundred and fifty pounds. There were high school kids who were smaller than him!

And there were elementary kids bigger than Ethan. He knew he was a small kid, he always had been, even considering he was the youngest in his grade. Both of his parents were short, and so were all of his aunts and uncles. His taller friend probably had at least a foot on him!

Well...that was a starting point. Ethan grabbed a pencil from his desk and walked over to his door frame. He swiped a quick mark over his head and turned around to look at it.

It was a pencil mark on a door.

Okay, duh, he needed a measuring tape or something. A quick trip to the garage took care of that; his dad had three so he'd just keep one in his room for now. And apparently he was four feet five inches tall, definitely about a foot shorter than stupid tall Jeremy.

Ethan bit his lip, and looked down at his probably-also-way-smaller-than-Jeremy's feet. What was he going to do?

- - -

Jeremy fell asleep easily. His dreams were...strange. He was holding a silver 2nd place badge and his parents were giving him the "at least you tried" talk. He'd lost at...something. What was it?

- - -

Ethan shook his head and glared at the mark on his door. This was a challenge, and no stupid pencil mark was going to make him give up on the first day! He bet that stupid mark wasn't even in the right spot; he'd probably been slouching because he was acting all lame and depressed before, or he hadn't been careful with the pencil.

Ethan walked with purpose back to the door, clicked his heels firmly against the base board, and very carefully stood. Up. Straight. He felt his head resting against the frame behind him. He rolled his shoulders and made sure his back was in his best, tallest posture, and he gave the pencil in his hand a stern glare. He closed his eyes and lifted the pencil over his head, pressing the tip against the door frame.

"Come on," he muttered as he flexed his calves but made sure his heels stayed on the ground; no cheating! "Come on, just another inch, Jeremy can't be that much bigger; I have a challenge to win!"

- - -

Jeremy wasn't sure where Ethan was, but he thought maybe his little friend had won 1st prize. That sounded like Ethan; always had to be at the top in everything. Jeremy perked up as his parents both smiled and said hello to his friend; Ethan must have joined them.

But...why were they looking over the top of his head?

- - -

As Ethan grit his teeth and focused, he thought maybe he'd still been slouching a bit after all. He felt his feet shift a bit on the carpet and pushed back to keep them against the wall, flexed his knees for a second, and as he straightened up again with one last posture-fixing streeetch, he felt the top of his head push against the pencil and heard the sound of the graphite scrape a line on the door frame upward.

Quickly, before he lost his posture, Ethan slashed the pencil to the side and stepped back from the door, relaxing into a slight slouch.

No. Way.

Ethan stared, tape measure in hand, at the jagged line he'd made when he pushed the pencil up three inches to four feet and eight inches. He stepped forward and ran his hand from his head to the door...four foot eight.

He couldn't have been slouching that much, right?
1451212.title: The Power of Competition

choices: Ethan tries again later that night
Ethan waits until tomorrow to show Jeremy his progress
Ethan notices some other changes happening besides his height
14512121.content:
The next morning, Jeremy was surprised to find himself arrive at the bus stop before Ethan did. Usually, Ethan was always there first (another "competition" for him, he imagined) and Jeremy began to worry that Ethan might have gotten sick, or had taken his remark the wrong way and was avoiding him. He breathed a sigh of relief, though, when he saw his friend round the corner just as the bus came into view over the hill.

"Where've you been?" Jeremy asked as neutrally as possible.

Ethan shrugged. "Home. Where I always am before school. Why?"

Jeremy didn't respond, just staring at his friend. Something seemed off about him, but he couldn't place his finger on it. As the bus pulled up and Ethan climbed on board, he thought that the cuff of his pants seemed to be showing just a bit more ankle than usual, but shook the thought away as nonsense.

As they sat down together on a seat near the middle of the bus, Jeremy sighed. "Look... I'm sorry about what I said yesterday. I don't know if you're self-conscious about--"

But Ethan cut him off mid-sentence. "Don't worry about it. It's fine. And I meant what I said in my email."

"What?"

"You said I'll never be bigger than you. Well, I accept that challenge." Ethan flashed a grin. "And I intend to win!"

"But," Jeremy stuttered, "it's not like you can control your height or anything. How are you going to possibly--"

Again, Ethan interrupted his friend. "Just wait. You'll see."

- - -

Once they got to school and classes began, Ethan found it unusually challenging to pay attention to his teachers. Typically, he was a good student, but today he was preoccupied with the thoughts of what had happened last night.

Something weird had happened when he tried to stretch up higher. At least, the first time. After he measured himself at 4 foot 8, he measured himself three more times later in the evening at various levels of posture, but the results never made more than a half-inch of difference either way. Sure, he wasn’t gaining any inches, but he wasn’t losing them either. Even after waking up in the morning and measuring again, he still hit that same mark right on the nose.

And then there was the clothes. When he put on his outfit for school this morning, everything felt unusually tight. He could barely keep his shirt tucked in, and the sleeves hugged his shoulders more than usual. His toes, too, pressed against the end of his shoes in a way they had never done before. It wasn’t something that was super-obvious to anyone but him, but it was definitely different. A good kind of different.

So that begged the question: did he really caused himself to grow? And, could he do it again? The thought filled his mind all day, and he couldn’t wait to go home again and try it out. Which, of course, made the day drag on longer than ever before.

- - -

The day was Friday, which meant Jeremy had guitar practice and wasn’t able to hang out with Ethan after school. Most days that would be a bummer, but Ethan was secretly relieved that he could go home right away and see if anything had changed.

As soon as he got into his room, he threw his bookbag on his bed and kicked off his shoes, grabbing the pencil and standing against the door frame, making sure not to slouch again. With his posture as straight as he could make it, he closed his eyes and swiped the pencil to the side again, then turning around and opening them.

The mark was exactly on top of where it had been last night.

“Okay, no change,” he said to himself. Lining his back against the door frame again, he closed his eyes once more. This time, he took a deep breath and then tensed up his muscles, doing his best to stretch the top of his head as far as it would go.

After a few seconds, he felt the pencil scraping against the door frame, and his heart skipped a beat.

Making a quick slash to the side, he whirled around and looked at where the mark was. His jaw dropped as he saw that it was at least as far above the previous mark as that one had been above the first once. Quickly, he grabbed the measuring tape and stretched it out, reading the results out loud.

“Four foot eleven and a half inches.”

The thought was unreal. He had gained nearly four inches in just a few seconds! Of course, the five foot barrier was still taunting him, but he was now over halfway to his goal of being bigger than Jeremy!

As Ethan tried to gather his thoughts, he only just then noticed that his shirt had come completely untucked and the bottom of it was now even with his naval, and his belt had become painfully tight. Loosening it up a few notches, he realized that if he kept this up he would need a whole new wardrobe.

Not that that was a bad thing.
14512121.title: Day Two Of The Challenge

choices: Jeremy has some strange dreams that propel him to keep tight watch on his friend
Ethan tries to push his limits and grow more than "just" three inches in a day
Ethan tries testing what his new body can do!
145121212.content:
Once again Jeremy was waiting at the bus stop for his friend and, once again, he was late. Ethan was humming to himself, staring into the middle distance, thinking about the song he had been learning last night at practice. He was so absorbed in his own thoughts that it wasn't until a familiar and energetic voice shouted, "Hey Jeremy!" that he snapped back to attention.

"Hey... Ethan?!"

The smirk on Ethan's face went entirely unnoticed by Jeremy as his own mouth dropped open, his eyes scanning up and down over his friend. He was VERY clearly taller and not by an insignificant amount. If things had seemed a bit off yesterday, now they were officially in the realm of the impossible. Ethan was wearing a strange assortment of clothes: his pants looked more like capris, cutting off at the bottom of his calves, his shirt barely reaching the hem of his pants while the sleeves were at his elbows and rather tight. On his feet were a pair of sandals, his toes clearly hanging over the edge of them. If the outfit was uncomfortable in any way, Ethan sure wasn't letting it show on his face. "What's up Jeremy? You look a little shocked."

Jeremy closed his eyes, tight, then opened them up again, squinting at his friend, stepping closer and measuring himself against him. Just two days he had been at around chest height, a full foot shorter... and now, he had closed that distance almost by half! Six inches in two days... it just wasn't possible! "Ethan, what the heck is this? Are you doing some kind of weird... trick of the light type thing or what?"

Ethan laughed, standing up taller, puffing his chest out, his shirt rising just a bit around his middle. "Nope! This is one hundred percent me! Remember what I said yesterday? I'm working my butt off to get taller and its already paying off! If I keep going at this rate, I'll have you beat before the weekend!"

Jeremy immediately got down on his hands and knees, peering closely at Ethan's sandals. There didn't appear to be any lifts in them or anything... he turned his head up as Ethan chuckled, looking down at him from above. "You know, this is a pretty nice view, with you all the way down there! I could get used to it!"

Ethan was just pushing his friend's buttons, wanting to get back at him for doubting in his competitive spirit, but there was a twinge of something deep inside that stirred at his own words. Jeremy quickly got back to his feet in a huff, moving in close and bumping into his still smaller friend. "Don't go getting a swelled head, Ethan. I'm a year older than you but I'm still growing too don't forget."

Ethan cracked his knuckles as the bus pulled up, smiling at his friend over his shoulder as he boarded. "It wouldn't be much of a competition if you didn't put up some kind of fight."

----

"Did you see Ethan?"

"No, why?"

"He's tall now! Well... tallER anyway."

"No way!"

Jeremy heard the buzzing all through the morning; everyone was just as surprised as he was that Ethan had sprouted up so much in so short of time. Ethan had been sent to the nurse's office, just to make sure there wasn't something wrong with him, but, as Ethan himself proudly noted, he was in perfect health. It was lunch time now and both boys were plowing through their food at their usual pace, though Ethan was keeping up talking almost the entire time. "So I was doing some calculating and if I keep going at this rate, I'll definitely be taller than you in like... two days! So, unless you can keep up, this is gonna be another victory for me! Let's see... and then after I beat you I'm --"

"Wait a second." Jeremy said, cutting through Ethan's chatter. "What do you mean "after"? Once you're taller than me, you win, right? What's after?"

Ethan tapped his pencil, the same pencil he had been using to measure himself, which he now viewed as a kind of good luck charm, against the open notebook and stared at Jeremy straight on, calmly answering, "Well, I was thinking about it and just because I'm taller than YOU doesn't mean I'm the tallEST. So, if I keep going, in a week or two I could probably be the tallest kid in school! And then after that--"

Jeremy interrupted again. "Wait, after THAT?! How many "afters" are there?"

Ethan blew out a puff of air, his bangs rustling slightly as he did so. "If you'd let me finish, I could tell you! Okay, so tallest in school, I get passed that, and then I start going for the world record. I looked up a bunch of different "tallest people in history" type things and they usually go for like eight or nine feet tall at the biggest so that's the next goal. After that, I started looking up landmarks and buildings and stuff. There's a lot of really big stuff out there! And that's without mentioning mountains."

Jeremy rolled his eyes. "Okay, I'll admit, it's weird that you're getting so tall so fast, but it's just a... normal old growth spurt. You might get a few more inches but you're going to stop after that. You're not going to end up as big as a mountain."

Ethan chuckled and said, "You trying to convince me or yourself?"

Jeremy shoved half his sandwich into his mouth to avoid answering. Ethan had a point; there was something unnerving in the way he was talking. It was his usual self assured attitude about how he was going to win this competition but it felt kind of... ominous when he started talking about outgrowing buildings and mountains. There was some part of Jeremy that was going along with it already, that, yeah, of course Ethan would outgrow not only him but everyone. He shoved that minor spark of feeling down, deep, annoyed at it. It was all completely ridiculous.

Ethan, meanwhile, had gone back to scribbling notes, sketching bar graphs and the like, eyes shining with determination.

---

Later that night, Jeremy couldn't keep his mind off what Ethan had said. His friend had charged off straight to his own home right after school, shouting excuses about wanting to run get a head start on his growing. Why was it so hard to concentrate with Ethan's words running through his head? They were so pie in the sky insane that he should have been able to brush them off without a care but for some reason he just couldn't. Images of Ethan, rising not just taller than him, but taller than everyone in the school, head pressed proudly against the ceiling, grinning down at everyone wouldn't get out of his head. Finally, frustrated, Jeremy threw his pen aside and got his guitar out. If nothing else, focusing on his music should get his mind off his friend. "Tomorrow, I'm not going to let him out of my sight." Jeremy thought, tuning his instrument. "I'll spend the night if I have to.

---

Ethan, stripped down to his underwear, was standing against the wall again. Earlier this morning he had had the choice of either wearing his father's clothes, which were far too big for him, or cobbling together whatever outfit he could manage from clothes that were just slightly too big for him at his old height. He had chosen the latter to better accentuate his own vertical gains but now that he was in his room, he saw no reason to keep them on. He had already started looking at online sites for new clothes but, at his rate of growth, by the time any clothes arrived they might be too small. He pushed that thought aside for the moment as he gripped his pencil tight in his hand, pressing the tip against the door frame. Remembering the last two times he had done this, he stood up straight, straight as he could, tensed his muscles, and puuuuuushed himself up against the door frame, the pencil making the now familiar rasp as it sliced upwards. Marking to the side, Ethan eagerly checked with the tape measure. He let out a little "Yeah!" of joy; he had officially surpassed the five foot mark! He grinned wide, a warm feeling of accomplishment welling up inside of him.

Not only had he been able to do it, but, this time, it had felt easier.
145121212.title: What a Difference a Day Makes

1451212122.content:
Jeremy felt...nervous, as he sat, alone, in class. For the past two days, Ethan had arrived at the bus stop later and bigger than usual. Today, he hadn't shown up at all. A part of Jeremy was worried about his friend's health, but there was also a small voice in his head wondering if the later his friend was, the bigger he'd get. (It wasn't the weirdest theory he'd cooked up since yesterday.)

His nerves only worsened as lunch came and went, with no sign of his friend. What if he was sick, or hurt? What if he'd...taken something to make him grow, like a steroid, or nuclear waste or something? He could be dead!

Jeremy's increasingly frantic and imaginative thoughts stopped and his mind blanked when he got to gym class, his last of the day. The entire class was quiet, staring at an even bigger Ethan standing in front of, and to the side of, their gym teacher. Ethan must have been a bit over five feet tall; his head had cleared the teacher's shoulder and he was looking slightly down at well over half the class with a slight half-smile.

"Okay class," their teacher intoned, resting his hand on Ethan's shoulder. "As you can see, your classmate has gotten a bit...well, a bit taller over the last few days. Ethan's parents took him to the doctor this morning, and they wanted you to know that he seems to be in perfect health for now. I know you'll all respect your classmate and not bother him, right?"

Most of the class, the ones that weren't too stunned, nodded slowly without taking their eyes off of Ethan. Jeremy's little...Jeremy's friend clearly planned to participate in class as he'd shown up in a set of obviously-new gym clothes. The t-shirt was long, dipping below his waist with a wide collar, and the shorts ended well below his knees and the waist was obviously wide on him and cinched tight. Clearly his parents had gotten him the biggest clothes he would reasonably fit.

Jeremy wondered if they knew what was going on, or if they thought his friend would need that much growing room.

The whole class was set to jogging, and Jeremy wasted no time in hustling over to his friend. A few classmates were pacing themselves so they could stare, but a quick glare from Jeremy saw them scuttling off and not getting too close. He was still the biggest kid in his class after all, and he'd use that status to protect his friend.

"Dude...what the hell?" Jeremy panted as he pushed the limit between jogging and a light run to keep pace with his friend.

Ethan didn't answer right away. For the first minute, Jeremy's younger friend focused on pushing the pace until he'd started lapping classmates. Once he was certain he was in first place (and apparently willing to share that with Jeremy today) he grinned over at his friend. He barely had to look upward; Jeremy realized with dismay, now that they were side by side, that he only had an inch or two on his friend!

"Isn't this awesome?" He beamed proudly and accelerated some more. A few of the students who were trying to catch up groaned. "And I'm so much faster already, too! I knew my shorter legs made jogging to the front harder, but I didn't know it'd be this much easier."

"We're," Jeremy panted, "we're not racing right now, dummy."

Ethan just rolled his eyes and slowed down a little. Jeremy didn't want to admit it, but this probably the only reason he finished the race at Ethan's side. And the kid wasn't even winded! His friend looked an odd mix of proud and disappointed as they slowed to a stop.

"Cool down," the teacher called out.

Ethan and Jeremy walked over to the wall. As they pressed their palms against it, Ethan turned to Jeremy with a smirk.

"So Jer, you're the tallest kid in our grade, right?"

Jeremy shook his head as he pressed his palms against the all and flexed his calves, stretching out his leg muscles. He looked over at his friend as Ethan adjusted his stance and moved his hands slightly further apart; he seemed really focused on his stretches despite asking him more weird questions.

"Nope, I think Angela has me beat by about two inches, actually. In class B?" Jeremy shook his head. "Why?"

"No reason," Ethan answered in a light tone. Apparently he wasn't focusing on his stretches that much, he wasn't crouching enough. From where Jeremy was crouched down, his friend was at eye level.

Rolling his shoulders, Ethan turned around and sat with his back to the wall and his legs straight out in front. Jeremy quickly moved to do the same. Strangely, his friend didn't seem to want to sit too close; as Jeremy moved to sit right next to Ethan his friend scooted a bit away with a quiet laugh. Jeremy shrugged and plopped down, resting his head against the cool wall at his back.

Jeremy tilted his head as Ethan briefly gave the ends of his shoes a squeeze and grimaced, muttering something about 'new shoes not being very bendy.' Weird.

"So Angela is about two inches taller than you?" Ethan asked as he tipped forward and reached past his toes.

Jeremy grunted an affirmative as he tried to reach as far as his friend. It seemed like every time he reached, Ethan somehow managed to flatten down a bit lower, to reach his fingers a bit further. The younger boy's expression was really focused, though Jeremy thought he shouldn't be so surprised that Ethan wanted to out-stretch him too. He suddenly lost concentration and jumped slightly, startled by an loud squeak as Ethan accidentally ruined his form, shifting himself and the heels of his new shoes forward on the waxed gym floor.

"It's not a big deal, girls are tall at our age. It shouldn't bother you so much." Jeremy muttered as he winced and relaxed his stretch.

"I'm not bothered." Ethan answered in a singsong voice as he leaned back too.

Jeremy looked over. After he accidentally scooted, Ethan must have slid a few inches away from the wall. Jeremy opened his mouth to mention it, but then he paused.

Ethan's back was firmly against the wall. His legs stretched out in front of him with his new shorts ending at knee length and the outlines of his big toes visibly poking at the end of his new shoes. As Jeremy scrambled up in shock, Ethan laughed and raised his hand, eyebrow quirked as he silently asked for a lift.

Gulping, Jeremy reached down and felt his friend's slightly larger hand close around the outside of his, and he staggered as he pulled up what felt like at least his own body weight. Ethan's amused expression only grew as he used Jeremy's boost to roll onto his feet, his shoes creaking slightly as he did. Jeremy gasped as his friend continued to rise taller and taller until he was staring forward at Ethan's smirking lips.

"You...you..." Jeremy stuttered.

Ethan offered a toothy grin from about three inches higher than Jeremy. Casually, he reached down and under the waist-level hem of his gym shirt and loosened the waist of his shorts with a quiet sigh of relief.

"I win."
1451212122.title: A Feat In Half A Day - A Day For Half A Foot

choices: When they get to Ethan's house, Ethan reveals his secret
Ethan does his best to keep Jeremy from finding out what's happening
Something unexpected happens on the way to Ethan's house.
14512121222.content:
Jeremy remained speechless as the class headed to the locker room to change. As he opened his locker and took off his gym shirt, he finally decided he had enough, and threw his shirt into the locker with some anger.

“Okay, you’ve got to tell me what is going on,” he finally said to Ethan, who was leaning against his own locker next to Jeremy’s. “Three days ago, you were a foot shorter than me. Now you’re the tallest kid in class. Nobody grows that fast.”

Ethan shrugged, his grin only growing wider. “Guess *I* do.”

Squinting, Jeremy examined his formerly diminutive friend from head to toe, looking for some telltale sign of how he was pulling this off. He indeed seemed to be filling out his new gym outfit more than he had at the beginning of class, and no longer looked like he was wearing clothes meant for someone two or three years older than him. Weirdly enough, his proportions didn’t seem to have changed all that much from when he was a foot shorter. He hadn’t gotten any lankier or bulkier or anything, just – bigger.

After a minute, Jeremy shook his head and sighed, grabbing his street clothes out of the locker and beginning to put them on. “And your parents and your doctor and everybody, they’re all just… fine with this?”

“They don’t have much of a choice.” Ethan said, his voice filled with obvious delight. “My parents didn’t seem to thrilled about having to buy me new clothes this morning, but I don’t think that’ll be a problem for much longer.”

“What do you mean?” Jeremy asked as he pulled his striped polo shirt over his head. “You said yesterday that you weren’t planning on stopping growing anytime soon.”

“Exactly!” Ethan’s eyes beamed as he leaned closer to his friend, bending over to get back to eye level with him. “Soon, there won’t be any clothes that’ll fit me!”

“So what, you’re going to just walk around bare-ass naked?”

“Might as well,” Ethan replied. “I don’t have anything to hide. And at that point, who’ll stop me?”

Ethan’s overflowing confidence was nothing new to Jeremy, but this was on a whole other level. Fully dressed, he stuffed his gym clothes in his bag, picked it up and slammed his locker shut. “Aren’t you going to change?”

Ethan shook his head. “This is the only outfit I have with me. Everything else is at home.”

“Home!” Jeremy’s eyes lit up, remembering the promise he had made to himself the previous day. “That reminds me, I’m spending the night at your house tonight. Tomorrow is a weekend; my parents won’t mind.”

“I don’t know about that, Jer,” Ethan scoffed. “I don’t want you to find out my big secrets.”

So there is something he’s hiding, Jeremy thought. “That’s exactly why I’m coming over,” Jeremy retorted. “Besides, we’re not competing anymore. You win.” For now.

Rolling his eyes, Ethan chuckled and nodded. “Fine, let’s go catch the bus.”
14512121222.title: After School

choices: Jeremy finds that he's a natural at this
Just as he thought, nothing happens
Jeremy grows, but not in the way he or Ethan expected
145121212221.content:
A half-hour later, the two boys had arrived at Ethan’s house, and headed straight up to his bedroom. As they entered, Jeremy noticed the pencil marks on the door, a visual indicator of just how much Ethan really had grown in just a few short days.

“Okay,” Jeremy said, throwing his backpack against the wall, “So how are you doing this?”

Ethan hesitated for a moment, then finally shed his reluctance. “Okay, fine, Jer. I’m only showing you this though because you’re my best friend.”

“Showing?” Jeremy repeated, but Ethan had already kicked off his shoes and begun peeling off his shirt and pants. Seeing each other in their underwear wasn’t anything new for the two friends, though Ethan’s now-larger frame seemed even more imposing now that he was half-naked.

“Okay, so it’s really simple.” Ethan walked over to the door frame and standing with his back to it, his hand holding a pencil right at the tip of his scalp. “All I have to do,” he said slowly and softly, “is to close my eyes… take a deep breath… and…”

His voice trailed off, and Jeremy started to wonder what he meant, until he saw it with his own eyes. Right in front of him, clear as day, Ethan’s body was stretching up and out. His socked feet spread out slightly against the hardwood floor, and the graphite of the pencil made a soft but audible scraping sound against the door frame.

For Jeremy the time seemed to move at a standstill as he gawked at his friend growing bigger, but in reality it was only a few seconds later when Ethan suddenly made a quick slashing motion with the pencil and turned around to look at his progress. “Wow, that’s a huge jump since last night!”

Indeed, Ethan was now noticeably taller than just a few minutes ago, and as Jeremy stepped closer in hushed awe, he realized he was now eye level with his friend’s chest. “H-how did you do that?” He finally breathed.

“I just told you,” Ethan said as he grabbed a measuring tape from the dresser near the door. “I close my eyes, take a deep breath and stretch. Wow, five-eleven! I bet I can break six feet by the end of the night!”

“Wait—how many times have you done this?”

“Well,” Ethan looked up as he thought, “Only once the first couple of nights. Three, four inches each time, I guess. It’s getting easier, though. Yesterday, I was able to do it twice, and I think I have three times in me today!”

“That’s impossible!” Jeremy leaned back against the bed, trying to make sense of what he was seeing and hearing.

“Oh yeah? Why don’t you give it a try? It would be interesting to add some challenge to this competition.”

Jeremy stared up at his friend quizzingly. “What?”

“C’mon, Jer,” Ethan egged him on. “Don’t you want to see what it’s like to be taller than any adults we know? Besides, what could it hurt?”

“It hurts my brain,” Jeremy said, shaking his head. “But fine, I’ll humor you.” Removing his shoes and then his pants, he finally pulled off his shirt, leaving him standing in his boxers and undershirt. “This feels really dumb.”

“Only for now,” Ethan said. “Go on, stand next to the door and do just as I said.”

Jeremy trudged over to the door, stood next to it, and closed his eyes. “Here goes nothing.”
145121212221.title: Secret Revealed

choices: Ethan tells him that the growth competition is back on, rebuking him.
Jeremy tries his best to try and alleviate the reckless Ethan.
Ethan surprisingly enough, decides to allow for a friendlier competition.
1451212122211.content:
He then took a deep breath and focused on getting taller, though internally he's not sure if that's even factually or physically possible, but yet there was clear proof that Ethan did this repeatably with each time he's getting more and more results each time now!

It was a few seconds of concentrating that before he decided to call it quits, he heard Ethan whisper to himself in amazement, "No way..." as Jeremy himself felt something actually, as he could feel his back sliding upwards against the door frame.

'Wait, its working?' He thought to himself in surprise, finding it easy to concentrate on the sensation of his growth as his shirt ridden up a bit higher as his boxers slowly fitted against his thighs.

Jeremy then opened his eyes as he huffed and puffed in exhaustion, the focusing taking a bit more than he thought out of him as he said in a bit startled tone, "Oh god...I didn't even think I could even pull it off honestly." Jeremy then turned around to Ethan to then notice a big difference, he wasn't staring at his Chest but more on level with halfway to his neck as he looked up at him.

"What the...how the heck you managed to get that much of a gain?" He questioned him with a frown on his face as he looked Jeremy over, basically looking the same as he usually does but like himself just...bigger really.

"Maybe I always was a natural and didn't realize it yet." Jeremy answered back a bit haughty, with a slight teasing smirk on his face, he could afford to be a little smug after all the crazy stuff that was happening, and he couldn't lie that getting around the size of his formerly pretty big friend was pretty nice after all.

Though the incredulous gaze of Ethan soon lightened up and then to Jeremy's slight concern, turned into a competitive glare as he soon found out that he didn't have this game in the bag as he thought.

"Okay Ethan lets try to think this through, me having the ability to grow doesn't mean anything right?" Jeremy asked him trying to defuse the situation as best as he could.
1451212122211.title: Jeremy finds that he's a natural at this

choices: Jeremy wins! Movie and a snack!
Ethan wins! Time to get playing!
It's a draw! They decide to talk some more.
1451212122212.content:
Jeremy stretched his body up, going up on his tip toes, grunting slightly, muscles standing out on his neck as he really, REALLY tried to will himself to grow, much to Ethan's amusement. After watching him grunt and struggle for a solid minute, Ethan placed his hand on Jeremy's head and forced him flat on his feet, his knees bending slightly. Jeremy was a bit shocked by the power his friend could now wield, opening his eyes and looking up at him. "You can't struggle like that Jer. You gotta relax, dude."

"Okay... okay fine." Jeremy muttered, taking a deep breath again, closing his eyes, his feet remaining flat on the floor as he willed himself to grow, to stretch taller, to close the gap even slightly between himself and Ethan. However, in the back of his mind, he couldn't quite manage to banish the thought of "This is so stupid. There's no way this is going to work."

After another minute of trying, Jeremy sighed, opening his eyes and lifting up his hands. "I can't do it."

"Huh... that's weird." Ethan said softly before shrugging. "Guess you just don't want it as much as I do!"

Jeremy felt a sting from those words, that dismissive shrug. Ethan nudged his friend aside, standing against the door frame with his pencil in hand again. "Here, watch me..."

Jeremy watched closely, wanting to see this in action again. He refused to blink, not wanting to miss a second of what was about to transpire. Ethan took a deep breath, shifting his stance slightly, his toes wiggling and gripping the carpet slightly. He leaned against the door frame, pressing the pencil against the top of his head.... and with a roll of his shoulders and a visible tensing of his muscles, he streeeeeetched up once again, his toes sliding across the carpet as his feet widened, his limbs stretched and filled out, his head inched upward, dragging the pencil with it, one, two, three more inches! Ethan sighed happily, slicing another mark with a flourish, opening his eyes and smirking down at his friend. "And that's how it's done!"

Jeremy's mouth dropped open in pure shock. He snatched the tape measure and held it against the mark, pushing Ethan out of the way. The now significantly taller kid took a few steps in the direction Jeremy pushed him, not because he was forced to, but because he wanted to. He watched Jeremy measure, already knowing the outcome. Sure enough, Jeremy related his findings, voice filled with awe, "Six feet...two inches."

"I knew I'd break six feet tonight!" Ethan said, stretching his arms up, his knuckles scraping against the ceiling. "Whoops! Getting a little bit too big for the room!"

He snickered as he indicated his body to Jeremy. "You don't mind me walking around like this, right Jer? Not like anything really fits me anymore."

Jeremy blushed slightly, turning his head. "Sure, whatever."

"I mean, I know you said you were going to have to keep an eye on me all night, so I might as well give you something nice to look at, right?" Ethan teasd, draping one long arm around his friend's neck, drawing him closer against his nearly naked, warm body. Ethan, competitive as he was, had a body that was to be envied. He wasn't bulky or overly muscular but his chest and arms had a nice definition to them, muscles swelled slightly from his athletic practices. His stomach was similarly defined, the light tracings of a six pack visible. Jeremy pushed against Ethan, but he was so solid it like was trying to push down a wall. A very warm, soft, wall...

Ethan chuckled and let go, loving how easy it was to overcome Jeremy. He suddenly lifted his friend up off the ground, his hands grabbing him just under his armpits, his feet dangling inches off the ground. "ETHAN! Knock it off! Put me DOWN!"

"Say please! Come on, be nice about it!" Ethan taunted, laughingly.

"PLEASE put me down you overgrown moron!" Jeremy spat, yelping slightly as Ethan dropped him in a heap on the floor. Before he could get up, Ethan pressed his bare foot against Jeremy's chest, pushing him down to the floor and pinning him. Jeremy was forced to gaze up a this formerly shorter friend, looming over him like a giant.

"How's the view down there, Jer? You'd better get used to it because soon enough this will be your new normal." Ethan said triumphantly, crossing his arms over his chest.

"Yeah, yeah, real impressive." Jeremy said dryly, grabbing Ethan's ankle, pushing against the foot. "Now let me up already!"

Ethan obeyed, stepping back, his friend rising to his feet once more. Looking around the room, Ethan loved how everything looked even smaller to him now. Ethan was practically brimming with energy, wanting to do SOMETHING with the high he felt from growing. "Come on Jeremy, how about a game? Or a contest? I gotta burn this off somehow!"

Jeremy noticed how Ethan was practically dancing from foot to foot, a small smile rising to his lips. "How about we just... I dunno, relax and watch a movie or something? You're too worked up as it is!"

"Screw that! You can't just waste the night sitting around!" Ethan insisted.

"It's not wasting it! It's just two friends having a relaxing night together! What's wrong with that?"

Ethan sighed theatrically, hands on his hips, looking up at the ceiling. After a bit, he looked back down, staring into Jeremy's eyes. "Okay... how about we leave this up to a competition then? Rock, paper, scissors?"

Jeremy rolled his eyes, but held out his fist. "Fine by me! You win, we'll do some kind of competition. I win, we watch a movie. Ready?"

"Whenever you are!" Ethan said, holding his own fist out.

"One...two...three!" Both shouted at the same time, throwing out their hands.
